ËÄå‰ªéÊï¥‰ΩìÁöÑ‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄBTCÂ§¥ÂØ∏Êï∞ÊçÆÊù•ÁúãÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂ÁõÆÂâçÊÄªÁöÑË∂ãÂäøÊù•ËØ¥ËøòÊòØ‰ª•Âê∏Á≠π‰∏∫‰∏ªÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂèØ‰ª•ÊòéÊòæÁöÑÁúãÂà∞ÔºåÂê∏Á≠πÈáèÂ∑≤ÁªèË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÂ∞ëÔºåËøô‰πüËØ¥ÊòéÂΩìÂâçÁöÑË¥≠‰π∞ÂäõÂá†‰πéËææÂà∞‰∫ÜÈ•±ÂíåÁöÑÁ®ãÂ∫¶ÔºåËÄåÈöèÁùÄÂê∏Á≠πÁöÑÂáèÂ∞ëÔºåÂøÖÁÑ∂‰ºöÈÄêÊ∏êÁöÑËΩ¨‰∏∫ÊäõÂîÆ‰∏∫‰∏ªÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÁõÆÂâç‰ªçÁÑ∂ÈúÄË¶ÅÊ†ºÂ§ñÁöÑÂ∞èÂøÉ„ÄÇ

ÈÄöËøáBTCÁöÑÊ∞∏Áª≠ÂêàÁ∫¶Êï∞ÊçÆÊù•ÁúãÔºåÁõÆÂâçÁöÑËµÑÈáëË¥πÁéáÂú®Â∫¶ËøáÂä†ÊÅØÂíåGDPÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂêéÂπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÂá∫Áé∞ÁúãÁ©∫ÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµÔºåÂèçËÄåÊòØÂä†Èáç‰∫ÜÁúãÂ§öÁöÑÊÉÖÁª™ÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÂú®Ëøô‰πãÂâçÁöÑÂ§öÁ©∫È¢ëÁπÅËΩ¨Êç¢Âá†‰πéÁúã‰∏çÂà∞‰∫Ü„ÄÇÂè¶Â§ñÂ∞±ÊòØ‰ªäÂ§©ÁöÑÊúüÊùÉ‰∫§Ââ≤Êù•ÁúãÔºåBTCÂá†‰πéÂ∞±ÊòØÊâìÂú®‰∫ÜÊúÄÂ§ßÁóõÁÇπ‰∏äÔºå‰ª∑Ê†ºÁöÑÂèòÂåñÂ∫îËØ•‰∏ç‰ºöÂ§™Â§ß‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

Áõ∏ÂØπ‰∫éÁõÆÂâçBTCÈÅáÂà∞ÁöÑÂéãÂäõÊù•ËØ¥ÔºåÂΩìÂâçETHÈÅáÂà∞ÁöÑÂéãÂäõË¶ÅÊõ¥Â§ßÔºåÂêàÂπ∂Á°ÆÂÆûÊòØÁõÆÂâçËÉΩÁúãÁöÑÂà∞ÁöÑÂú®2022Âπ¥ÂîØ‰∏ÄÁöÑÂè≤ËØóÁ∫ß‰∫ã‰ª∂ÔºåÂú®Êî∂Ëé∑Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑÂÖ≥Ê≥®ÂíåËµÑÈáëÂêéÔºåÂøÖÁÑ∂ÊòØÊúâÂ§ßÈáèÁöÑ‚ÄúÊäïÊú∫ÊÄß‚ÄùÁ≠πÁ†ÅÁöÑÂá∫Áé∞ÔºåËÄåÂú®ËøôÈÉ®ÂàÜÁöÑETHÊ≤°ÊúâÁ¶ªÂú∫ÂâçÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ËØ¥‰ª∑Ê†ºÊØè‰∏äÊ∂®‰∏ÄÁæéÈáëÔºåÊó•ÂêéÊâÄÈÅáÂà∞ÁöÑÂõ∞ÈöæÂ∞±‰ºöÂ§ö‰∏ÄÂàÜ„ÄÇ

‰ªéËøëÊó•ÁöÑËΩ¨ÂÖ•‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÁöÑÊäõÂéãÂíåËΩ¨Âá∫‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÁöÑÊèêÁé∞Êï∞ÊçÆÊù•ÁúãÔºåÂá†‰πéÊØèÂ§©ÈÉΩÂ≠òÂú®Â§ßÈáèETHÊªûÁïôÂú®‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÁöÑÁé∞Ë±°ÔºåËøôÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫ÈöèÁùÄ‰ª∑Ê†ºÁöÑ‰∏äÊ∂®ÔºåÂæàÂ§öÊäïËµÑËÄÖÂæàÊ∏ÖÊ•öÁõÆÂâç‰ªçÁÑ∂Â§Ñ‰∫éÁÜäÂ∏ÇÁöÑÈò∂ÊÆµÔºåÈù†ÊÉÖÁª™Âíå‰ø°ÊÅØÈù¢ÁöÑ‰∏äÊ∂®ÂøÖÁÑ∂‰ºöÊúâ‰∏ãË∑åÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂ§©ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÊèêÂâçÂüã‰ºèÂ•ΩÔºåÂÅöÂ•ΩÈöèÊó∂ÂèØ‰ª•Âá∫ÊâãÁöÑÂáÜÂ§áÊâçÊòØÊúÄÂÆâÂÖ®ÁöÑÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑÁ≠πÁ†ÅÈÉΩÈõÜ‰∏≠Âú®‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄ„ÄÇ

ËÄåÈöèÁùÄ‰ª∑Ê†ºÁöÑ‰∏äÊ∂®ÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂FOMOÁöÑÊÉÖÁª™ËøòÂú®Êâ©Â§ßÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÊõ¥Â§öÂ∑≤ÁªèË∏èÁ©∫ÁöÑÊäïËµÑËÄÖÔºåÂπ∂‰∏çÊï¢Âú®È´ò‰ΩçËøõÂú∫ÔºåÂèçËÄåÂºÄÂßãÁî®Â∞èÈ¢ù‰ΩÜÈ´òÊù†ÊùÜÁöÑÂêàÁ∫¶Êù•ÂºÄÂßãÂçöÂºàÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Áé∞Ë¥ßÁöÑË¥≠‰π∞ÂäõÂú®ÈÄêÊ∏êÁöÑ‰∏ãÈôçÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÈöèÁùÄÁæéÂÄ∫ÊÆñÂà©ÁéáÁöÑÊèêÂçáÔºåÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑËµÑÈáëÈÄâÊã©ËøõÂÖ•‰∫ÜÁæéÂÄ∫ÁöÑÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÔºåÂΩìÂâçÂ∏ÅÂ∏ÇÁöÑËµÑÈáë‰∏ç‰ΩÜÊ≤°ÊúâÂ¢ûÂä†ÔºåÂèçËÄåËøòÂú®ÂáèÂ∞ë„ÄÇËøô‰πüÊòØË¥≠‰π∞Âäõ‰∏çË∂≥ÁöÑË°®Áé∞„ÄÇ

‰ªéÊà™Ê≠¢Âà∞‰ªäÂ§©Êó©Êô®ÂÖ´ÁÇπÁöÑËµÑÈáëÊï∞ÊçÆÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂Áõ∏ÂØπÊò®Â§©USDTÂíåUSDCÁöÑËΩ¨ÂÖ•‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÁöÑËµÑÈáëÈáèÊúâÁ®çËÆ∏ÁöÑÊèêÂçáÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØËøôÁßçÊèêÂçáÂ¶ÇÊûúÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÂ∏¶Âä®Êï¥‰ΩìÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÁöÑ‰∏äË°åËøòÊòØÂ§™Â∞ëÂ§™Â∞ëÔºåËµÑÈáëÊÄªÈáèÁîöËá≥Ê≤°ÊúâËææÂà∞‰∏äÊ∂®Â¢ûÊ∂®ÊúüÁöÑÈ´òÂ∫¶ÔºåÂç≥‰æøÊòØÂú®Âë®ÂÜÖÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÊù•ËØ¥ÔºåÊú¨Âë®ÁöÑËµÑÈáëÈáè‰πüÊòØÂ±û‰∫éËøë‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúàÂÜÖÂû´Â∫ïÁöÑÁ®ãÂ∫¶„ÄÇ

ËÄåÊàë‰ª¨ÈÉΩÂ∫îËØ•ÂæàÊ∏ÖÊ•öÁöÑÁü•ÈÅìÔºåËµÑÈáëÊâçÊòØÂÜ≥ÂÆö‰∫é‰ª∑Ê†º‰∏äÊ∂®ËøòÊòØ‰∏ãË∑åÁöÑÂîØ‰∏Ä‰æùÊçÆÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúËµÑÈáëÈáèÂú®ÂáèÂ∞ëÔºåÈô§ÈùûÊòØÊäõÂéãÂá∫Áé∞Êõ¥Â§ßÂπÖÂ∫¶ÁöÑÈôç‰ΩéÔºåÊâçÊúâÂèØËÉΩÁª¥ÊåÅ‰∏äÂçáÁöÑÂäøÂ§¥ÔºåËÄåÁõÆÂâç‰∏çËÆ∫ÊòØBTCËøòÊòØETH‰ªéÊï¥‰ΩìÁöÑÊäõÂéãÊÉÖÂÜµÊù•ÁúãÔºå‰∏ç‰ΩÜÊ≤°ÊúâÂáèÂ∞ëÔºåÂèçËÄåËøòÊòØÂú®ÊåÅÁª≠Â¢ûÂä†ÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂Â¢ûÂä†ÁöÑÂ§ßÈÉ®ÂàÜÈÉΩÊòØÂΩìÂâçÁöÑ‰∫âÁ´Ø‰ª∑Ê†º‰∏ã„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÈÄöËøáÂØπÊØîÔºå‰æùÁÑ∂ÂèØ‰ª•ÊòéÊòæÁöÑÁúãÂà∞ÊäõÂéãÂíåËµÑÈáëÈáèÁöÑÊÇ¨ÊÆäÂ∑ÆË∑ùÔºå‰ªéÁõÆÂâçÁöÑÊï¥‰ΩìËµÑÈáëÈáèÊù•ËØ¥ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏çÊîØÊåÅÂ§ßËåÉÂõ¥ÁöÑËΩ¨ÂêëÊÉÖÂÜµÂèëÁîü„ÄÇËØ¥Âè•ÈöæÂê¨ÁöÑËØùÔºåÂè™Ë¶ÅËøôÈÉ®ÂàÜÂú®‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÁöÑÁ≠πÁ†ÅÊÉ≥‰∏çÂºÄÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂ÈÉΩÊúâÂ¥©ÁõòÁöÑÂç±Èô©ÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÂú®Âë®Êú´‰∏ªÂäõËµÑÈáëÂíå‰∏ªÂäõÊäõÂéãÈÉΩ‰∏çÂú®ÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ã„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•ÔºåÁé∞Ë¥ßËøòÂ•ΩÔºå‰ΩÜ‰ªçÁÑ∂Ë¶ÅÂ∞ùËØïÈôç‰ΩéÊù†ÊùÜÔºåËøúÁ¶ªÂêàÁ∫¶„ÄÇ

ÂΩìÁÑ∂‰πü‰∏çÈÉΩÊòØÂùèÊ∂àÊÅØÔºåÈöèÁùÄÊò®Â§©GDPÊï∞ÊçÆÁöÑÂÖ¨Â∏ÉÔºåÁî±‰∫éÊãÖÂøÉÁæéÂõΩÁªèÊµéÁöÑË°∞ÈÄÄÔºåÊ¨ßÂÖÉÂíåÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑÊ±áÁéáÊúâÁ®çËÆ∏ÁöÑÂõûÂçáÔºåÂú®Ê≠§Â∏¶Âä®‰∏ãÁæéÈáëÊåáÊï∞ÊåÅÁª≠‰∏ãË∑åÔºåÁõÆÂâçÂ∑≤ÁªèË∑åÁ†¥‰∫Ü106ÔºåËøô‰πü‰ª£Ë°®ÁùÄÁæéÈáëÁöÑ‚Äú‰ª∑ÂÄº‚ÄùÂú®‰∏ãË∑åÔºåÂΩìÂâçÁöÑDXYÂ∑≤ÁªèÈôç‰ΩéÂà∞‰∫Ü‰∏ÉÊúàÂàùÁöÑÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂèØ‰ª•Áª¥ÊåÅ‰∏ãÈôçÁöÑËØùÔºåÂ∞ÜÊúâÊú∫‰ºöÈáäÊîæÂá∫Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑËµÑÈáë„ÄÇ

ËÄåÁæéÂÄ∫ÁöÑÂ∏ÇÂú∫Âú®‰ªäÂ§©‰∏äÂçàÁü≠ÊöÇÁöÑ‰∏äÂçáÂêéÔºåÂèàÂºÄÂßãËøõÂÖ•Âà∞‰∫ÜÊÆñÂà©Áéá‰∏ãË∑åÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºåËøô‰πü‰ª£Ë°®ÁùÄÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑËµÑÈáëËøõÂÖ•‰∫ÜÁæéÂÄ∫ÁöÑÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÔºåÁîöËá≥Áé∞Âú®Â∏ÇÂú∫‰∏ä‰πüÂú®ÂºÄÂßãÁÇí‰ΩúÁæéÂÖÉËßÅÈ°∂ÁöÑ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåËøôÂØπ‰∫éÈ£éÈô©Â∏ÇÂú∫Êù•ËØ¥‰πüÊòØ‰∏Ä‰ª∂Â•Ω‰∫ã„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÁæéÂõΩ‰∫∫‰ºº‰πéÂØπËøôÊ¨°ÁöÑÁæéÂõΩÁªèÊµé‰∏çÊä±ÊúâÂπªÊÉ≥‰∫ÜÔºåÈô§ÈùûÊúâÊõ¥Âä†ÊòéÁ°ÆÁöÑÁæéËÅîÂÇ®ËΩ¨Âêë‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåÂê¶ÂàôÈÅáÂà∞ÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÂíåÂ∏ÅÂ∏ÇÂæàÁõ∏‰ºº„ÄÇ

Â∞§ÂÖ∂ÈúÄË¶ÅÊ≥®ÊÑèÁöÑÊòØÔºåÈªÑÈáëÁöÑ‰ª∑Ê†ºÂú®ÁæéÂõΩÁªèÊµéË°∞ÈÄÄÂíåÁæéÈáëËßÅÈ°∂ÁöÑÈ¢ÑÊúü‰∏ãÔºåÂºÄÂßãÂ§ßÂπÖÁöÑ‰∏äÊ∂®ÔºåËÄå‰πãÂâçÊàë‰ª¨‰πüËØ¥ËøáÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂ÈªÑÈáëÂíåÂ∏ÅÂ∏ÇÁöÑÂÖ≥Á≥ª‰∏çÊòØÂæàÂ§ßÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂèØ‰ª•Áúã‰ΩúÊòØÂ∏ÅÂ∏ÇÁöÑÂâçÂì®ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúËøûÈªÑÈáëÈÉΩÂú®ÁªèÊµé‰ΩúÁî®‰∏ãÊåÅÁª≠‰∏ãË∑åÔºåÈÇ£Â∞±Êõ¥Âà´ÊèêÊâÄË∞ìÁöÑ‚ÄúÊï∞Â≠óÈªÑÈáë‚Äù‰∫ÜÔºåËÄåÈªÑÈáëÁöÑ‰∏äÊ∂®Ê≠£Á¨¶Âêà‰∫ÜÁªèÊµéÂáèÁºìÔºåÁæéÈáë‚ÄúË¥¨ÂÄº‚Äù‰∏ãÔºåÊäïËµÑËÄÖÊÄùÁª¥‰∏äÁöÑËΩ¨Âèò„ÄÇ

title: How DAOs Can Avoid the Tyranny of Informal Structure
body:
*Author(s): MatterTurbulent#5161*

*Editor(s): chidi#5925*

*Last updated: 29th July 2022*


---

***[Green Pill](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmkdAgtxf3ah0Vmyy1B3OU8BPacX4_gVY) is a podcast geared toward audiences interested in harnessing web3 to improve society and preserve the environment. Kevin Owocki hosts the podcast, and many readers may know him as the founder of Gitcoin, an entity funding public goods in the crypto space. In [episode 12](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aqe8xel9hsA&list=PLmkdAgtxf3ah0Vmyy1B3OU8BPacX4_gVY&index=12), Kevin suggests an essay titled "[The Tyranny of Structurelessness](http://www.cooperatives-wales.coop/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/The-Tyranny-of-Structurelessness-Jo-Freeman.pdf)" should be fundamental reading for builders in Web3. So I read the essay, summarized the main points, and applied the ideas to DAOs.¬†***

![](https://blog.liquid.com/hubfs/DAO-%20Network.png)

### Structurelessness Summarized

Activist Jo Freeman published [The Tyranny of Structurelessness](http://www.cooperatives-wales.coop/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/The-Tyranny-of-Structurelessness-Jo-Freeman.pdf) in 1970 in response to her observations of the women's liberation movement. The author argues human coordination cannot (by definition!) be fully "structureless." Instead, cooperation among humans either exhibits a formal or informal structure.¬†

The informal structure will coalesce and control a social movement without a formal structure. Informal structures often consist of friends with similar demographics, aggressive or resourced individuals, but not necessarily those best suited to advance the movement. Informal structures instill backchannels and secret or implicit rules in the organization. Decisions may be based on furthering relationships among elites rather than furthering the organization. Worse, hidden decision-makers are not responsible to their group.¬†

If a group doesn't possess elected or established leaders, some "star" members may in practice function as representatives, but their unofficial status shields them from accountability. Additionally, if tasks are not clear and accessible to the whole group, the organization may lose energy, become ineffective, or see infighting. Group members may leave for more engaging and actionable organizations.

So what is the tyranny of structurelessness? Rejection of formal structure may mask the reality: an informal structure runs the group. Or the intentional avoidance of formal structure will leave a movement vulnerable to a powerful group taking over.¬†

### Applying the Lessons to DAOs

Freeman prescribes 7 principles ‚Äúessential to democratic structuring.‚Äù Here are my attempts to apply the theory to Web3 and DAOs:¬†

1. Instead of letting individuals choose roles by default, assigning roles via democratic processes (e.g., emoji voting/Snapshot/verbal consensus) holds the individual more accountable. What they're responsible for is clear to everyone. Although, at its early stages, a DAO environment might be "all hands on deck," boundaries are blurred, or only one person volunteers for a role. In this case, DAOs should still articulate role parameters in public places, along with the mechanism for contesting the positions.
2. Those with authority, such as DAO leaders or multisig governors, should be responsible for the organization. The mechanisms for enforcing responsibility could be election cycles, a fluid delegate system, or spaces for feedback like town halls or a complaint box.¬†

   I believe multisig governors should hold little decision-making power and execute the wishes of the community/voting body. Alternatively, DAOs could also use a veto model similar to the legislative process in the US, where the multisig can reject proposals with a supermajority. Still, the community can overthrow the veto by mustering its supermajority.¬†¬†
3. Authority should be distributed, such as among core members and community mods. This prevents a monopoly of power and requires and leverages consultation before decisions. Dividing labor consistently allows contributors to develop specialized skills, increasing efficiency.
4. Yet, Freeman also recommends rotating tasks among members. It‚Äôs a balance between giving members time to get good at a job (maybe a Guild/Team lead) and not letting the job become one person‚Äôs property. That dynamic could stifle organization growth or block new talent from upward mobility.¬†
5. Tasks should be allocated according to rational criteria rather than the contributor‚Äôs popularity. Criteria could come from written or verbal arguments about why the contributor is qualified, factoring in demonstrable experience, portfolio, or even POAP history.
6. Information flow should be diffused, not centralized, because information is power. DAOs should strive for transparency in their discussions, budgeting, and policy development. It‚Äôs best to minimize back-channeling.
7. DAO members should have equal access to resources. Bounty boards should be easily identified. Everyone should understand how to use tool subscriptions owned by the DAO. Experienced members should freely share, not hoard, their institutional knowledge. That way, DAOs can be a more meritocratic environment!¬†


---

### Afterword

I hope you enjoyed this short op-ed. Here is The Tyranny of Structurelessness by Jo Freeman. I recommend reading it. If you think of any other applications for DAOs, I‚Äôd love to hear them! Tweet me [@MatterTurbulent](https://twitter.com/MatterTurbulent).¬†

### ÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÂêàÊ≥ïÂêó?

ÊúâÂÖ≥ÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÁöÑÁõëÁÆ°Êñá‰ª∂‰∏ªË¶ÅÊúâ‰∏§‰∏™Ôºö

‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊòØÔºå„Ää‰∏≠ÂõΩ‰∫∫Ê∞ëÈì∂Ë°å Â∑•‰∏öÂíå‰ø°ÊÅØÂåñÈÉ® ‰∏≠ÂõΩÈì∂Ë°å‰∏öÁõëÁù£ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂßîÂëò‰ºö ‰∏≠ÂõΩËØÅÂà∏ÁõëÁù£ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂßîÂëò‰ºö ‰∏≠ÂõΩ‰øùÈô©ÁõëÁù£ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂßîÂëò‰ºöÂÖ≥‰∫éÈò≤ËåÉÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÈ£éÈô©ÁöÑÈÄöÁü•„Äã(Èì∂Âèë„Äî2013„Äï289Âè∑)„ÄÇ

Âè¶‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊòØÔºå„Ää‰∏≠ÂõΩ‰∫∫Ê∞ëÈì∂Ë°å ‰∏≠Â§ÆÁΩë‰ø°Âäû Â∑•‰∏öÂíå‰ø°ÊÅØÂåñÈÉ® Â∑•ÂïÜÊÄªÂ±Ä Èì∂Áõë‰ºö ËØÅÁõë‰ºö ‰øùÁõë‰ºöÂÖ≥‰∫éÈò≤ËåÉ‰ª£Â∏ÅÂèëË°åËûçËµÑÈ£éÈô©ÁöÑÂÖ¨Âëä„Äã„ÄÇ

Êñá‰ª∂‰∏≠ÊúâËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑË°®Ëø∞Ôºå‚ÄúÊØîÁâπÂ∏Å‰∫§Êòì‰Ωú‰∏∫‰∏ÄÁßç‰∫íËÅîÁΩë‰∏äÁöÑÂïÜÂìÅ‰π∞ÂçñË°å‰∏∫ÔºåÊôÆÈÄöÊ∞ë‰ºóÂú®Ëá™ÊãÖÈ£éÈô©ÁöÑÂâçÊèê‰∏ãÊã•ÊúâÂèÇ‰∏éÁöÑËá™Áî±„ÄÇ‚Äù‚Äú‰ª£Â∏ÅÂèëË°åËûçËµÑ‰∏é‰∫§ÊòìÂ≠òÂú®Â§öÈáçÈ£éÈô©ÔºåÂåÖÊã¨ËôöÂÅáËµÑ‰∫ßÈ£éÈô©„ÄÅÁªèËê•Â§±Ë¥•È£éÈô©„ÄÅÊäïËµÑÁÇí‰ΩúÈ£éÈô©Á≠âÔºåÊäïËµÑËÄÖÈ°ªËá™Ë°åÊâøÊãÖÊäïËµÑÈ£éÈô©ÔºåÂ∏åÊúõÂπøÂ§ßÊäïËµÑËÄÖË∞®Èò≤‰∏äÂΩìÂèóÈ™ó„ÄÇ‚Äù

‰ªéËøô‰∫õË°®Ëø∞ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂá∫ÔºåÊåÅÊúâÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÂπ∂‰∏çËøùÊ≥ïÔºåÂè™Ë¶Å‰Ω†Ëá™Â∑±ÊâøÊãÖÁõ∏Â∫îÁöÑÈ£éÈô©Â∞±ÂèØ‰ª•‰∫Ü„ÄÇÈ£éÈô©‰∏éÂõûÊä•ÈÉΩÊòØÊàêÊ≠£ÊØîÁöÑÔºåÈ´òÈ£éÈô©È´òÂõûÊä•ÔºåË∞®ÊÖéË¥≠‰π∞„ÄÇ

### Âú®ÂõΩÂÜÖÊØîÁâπÂ∏Å‰∫§ÊòìËøùÊ≥ïÂêó?

**ÊåÅÊúâÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÔºåÂú®ÊàëÂõΩ‰∏çËøùÊ≥ï**

2013Âπ¥12ÊúàÔºåÊ†πÊçÆ„ÄäÂÖ≥‰∫éÈò≤ËåÉÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÈ£éÈô©ÁöÑÈÄöÁü•„ÄãÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßç‚ÄúÁâπÂÆöÁöÑËôöÊãüÂïÜÂìÅ‚ÄùÔºå‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØËØ¥ÔºåÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅË¢´ÂΩìÂÅö‚ÄúÂïÜÂìÅ‚ÄùÔºåÊó¢ÁÑ∂ÊòØÂïÜÂìÅÔºåÊó†ËÆ∫ÊòØÂê¶ÊúâÂΩ¢ÔºåÂú®Ê≥ïÂæã‰∏äÊàë‰ª¨ÈÉΩËßÜ‰∏∫ÔºöÁâ©„ÄÇ

Âú®ÊàëÂõΩÂ¢ÉÂÜÖÊåÅÊúâËøôÁßçÊó†ÂΩ¢ÁöÑËôöÊãüÁöÑ‚ÄúÁâ©‚ÄùÔºåÂπ∂‰∏çËøùÊ≥ï„ÄÇ

Âõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊàëÂõΩÂ±ÖÊ∞ëÊåÅÊúâÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÊòØÂêàÊ≥ïÁöÑ„ÄÇÂÅ∂ÂèëÁöÑOTCÂú∫Â§ñ‰∫§ÊòìÔºå‰πüÊòØË¢´ÂÆπËÆ∏ÁöÑÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËÆ§‰∏∫ÂêàÂêåÊ≥ïÂ∫îÂΩì‰øùÊä§„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÂØπ‰∫éÈ¢ëÂèëÁöÑ‰∫§ÊòìË°å‰∏∫ÔºåÊ≥ïÂæãÁöÑËØÑ‰ª∑ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂèëÁîüÂèòÂåñ„ÄÇÁõÆÂâçÔºåÂØπ‰∫éËôöÊãüË¥ßÂ∏Å‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÔºåÊàëÂõΩËá™2017Âπ¥9Êúà4Êó•‰πãÂêéÂ∑≤ÁªèË°®Êòé‰∫ÜÂèçÂØπÊÄÅÂ∫¶„ÄÇ

Â∏ÇÈù¢‰∏äÔºåËßÑÊ®°ËæÉÂ§ßÁöÑ‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÈÉΩÈÄêÊ∏êÊ∑°Âá∫ÂõΩÂÜÖÂ∏ÇÂú∫Ôºå‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜ‰∏úÊ∏°Êó•Êú¨Ôºå‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜ‰∏ã‰∫ÜÂçóÊ¥ãÔºåÂΩìÁÑ∂ÔºåÈöèÁùÄ11ÊúàÂàùÈ¶ôÊ∏ØÂú∞Âå∫Êñ∞ËßÑÁöÑÂèëÂ∏ÉÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Áõ∏‰ø°ÔºåÊú™Êù•ËôöÊãüÂ∏Å‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂú®È¶ôÊ∏ØÂú∞Âå∫ÂèñÂæóÂêàÊ≥ïÁâåÁÖßÔºå‰∏∫ÂΩìÂú∞Êú∫ÊûÑÊäïËµÑËÄÖÁ≠âËøõË°åÊúçÂä°„ÄÇ

body:
*July 28, 2022*

Èö®ËëóBTCÂÉπÊ†ºÂíåÂÇ≥Áµ±ÈáëËûçË≥áÁî¢ÈóúËÅØÂ∫¶‰∏äÂçáÔºåÂπ£ÂúàË∂ä‰æÜË∂äÂ§ö‰∫∫Âú®Ë®éË´ñÂÆèËßÄÁ∂ìÊøüËµ∞Âêë„ÄÇÊàëÁúãÂà∞Â∏ÇÂ†¥‰∏äÂæàÂ§öÔºàÂú®È¶ôÊ∏ØÁöÑÔºâÂàÜÊûêÂ∏´ÈÉΩÊääÂÆèËßÄÁ∂ìÊøüÂíåÂÉπÊ†ºÁöÑÈÇèËºØË™¨ÂæóÈÅéÊñºÁ∞°ÂñÆÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÊÉ≥ÂÄºÈÄôÊ©üÊúÉÁÇ∫Â§ßÂÆ∂ÂæûÂ∞çÂÜ≤Âü∫ÈáëÁöÑËßíÂ∫¶Ëß£Ë™¨ÂÆèËßÄÁ∂ìÊøüÂíåË≥áÁî¢ÂÉπÊ†ºÁöÑÈóú‰øÇ„ÄÇ

È¶ñÂÖàÂ§ßÂÆ∂Ë¶Å‰∫ÜËß£Â∏ÇÂ†¥ÈÉΩÊòØÂ∞çÈ†êÊúüÈÄ≤Ë°å‰∫§ÊòìÊ±∫Á≠ñÔºåËÄåÊàëÂÄëË¶Å‰∫ÜËß£Á©∂Á´üÂ∏ÇÂ†¥Â∞ç‰ªÄÈ∫ΩÂèÉÊï∏‰ΩúÂá∫‰º∞Ë®àÂë¢„ÄÇ

**ÁæéÂúãÂíåÊ≠êÊ¥≤ÁöÑCPI, Core CPIÂíåÊ≤πÂÉπ**

Áî±ÊñºËÅØÂÑ≤‰æ∑ÔºàFEDÔºâÈÉΩÊòØÁúãÈÄöËÑπÂíåÁ∂ìÊøüÁî¢Âá∫‰ΩúÂä†ÊÅØÊåáÊ®ôÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•‰∏çËÉΩ‰∏çÊèêÁöÑÊòØÈÄöËÑπÊåáÊ®ôCPI„ÄÇÂ∏ÇÂ†¥Êúâ‰∫õNarrativeÁ∂ìÂ∏∏ÊääCPIÂíåÂä†ÊÅØÁ∂ÅÊû∂Âú®‰∏ÄËµ∑Ôºå‰ΩÜÈ¶ñÂÖàÊàëÂÄëË¶ÅÊòéÁôΩCPI‰∏äÂçáÊàêÂõ†ÂíåÂä†ÊÅØÁöÑÁµêÊûúÔºåÁµï‰∏çËÉΩÊää‰∏≠Â≠∏Á∂ìÊøüÊõ∏ÁöÑÁêÜË´ñÁõ¥Â•ó‰∏äÂéª„ÄÇ‰ªäÂπ¥‰∏äÂçäÂπ¥CPIÂ§ßÂπÖÂ∫¶‰∏äÂçáÊòØÁî±Êñº‰øÑÁÉèÊà∞Áà≠Â∞éËá¥Ê≤πÂÉπ‰∏äÂçá„ÄÇÂ∏ÇÂ†¥ÂÖ∂ÂØ¶Êó©Âú®‰∏ÄÊúàÂ∑≤Á∂ìÈ†êË®àÊà∞‰∫ãÊúÉÁôºÁîüÔºåËÄåÊ≤πÂÉπÁî±‰∏ÄÊúàËá≥ÂÖ≠Êúà‰∫îËôüÈ†ÇÈªû‰∏äÂçá‰∫Ü55%„ÄÇFEDËÉΩÂÅöÁöÑÈùûÂ∏∏ÊúâÈôêÔºåÂõ†Áà≤CPI‰∏äÂçá‰∏ªÂõ†Âπ∂ÈùûÁî±Ë≥áÁî¢ÂÉπÊ†ºÂíåÊ∂àË≤ªÈÅéÊ∏°Â∞éËá¥ÁöÑÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÊúüÊúõÊÅØÂè£‰∏äÂçáËÆìCPIÂ£ì‰∏ã‰æÜÊòØ‰∏çÁèæÂØ¶ÁöÑ„ÄÇÁæéÂúãÈ°ßÂïèÂúò‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÈÉΩÁü•ÈÅìË¶ÅÂ£ìÂà∂Ê≤πÂÉπ‰∏äÂçáÔºåÁÑ∂ËÄåËøëÊúüÁöÑÊ≤ôÁâπÂ§ñË®™ÂíåUAEÊîøÊ¨äÈÅéÂ∫¶ÁöÑÂ§ñ‰∫§ÂΩ±ÈüøÁöÑÁ¢∫ËÆìÊ≤πÂÉπÈÅîÈ†ÇÈªûÂõûËêΩ„ÄÇÁèæÊôÇÊçÆÂ∏ÇÂ†¥È†êÊúüÁöÑ‰øÑÁÉèÊà∞‰∫ãÁôºÂ±ïÔºåÊ≤πÂÉπÈõñÁÑ∂‰∏çÂ§™ÂèØËÉΩÂÜçÁ™ÅÁ†¥ÂÖ≠ÊúàÈ†ÇÈªûÔºå‰ΩÜÁµïÂ§ßÊ©üÊúÉÊúÉÂæòÂæäÂú®È´òÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÔºåÂä†‰∏äÁæéÂúãÂíåÊ≠êÊ¥≤ÈÇÑË¶ÅÂà∞ÈÅé‰∏ÄÂÄãÂÜ¨Â§©ÔºåËÉΩÊ∫êÈúÄÊ±ÇÈÇÑÊúâ‰∏ÄÈóúË¶ÅÈÅéÔºåCPIÂú®‰ªäÂπ¥ÂÜÖÊàñÊòéÂπ¥Âπ¥ÂàùÈÉΩÂõûÂéªFEDÁöÑ3%Ê®ôÊ∫ñÊòØ‰∏çÂ§™ÂèØËÉΩÁöÑ„ÄÇÁÑ∂ËÄåÔºåÂè¶‰∏ÄÊåáÊ®ôCore CPIÔºàÈô§ÂéªËÉΩÊ∫êÂíåÈ£üÂìÅÔºâÂâáÂ∑≤Á∂ìÈÄ£Á∫å4Êúà‰∏ãË∑åÔºåË™¨Êòé‰∫Ü1.ÔºâÊ∂àË≤ªËÄÖÈñãÂßãÊÑüÂèóÂà∞ÈÄöËÑπÁöÑÂà∫ÁóõÂíå2.ÔºâÊ∏õÂ∞ëÊ∂àË≤ªÈö®Âç≥Â∏∂‰æÜÁöÑÁ∂ìÊøüË°∞ÈÄÄÔºåÈÄô‰πüÊòØFEDÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÁöÑÈ†êÊúüÁµêÊûú„ÄÇ

**È´òËÉΩÊ∫êÂÉπÊ†ºÂíåGDP**

Â∏ÇÂ†¥‰∏äÊúÄËøëË®éË´ñÁöÑÁ∂ìÊøüË°∞ÈÄÄÔºàRecessionÔºâË´ñÁ©∂Á´üÊòØ‰ªÄÈ∫ΩÔºüÈõñÁÑ∂Ê≤πÂÉπËøëÊúüÂõûËêΩÔºå‰ΩÜÂ∞§ÂÖ∂Âú®Ê≠êÊ¥≤Ôºå‰ªñÂÄëÂú®ÂÜ¨Â§©ÁöÑËÉΩÊ∫êÈúÄÊ±ÇÊúÉÊØîÁæéÂúãÊòéÈ°Ø‰∏äÂçáÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÊàëÂÄëËÉΩÈ†êÊúüÂπ¥Â∫ïÊ≠êÊ¥≤ÁöÑCPIÈÉΩ‰∏çÊúÉÊúâÊòéÈ°ØÁöÑ‰∏ãË∑å„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÂä†ÊÅØÂπÖÂ∫¶Â§ßÔºåÂä†‰∏äCore CPIÊÖ¢ÊÖ¢Âêë‰∏ãÔºåÂØ¶ÈöõÈÄöË≤®ËÜ®ËÑπÔºàReal InflationÔºâÂ∞±ÊúÉÂæàÂÆπÊòìËÆäÁà≤Ë≤†Êï∏Ôºå‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØÊâÄË¨ÇÁöÑÈÄöÁ∏Æ„ÄÇÂúãÂÜÖÁ∂ìÊøüÊàêÊú¨Â§ßÂπÖÂ¢ûÂä†ÔºåÈùûËÉΩÊ∫ê‰ºÅÊ•≠ÁöÑÁõàÂà©ÊúÉÈ¶ñÁï∂ÂÖ∂Ë°ùÂèóÂà∞ÂΩ±ÈüøÔºåË≥áÈáëÈáè‰ΩéÁöÑ‰ºÅÊ•≠Â∞±ÊúÉÊúâÊΩõÂú®Ê≠êÂÇµÂç±Ê©üÁöÑÁøªÁâàÔºå‰πüÊòØÁà≤‰ªÄÈ∫ΩÂæàÂ§öÊ≠êÊ¥≤ÂúãÂÆ∂ÂµåÂÖ•‰∫ÜÂÖ©Èõ£ÁöÑÂ±ÄÈù¢ÔºåÊó¢Ë¶Å‰øùÊåÅÊîøÊ≤ªÊ≠£Á¢∫Ôºå‰πüË¶Å‰øùÁ∂ìÊøü„ÄÇÂÄã‰∫∫Ë™çÁà≤ÁæéÂúãÈÄ≤ÂÖ•ÁµêÊßãÊÄßË°∞ÈÄÄÔºàUnemployment rate‰∏äÂçáÔºåË≤†CPIÔºâÁöÑÊ©üÁéáÊòØÂæà‰ΩéÁöÑÔºå‰∏ÄÊòØÂõ†Áà≤ÂàÜÊûêÂ∏´Â∑≤Á∂ìÊääÂ§ßÈÉ®ÂàÜÁöÑ‰ºÅÊ•≠ÁõàÂà©È†êÊúüË™ø‰ΩéÔºåËÆäÁõ∏‰ºÅÊ•≠Âè™ÈúÄÈÅîÂà∞‰∏ÄÂÄãËºÉ‰ΩéÁöÑÁõàÂà©Â∞±Â∑≤Á∂ìÊòØÊ≠£ÂêëÊ∂àÊÅØÔºå‰∫åÊòØÁæéÂúãÂú®ÂúãÈöõÁöÑÊîøÊ≤ªÂΩ±ÈüøÂ∞çÊñºÊ≤πÂÉπÁöÑÊéßÂà∂ÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏ÊúâÁ∂ìÈ©ó„ÄÇ

title: How DAOs Can Avoid the Tyranny of Informal Structure
body:
*Author(s): MatterTurbulent#5161*

*Editor(s): chidi#5925*

*Last updated: 29th July 2022*


---

***[Green Pill](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmkdAgtxf3ah0Vmyy1B3OU8BPacX4_gVY) is a podcast geared toward audiences interested in harnessing web3 to improve society and preserve the environment. Kevin Owocki hosts the podcast, and many readers may know him as the founder of Gitcoin, an entity funding public goods in the crypto space. In [episode 12](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aqe8xel9hsA&list=PLmkdAgtxf3ah0Vmyy1B3OU8BPacX4_gVY&index=12), Kevin suggests an essay titled "[The Tyranny of Structurelessness](http://www.cooperatives-wales.coop/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/The-Tyranny-of-Structurelessness-Jo-Freeman.pdf)" should be fundamental reading for builders in Web3. So I read the essay, summarized the main points, and applied the ideas to DAOs.¬†***

![](https://blog.liquid.com/hubfs/DAO-%20Network.png)

### Structurelessness Summarized

Activist Jo Freeman published [The Tyranny of Structurelessness](http://www.cooperatives-wales.coop/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/The-Tyranny-of-Structurelessness-Jo-Freeman.pdf) in 1970 in response to her observations of the women's liberation movement. The author argues human coordination cannot (by definition!) be fully "structureless." Instead, cooperation among humans either exhibits a formal or informal structure.¬†

The informal structure will coalesce and control a social movement without a formal structure. Informal structures often consist of friends with similar demographics, aggressive or resourced individuals, but not necessarily those best suited to advance the movement. Informal structures instill backchannels and secret or implicit rules in the organization. Decisions may be based on furthering relationships among elites rather than furthering the organization. Worse, hidden decision-makers are not responsible to their group.¬†

If a group doesn't possess elected or established leaders, some "star" members may in practice function as representatives, but their unofficial status shields them from accountability. Additionally, if tasks are not clear and accessible to the whole group, the organization may lose energy, become ineffective, or see infighting. Group members may leave for more engaging and actionable organizations.

So what is the tyranny of structurelessness? Rejection of formal structure may mask the reality: an informal structure runs the group. Or the intentional avoidance of formal structure will leave a movement vulnerable to a powerful group taking over.¬†

### Applying the Lessons to DAOs

Freeman prescribes 7 principles ‚Äúessential to democratic structuring.‚Äù Here are my attempts to apply the theory to Web3 and DAOs:¬†

1. Instead of letting individuals choose roles by default, assigning roles via democratic processes (e.g., emoji voting/Snapshot/verbal consensus) holds the individual more accountable. What they're responsible for is clear to everyone. Although, at its early stages, a DAO environment might be "all hands on deck," boundaries are blurred, or only one person volunteers for a role. In this case, DAOs should still articulate role parameters in public places, along with the mechanism for contesting the positions.
2. Those with authority, such as DAO leaders or multisig governors, should be responsible for the organization. The mechanisms for enforcing responsibility could be election cycles, a fluid delegate system, or spaces for feedback like town halls or a complaint box.¬†

   I believe multisig governors should hold little decision-making power and execute the wishes of the community/voting body. Alternatively, DAOs could also use a veto model similar to the legislative process in the US, where the multisig can reject proposals with a supermajority. Still, the community can overthrow the veto by mustering its supermajority.¬†¬†
3. Authority should be distributed, such as among core members and community mods. This prevents a monopoly of power and requires and leverages consultation before decisions. Dividing labor consistently allows contributors to develop specialized skills, increasing efficiency.
4. Yet, Freeman also recommends rotating tasks among members. It‚Äôs a balance between giving members time to get good at a job (maybe a Guild/Team lead) and not letting the job become one person‚Äôs property. That dynamic could stifle organization growth or block new talent from upward mobility.¬†
5. Tasks should be allocated according to rational criteria rather than the contributor‚Äôs popularity. Criteria could come from written or verbal arguments about why the contributor is qualified, factoring in demonstrable experience, portfolio, or even POAP history.
6. Information flow should be diffused, not centralized, because information is power. DAOs should strive for transparency in their discussions, budgeting, and policy development. It‚Äôs best to minimize back-channeling.
7. DAO members should have equal access to resources. Bounty boards should be easily identified. Everyone should understand how to use tool subscriptions owned by the DAO. Experienced members should freely share, not hoard, their institutional knowledge. That way, DAOs can be a more meritocratic environment!¬†


---

### Afterword

I hope you enjoyed this short op-ed. Here is The Tyranny of Structurelessness by Jo Freeman. I recommend reading it. If you think of any other applications for DAOs, I‚Äôd love to hear them! Tweet me [@MatterTurbulent](https://twitter.com/MatterTurbulent).¬†

Áî±ÊñºËÅØÂÑ≤‰æ∑ÔºàFEDÔºâÈÉΩÊòØÁúãÈÄöËÑπÂíåÁ∂ìÊøüÁî¢Âá∫‰ΩúÂä†ÊÅØÊåáÊ®ôÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•‰∏çËÉΩ‰∏çÊèêÁöÑÊòØÈÄöËÑπÊåáÊ®ôCPI„ÄÇÂ∏ÇÂ†¥Êúâ‰∫õNarrativeÁ∂ìÂ∏∏ÊääCPIÂíåÂä†ÊÅØÁ∂ÅÊû∂Âú®‰∏ÄËµ∑Ôºå‰ΩÜÈ¶ñÂÖàÊàëÂÄëË¶ÅÊòéÁôΩCPI‰∏äÂçáÊàêÂõ†ÂíåÂä†ÊÅØÁöÑÁµêÊûúÔºåÁµï‰∏çËÉΩÊää‰∏≠Â≠∏Á∂ìÊøüÊõ∏ÁöÑÁêÜË´ñÁõ¥Â•ó‰∏äÂéª„ÄÇ‰ªäÂπ¥‰∏äÂçäÂπ¥CPIÂ§ßÂπÖÂ∫¶‰∏äÂçáÊòØÁî±Êñº‰øÑÁÉèÊà∞Áà≠Â∞éËá¥Ê≤πÂÉπ‰∏äÂçá„ÄÇÂ∏ÇÂ†¥ÂÖ∂ÂØ¶Êó©Âú®‰∏ÄÊúàÂ∑≤Á∂ìÈ†êË®àÊà∞‰∫ãÊúÉÁôºÁîüÔºåËÄåÊ≤πÂÉπÁî±‰∏ÄÊúàËá≥ÂÖ≠Êúà‰∫îËôüÈ†ÇÈªû‰∏äÂçá‰∫Ü55%„ÄÇFEDËÉΩÂÅöÁöÑÈùûÂ∏∏ÊúâÈôêÔºåÂõ†Áà≤CPI‰∏äÂçá‰∏ªÂõ†Âπ∂ÈùûÁî±Ë≥áÁî¢ÂÉπÊ†ºÂíåÊ∂àË≤ªÈÅéÊ∏°Â∞éËá¥ÁöÑÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÊúüÊúõÊÅØÂè£‰∏äÂçáËÆìCPIÂ£ì‰∏ã‰æÜÊòØ‰∏çÁèæÂØ¶ÁöÑ„ÄÇÁæéÂúãÈ°ßÂïèÂúò‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÈÉΩÁü•ÈÅìË¶ÅÂ£ìÂà∂Ê≤πÂÉπ‰∏äÂçáÔºåÁÑ∂ËÄåËøëÊúüÁöÑÊ≤ôÁâπÂ§ñË®™ÂíåUAEÊîøÊ¨äÈÅéÂ∫¶ÁöÑÂ§ñ‰∫§ÂΩ±ÈüøÁöÑÁ¢∫ËÆìÊ≤πÂÉπÈÅîÈ†ÇÈªûÂõûËêΩ„ÄÇÁèæÊôÇÊçÆÂ∏ÇÂ†¥È†êÊúüÁöÑ‰øÑÁÉèÊà∞‰∫ãÁôºÂ±ïÔºåÊ≤πÂÉπÈõñÁÑ∂‰∏çÂ§™ÂèØËÉΩÂÜçÁ™ÅÁ†¥ÂÖ≠ÊúàÈ†ÇÈªûÔºå‰ΩÜÁµïÂ§ßÊ©üÊúÉÊúÉÂæòÂæäÂú®È´òÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÔºåÂä†‰∏äÁæéÂúãÂíåÊ≠êÊ¥≤ÈÇÑË¶ÅÂà∞ÈÅé‰∏ÄÂÄãÂÜ¨Â§©ÔºåËÉΩÊ∫êÈúÄÊ±ÇÈÇÑÊúâ‰∏ÄÈóúË¶ÅÈÅéÔºåCPIÂú®‰ªäÂπ¥ÂÜÖÊàñÊòéÂπ¥Âπ¥ÂàùÈÉΩÂõûÂéªFEDÁöÑ3%Ê®ôÊ∫ñÊòØ‰∏çÂ§™ÂèØËÉΩÁöÑ„ÄÇÁÑ∂ËÄåÔºåÂè¶‰∏ÄÊåáÊ®ôCore CPIÔºàÈô§ÂéªËÉΩÊ∫êÂíåÈ£üÂìÅÔºâÂâáÂ∑≤Á∂ìÈÄ£Á∫å4Êúà‰∏ãË∑åÔºåË™¨Êòé‰∫Ü1.ÔºâÊ∂àË≤ªËÄÖÈñãÂßãÊÑüÂèóÂà∞ÈÄöËÑπÁöÑÂà∫ÁóõÂíå2.ÔºâÊ∏õÂ∞ëÊ∂àË≤ªÈö®Âç≥Â∏∂‰æÜÁöÑÁ∂ìÊøüË°∞ÈÄÄÔºåÈÄô‰πüÊòØFEDÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÁöÑÈ†êÊúüÁµêÊûú„ÄÇ

Èö®ËëóBTCÂÉπÊ†ºÂíåÂÇ≥Áµ±ÈáëËûçË≥áÁî¢ÈóúËÅØÂ∫¶‰∏äÂçáÔºåÂπ£ÂúàË∂ä‰æÜË∂äÂ§ö‰∫∫Âú®Ë®éË´ñÂÆèËßÄÁ∂ìÊøüËµ∞Âêë„ÄÇÊàëÁúãÂà∞Â∏ÇÂ†¥‰∏äÂæàÂ§öÔºàÂú®È¶ôÊ∏ØÁöÑÔºâÂàÜÊûêÂ∏´ÈÉΩÊääÂÆèËßÄÁ∂ìÊøüÂíåÂÉπÊ†ºÁöÑÈÇèËºØË™¨ÂæóÈÅéÊñºÁ∞°ÂñÆÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÊÉ≥ÂÄºÈÄôÊ©üÊúÉÁÇ∫Â§ßÂÆ∂ÂæûÂ∞çÂÜ≤Âü∫ÈáëÁöÑËßíÂ∫¶Ëß£Ë™¨ÂÆèËßÄÁ∂ìÊøüÂíåË≥áÁî¢ÂÉπÊ†ºÁöÑÈóú‰øÇ„ÄÇ

title: How DAOs Can Avoid the Tyranny of Informal Structure
body:
*Author(s): MatterTurbulent#5161*

*Editor(s): chidi#5925*

*Last updated: 29th July 2022*


---

*[Green Pill](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmkdAgtxf3ah0Vmyy1B3OU8BPacX4_gVY) is a podcast geared toward audiences interested in harnessing web3 to improve society and preserve the environment. [Kevin Owocki](https://twitter.com/owocki) hosts the podcast, and many readers may know him as the founder of Gitcoin, an entity funding public goods in the crypto space. In [episode 12](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aqe8xel9hsA&list=PLmkdAgtxf3ah0Vmyy1B3OU8BPacX4_gVY&index=12), Kevin suggests an essay titled "[The Tyranny of Structurelessness](http://www.cooperatives-wales.coop/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/The-Tyranny-of-Structurelessness-Jo-Freeman.pdf)" should be fundamental reading for builders in Web3. So I read the essay, summarized the main points, and applied the ideas to DAOs.*

![](https://blog.liquid.com/hubfs/DAO-%20Network.png)

### Structurelessness Summarized

Activist Jo Freeman published [The Tyranny of Structurelessness](http://www.cooperatives-wales.coop/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/The-Tyranny-of-Structurelessness-Jo-Freeman.pdf) in 1970 in response to her observations of the women's liberation movement. The author argues human coordination cannot (by definition!) be fully "structureless." Instead, cooperation among humans either exhibits a formal or informal structure.

The informal structure will coalesce and control a social movement without a formal structure. Informal structures often consist of friends with similar demographics, aggressive or resourced individuals, but not necessarily those best suited to advance the movement. Informal structures instill backchannels and secret or implicit rules in the organization. Decisions may be based on furthering relationships among elites rather than furthering the organization. Worse, hidden decision-makers are not responsible to their group.

If a group doesn't possess elected or established leaders, some "star" members may in practice function as representatives, but their unofficial status shields them from accountability. Additionally, if tasks are not clear and accessible to the whole group, the organization may lose energy, become ineffective, or see infighting. Group members may leave for more engaging and actionable organizations.

So what is the tyranny of structurelessness? Rejection of formal structure may mask the reality: an informal structure runs the group. Or the intentional avoidance of formal structure will leave a movement vulnerable to a powerful group taking over.

### Applying the Lessons to DAOs

Freeman prescribes 7 principles ‚Äúessential to democratic structuring.‚Äù Here are my attempts to apply the theory to Web3 and DAOs:

1. Instead of letting individuals choose roles by default, assigning roles via democratic processes (e.g., emoji voting/Snapshot/verbal consensus) holds the individual more accountable. What they're responsible for is clear to everyone. Although, at its early stages, a DAO environment might be "all hands on deck," boundaries are blurred, or only one person volunteers for a role. In this case, DAOs should still articulate role parameters in public places, along with the mechanism for contesting the positions.
2. Those with authority, such as DAO leaders or multisig governors, should be responsible for the organization. The mechanisms for enforcing responsibility could be election cycles, a fluid delegate system, or spaces for feedback like town halls or a complaint box.

   I believe multisig governors should hold little decision-making power and execute the wishes of the community/voting body. Alternatively, DAOs could also use a veto model similar to the legislative process in the US, where the multisig can reject proposals with a supermajority. Still, the community can overthrow the veto by mustering its supermajority.
3. Authority should be distributed, such as among core members and community mods. This prevents a monopoly of power and requires and leverages consultation before decisions. Dividing labor consistently allows contributors to develop specialized skills, increasing efficiency.
4. Yet, Freeman also recommends rotating tasks among members. It‚Äôs a balance between giving members time to get good at a job (maybe a Guild/Team lead) and not letting the job become one person‚Äôs property. That dynamic could stifle organization growth or block new talent from upward mobility.
5. Tasks should be allocated according to rational criteria rather than the contributor‚Äôs popularity. Criteria could come from written or verbal arguments about why the contributor is qualified, factoring in demonstrable experience, portfolio, or even POAP history.
6. Information flow should be diffused, not centralized, because information is power. DAOs should strive for transparency in their discussions, budgeting, and policy development. It‚Äôs best to minimize back-channeling.
7. DAO members should have equal access to resources. Bounty boards should be easily identified. Everyone should understand how to use tool subscriptions owned by the DAO. Experienced members should freely share, not hoard, their institutional knowledge. That way, DAOs can be a more meritocratic environment!


---

### Afterword

I hope you enjoyed this short op-ed. Here is The Tyranny of Structurelessness by Jo Freeman. I recommend reading it. If you think of any other applications for DAOs, I‚Äôd love to hear them! Tweet me [@MatterTurbulent](https://twitter.com/MatterTurbulent).

title: Gresham‚Äôs law
body: Gresham‚Äôs law prevails: bad quality money drives out good quality money from circulation as the former is used as a means of exchange, while the latter is used in the function of store of value.

title: NFTÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÔºåÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰π∞ÂçñNFTÔºü
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/q1NVAnZhD6qE86ktOMaFB.png?height=900&width=1600)

**NFTÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÔºü**

ÈóÆÂà∞Ëøô‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºå‰Ω†Â¶ÇÊûúÂéªÂéªÊêúÁ¥¢ÔºåÂæóÂà∞ÁöÑÁªìÊûú‰∏ÄÂÆöÊòØËøôÊ†∑ÔºöNon-fungible TokenÔºàÈùûÂêåË¥®ÂåñÈÄöËØÅÔºâ„ÄÇ

ÈÇ£‰ªÄ‰πàÊòØ‚ÄúÂêåË¥®Âåñ‰ª£Â∏Å‚ÄùÂë¢Ôºü‰∏ÄÂº† 100 ÂùóÁöÑ ‚ÄúÂÆû‰ΩìÈí±‚ÄùÔºåË∑üÂè¶‰∏ÄÂº† 100 ÂùóÈí±ÔºåÊàñËÄÖ 5 ‰∏™ 20 ÂùóÈí±ÂÆåÂÖ®ÂèØ‰ª•‰∫íÊç¢ÔºõÂì™ÊÄïÊòØËôöÊãüË¥ßÂ∏ÅÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊØîÁâπÂ∏Å‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ÊãÜÂàÜÔºåËÄå‰∏îÂíåÂè¶‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊØîÁâπÂ∏Å‰πãÈó¥Ôºå‰πüÂÆåÂÖ®Á≠â‰ª∑„ÄÇËøô‰∫õÈÉΩÂ±û‰∫éÂπø‰πâ‰∏äÁöÑ ‚ÄúÂêåË¥®Âåñ‰ª£Â∏Å‚Äù„ÄÇ   ‰ΩÜ NFT Âàô‰∏çÂêå„ÄÇ¬†‚ÄúÂå∫ÂùóÈìæ‚Äù¬†ÊäÄÊúØÔºåÂÆÉÁöÑÊú¨Ë¥®ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â§ßÂûãÁöÑÂàÜÂ∏ÉÂºèË¥¶Êú¨ÔºåÊï∞ÊçÆÊó†Ê≥ïÁØ°Êîπ„ÄÇ

ËÄå NFTÂ∞±ÊòØÊääÊôÆÈÄöÁöÑÂõæÁâá„ÄÅÈü≥‰πê„ÄÅËßÜÈ¢ë„ÄÅÊñáÂ≠óÁ≠âÔºåÂ≠òÂÇ®Âà∞Êüê‰∏Ä‰∏™Âå∫ÂùóÈìæ‰∏äÔºåÂÅöÊàê‰∏Ä‰∏™ ‚ÄúÊï∞Â≠óËµÑ‰∫ßÈÄöËØÅ‚ÄùÔºàtokenÔºâ„ÄÇËøô‰∏™ÈÄöËØÅ‰ºöÂú®Âå∫ÂùóÈìæ‰∏äÊã•Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂîØ‰∏ÄÁöÑÔºå‰∏çÂèØÊõø‰ª£ÁöÑÊï∞Â≠óËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºå‰ªéËøô‰∏™ÊÑè‰πâ‰∏äËÆ≤ÔºåÊØè‰∏™ NFT ÈÉΩÊòØÁã¨‰∏ÄÊó†‰∫åÁöÑ

Âú®ÂÆû‰ΩìÁöÑ‰∏ñÁïå‰∏≠ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†Êúâ‰∏ÄÊ†ãÊàøÂ≠ê„ÄÅ‰∏ÄÊù°ÈªÑÈáë„ÄÅ‰∏ÄÂπÖÂêçÁîªÔºåÊòØÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄèËøáÁé∞ÊúâÁöÑÊú∫Âà∂ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊàø‰∫ßÂú∞Â•ë„ÄÅÂïÜÂìÅË¥≠‰π∞ËØÅ‰π¶Á≠âÊñπÂºèËØÅÊòéÊâÄÊúâÊùÉÔºå‰∏çËøáÂú®ËôöÊãü‰∏ñÁïå‰∏≠ÔºåËøáÂéªÂç¥Ê≤°Êúâ‰∏ÄÂ•óÁêÜÊÉ≥ÁöÑÊú∫Âà∂ÂèØ‰ª•ËØÅÊòéËôöÊãüËµÑ‰∫ßÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÊùÉÔºåÊàñÊòØËøô‰∫õ‰øùÊä§Êú∫Âà∂ÁöÑ‰ΩúÁî®Ëøá‰∫éËñÑÂº±„ÄÇ

Ëøô‰∫õÂéüÂõ†ÂºïÂèëNFTÁàÜÁÇ∏ÊÄßÊàêÈïøÔºåÈÄèËøáÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÂÖ¨ÂºÄÈÄèÊòé„ÄÅ‰∏çÂèØÁØ°ÊîπÁöÑÁâπÊÄßÔºåÂ∞ÜÊï∞‰ΩçËµÑ‰∫ßÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÊùÉËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÈÄèËøá‰ª£Â∏ÅÔºàtokenÔºâÁöÑÊñπÂºè‰∫§ÊòìÔºå‰∏æÂá°Èü≥‰πê„ÄÅËâ∫ÊúØÂàõ‰Ωú„ÄÅ‰ΩìËÇ≤Âç°ÁâåÁ≠âÔºåÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™Êï∞‰ΩçÊùøÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÊùÉÔºåÁî®Êù•È™åÊòéÊ≠£Ë∫´„ÄÇ

Âú®ÁõÆÂâçÂä†ÂØÜÈ¢ÜÂüü‰∏≠ÔºöÊ∏∏Êàè„ÄÅËâ∫ÊúØÂìÅ„ÄÅÂüüÂêç„ÄÅÊî∂ËóèÂìÅ„ÄÅËôöÊãüËµÑ‰∫ß„ÄÅÁé∞ÂÆûËµÑ‰∫ß„ÄÅË∫´‰ªΩÁ≠âÊñπÈù¢ÈÉΩÊúâ NFT ÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®„ÄÇÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÁõÆÂâçÂèëÂ±ïÊúÄ‰∏∫ËøÖÈÄüÁöÑÊòØÊ∏∏Êàè„ÄÅËâ∫ÊúØÂìÅ‰ª•ÂèäÂüüÂêçÁ≠â„ÄÇ

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RxiGpwGJCOckc87-Iph7E.png?height=609&width=458)

**Â¶Ç‰ΩïË¥≠‰π∞NFTÔºö**

title: NFTÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÔºåÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰π∞ÂçñNFTÔºü
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/q1NVAnZhD6qE86ktOMaFB.png?height=900&width=1600)

**NFTÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÔºü**

ÈóÆÂà∞Ëøô‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºå‰Ω†Â¶ÇÊûúÂéªÊêúÁ¥¢ÔºåÂæóÂà∞ÁöÑÁªìÊûú‰∏ÄÂÆöÊòØËøôÊ†∑ÔºöNon-fungible TokenÔºàÈùûÂêåË¥®ÂåñÈÄöËØÅÔºâ„ÄÇ

ÂÖàËÆ≤‰∏Ä‰∏ã‚ÄúÂêåË¥®Âåñ‰ª£Â∏Å‚Äù„ÄÇ‰∏ÄÂº† 100 ÂùóÁöÑ ‚ÄúÂÆû‰ΩìÈí±‚ÄùÔºåË∑üÂè¶‰∏ÄÂº† 100 ÂùóÈí±ÔºåÊàñËÄÖ 5 ‰∏™ 20 ÂùóÈí±ÂÆåÂÖ®ÂèØ‰ª•‰∫íÊç¢ÔºõÂì™ÊÄïÊòØËôöÊãüË¥ßÂ∏ÅÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊØîÁâπÂ∏Å‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ÊãÜÂàÜÔºåËÄå‰∏îÂíåÂè¶‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊØîÁâπÂ∏Å‰πãÈó¥Ôºå‰πüÂÆåÂÖ®Á≠â‰ª∑„ÄÇËøô‰∫õÈÉΩÂ±û‰∫éÂπø‰πâ‰∏äÁöÑ ‚ÄúÂêåË¥®Âåñ‰ª£Â∏Å‚Äù„ÄÇ   ‰ΩÜ NFT Âàô‰∏çÂêå„ÄÇ¬†‚ÄúÂå∫ÂùóÈìæ‚Äù¬†ÊäÄÊúØÔºåÂÆÉÁöÑÊú¨Ë¥®ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â§ßÂûãÁöÑÂàÜÂ∏ÉÂºèË¥¶Êú¨ÔºåÊï∞ÊçÆÊó†Ê≥ïÁØ°Êîπ„ÄÇ

ËÄå NFTÂ∞±ÊòØÊääÊôÆÈÄöÁöÑÂõæÁâá„ÄÅÈü≥‰πê„ÄÅËßÜÈ¢ë„ÄÅÊñáÂ≠óÁ≠âÔºåÂ≠òÂÇ®Âà∞Êüê‰∏Ä‰∏™Âå∫ÂùóÈìæ‰∏äÔºåÂÅöÊàê‰∏Ä‰∏™ ‚ÄúÊï∞Â≠óËµÑ‰∫ßÈÄöËØÅ‚ÄùÔºàtokenÔºâ„ÄÇËøô‰∏™ÈÄöËØÅ‰ºöÂú®Âå∫ÂùóÈìæ‰∏äÊã•Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂîØ‰∏ÄÁöÑÔºå‰∏çÂèØÊõø‰ª£ÁöÑÊï∞Â≠óËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºå‰ªéËøô‰∏™ÊÑè‰πâ‰∏äËÆ≤ÔºåÊØè‰∏™ NFT ÈÉΩÊòØÁã¨‰∏ÄÊó†‰∫åÁöÑ

title: Velocity
body: In each and every atomic transaction, money and goods with the same value flow in the opposite directions, so the Fisher-equation seems to be a mere identity.First, the structure of the economy determines how often money should change hands. An economy where production is vertically integrated requires fewer money flows than a horizontally integrated one.

title: Fisher-equation
body: The most important economic problem is the relative shortage of money. This occurs when the growth rate of the real economy is higher than the growth rate of gold-mining, and the velocity of circulation cannot compensate for the difference.

title: Economy
body: The development level of the payment and settlement systems determines how easily money can change hands. In a pure cash economy, parties must meet physically to hand over a payment, whereas, with electronic payment systems, this process is much faster though still bounded.

**ÂΩìÁÑ∂‰∫åËàÖÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÁü•ÈÅìÔºåËøôÊú¨ÊïôÁßë‰π¶ÈáåÔºåËøòÂÜôÁùÄÔºö‰∫îËÄÖËã•‰∏çÁÅµÔºåÊùÄ‰πã„ÄÇ**

**ÂêåÊ†∑ÊèèÂÜôÂ∫ïÂ±Ç‰∏™‰ΩìÔºåËÄÅËàçÁöÑÁªìËÆ∫Â∞±‰∏çÂ§™‰∏ÄÊ†∑Ôºö‚ÄúÁ••Â≠ê‰ª•‰∏∫Âä™ÂäõÊãâËΩ¶ÔºåÂ∞±ËÉΩÊã•ÊúâÂ±û‰∫éËá™Â∑±ÁöÑ‰∏ÄËæÜÈªÑÂåÖËΩ¶„ÄÇ‚ÄùËÄÅËàçÂ¶ÇÊûúÁ©øË∂äÂà∞Áé∞Âú®Ôºå‰ºö‰∏ç‰ºöÈáçÂÜôÈ™ÜÈ©ºÁ••Â≠êÔºå‚ÄúÁ••Â≠êÊ≤ªÊÑà‰∫ÜÊàëÁöÑÁ≤æÁ•ûÂÜÖËÄó‚ÄúÔºü**

**Êó¢ÁÑ∂‰∫åËàÖËÉΩÊ≤ªÂ•Ω‰ΩúËÄÖÁöÑÁ≤æÁ•ûÂÜÖËÄóÔºåÈÇ£‰πàÁ••Â≠êÂ∞±Â∫îËØ•ËÉΩÊ≤ªÂ•ΩËÄÅËàçÁöÑÁ≤æÁ•ûÂÜÖËÄóÔºåÂçñÁÇ≠ÁøÅÂ∫îËØ•Ê≤ªÂ•ΩÁôΩÂ±ÖÊòìÁöÑÁ≤æÁ•ûÂÜÖËÄóÔºåÈòøqÂ∫îËØ•ËÉΩÊ≤ªÂ•ΩÈ≤ÅËøÖÁöÑÁ≤æÁ•ûÂÜÖËÄóÔºåËä≥Ê±ÄÂ∫îËØ•Ê≤ªÂ•ΩÈõ®ÊûúÁöÑÁ≤æÁ•ûÂÜÖËÄó„ÄÇ‰πãÊâÄ‰ª•Ê≤°Ê≤ªÂ•ΩÔºåËøòÊòØËøô‰∫õ‰ΩúÂÆ∂ÁîüÊ¥ªÁöÑÊó∂‰ª£‰∏çÂêåÔºå‰ΩìÂà∂‰ºòÂäø‰∏çË∂≥ÔºåÊ≠£ËÉΩÈáè‰∏çÂ§ü„ÄÇ**

title: Circulation
body: There could be special circumstances when the velocity of circulation increases beyond these boundaries. During hyperinflation money loses its function of store of value, as economic agents expecting fast growing prices try to exchange money for goods even if they do not need those goods to consume.

title: Loan
body: Assuming that all debts will be repaid, only a liquidity problem prevails: in the short run, the convertibility of notes is constrained by the level of reserves. However, there are always some debtors who default on their debt, which can lead to solvency problems in the long run.

title: Mail3 and KNN3 Reached an official Partnership
body:
> *Today, we are excited to announce a new partnership with KNN3.*

As a start of cooperation, Mail3 will integrate KNN3 Network graph database, which provides Web3 users with more optional features and a personal feed. Along with that, the relational aggregator can facilitate the entire web3 network and optimize your web3 mail experience.

Mail3 and KNN3 Network are proud to be the pioneer in providing diverse and meaningful web3 social enabling. More upcoming in-depth cooperation will be updated in our official announcement.

### About KNN3

KNN3 is Web3 Relationship Aggregator on multi-blockchains to empower Web3 social discovery & user enabling.

KNN3 Network provides graph solutions for web3 multiverse relational aggregation to empower Social d/App and AI analytics.

KNN3 aims to become a community-driven data curation protocol to enable on-chain data collaboration.

**[Website](https://www.knn3.xyz/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Knn3Network) | [Medium](https://medium.com/@KNN3_Network) | [Discord](https://discord.gg/KCtjhUpXn2)**

### About Mail3

Mail3 is a brand new Web3 communication protocol that enables wallet-to-wallet communication and wallet-to-contract communication for projects and community members with boundless possibility and forward compatibility.

It uses blockchain-based account and decentralized service guarantees security, privacy, and self-sovereign. supports all blockchain support.

Mail3 provides wallet as the identity, once the user connects the wallet, the email address can be automatically generated with wallet address and domain names, such as[ 0x1234512345@mail3.me](https://0x1234512345@mail3.me) and[ alice.eth@mail.me](https://alice.eth@mail.me).

Mail3 aims to be the infrastructure for web3 communication and the platform for valuable information such as relationships, reputation, and trust.

**[Website](https://mail3.me/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mail3dao) | [Discord](https://discord.gg/J3ac6YcXUU) | [Github](https://github.com/mail3protocol)**

title: Lender
body: The introduction of lending leads to many changes. First of all, lenders are not only depository institutions anymore, we can call them banks henceforth. Second, lending increases the quantity of money circulating in the economy, which could solve the problem of relative money shortage.

title: Why Shogo Travels
body:
This is my very first post in Mirror.

Hi all, It‚Äôs Shogo from Tokyo. I will be posting my travel memory in Mirror. 3 years back, I have been explored 5 continents, 35 countries over the world after graduation from university. Knowing new places, culture, lives of people means a lot to me since I started my journey. It gives me many kinds of different perspectives, ideas, motivation. Now its time to get back to the travel age again.

### Why writing the post 

1. As a traveller, I would love to tell many people, especially Japanese, that the travelling is so much fun to do! There are a lot of things you do not know if you are stuck in one places, time to get out to go see new things!
2. There are different lives over the world, and it is not rare that I encounter a lot of unfairness of the world or poverty. Any opportunities to chase our dreams should not depend on where they were born, what skin colour they have.  I believe this is what as many people as possible should be aware of. There are many ways to seriously face those issue as well, and one of them, I believe, might be in web3 world, which is why I tried to use one of the web3 products, Mirror, here.

### About my dream

My dream is to visit all the countries in the world. I don‚Äôt really like to split the areas by country since it is likely just lines that human created for their own benefits. But I was born in this age, no choices. 

And people like to ask me. What do you want to achieve. What do you want to do. I am not 100% sure if those questions always make sense and I do not have clear answer yet. But What I always feel is that this world is way too unfair and I am not comfortable about it. Some people have limited choices about their dreams depending on the area where they were born regardless of all their efforts or talents. I understand that there is no way that human can create a world with full fairness. But if I imagine the ideal myself, it would be me trying to create the world where more people can chase their dreams.

### About my life

I have graduated from Waseda univ with space engineer major, then started to travel many countries. After coming back to Tokyo, I was working for digital marketing agency for over 2 years. Apart from I have also involved in many project such as developing the webapp named ‚ÄúComms‚Äú which is a service for Japanese comedians, and developing the company system with backend code etc. 

Then now I am back to travel life again. Let‚Äôs see what I find out of this journey!

title: IOUs
body: The more reputable a private agent is, the more liquid his IOUs will be. However, only close business partners can rate the reputation of an agent, which makes the liquidity of commercial bills pretty constrained.

title: Gold
body: It is even better if the bank buys the commercial bill by paying out gold coins or by issuing promissory notes. The former can be ruled out on the grounds discussed before: the seller of the bill will convert coins into notes immediately for practical reasons.

title: Chuka -a place and time where nature, art and science meet.
body:
We feel our activity as a non-obvious alternative to classical forms of creativity, which can be introduced into your life, work, current and future projects. It can be useful as people of creative processions, artists, fashion designers, all those who work with textiles and are looking for ways to delve into their practice, expand their understanding of the possibilities of hand design, find ideas and inspiration. And also to everyone who is interested in trying something new, interacting with natural materials, seeing how natural color works, noticing opportunities in this, regaining the freshness of perception of the world.

We encourage the development of a playful relationship with natural materials, developing an affinity for the natural world, looking for deeper meanings in how we can create things and what we feel after.

title: YouTube‚Äôs making it easier for creators to turn longer content into Shorts
body:
YouTube is trying to make it even easier for creators to turn their longer videos into Shorts formatted for the platform's TikTok competitor, by adding a new ‚ÄúEdit into a Short‚Äù tool to its iOS and Android app. It‚Äôll let creators select up to 60 seconds from one of their videos and bring the clip into the Shorts editor, right from the YouTube app on iOS or Android. From there, they can add things like text, filters, as well as additional videos shot with the Shorts camera or pulled from their photo library.

In [an announcement post for the feature](https://support.google.com/youtube/thread/139221507/new-features-and-updates-for-shorts-viewers-creators?hl=en), YouTube says that the finished Short will link to the full video it was clipped from, which could help make Shorts an ideal promotional tool for the creator‚Äôs longer content ‚Äî a key incentive for them to dive in while YouTube continues testing [monetization options for the feature](https://www.theverge.com/2022/2/10/22925936/youtube-creators-feature-shopping-live-streaming-gifted-memberships). If a viewer enjoys a Short created with this tool, they wouldn‚Äôt have to go to the creator‚Äôs channel and search around for the full video.

*Using the tool should be relatively simple.*

Image: Google

Unlike other tools like Cut, which [lets you use five seconds from a longer video](https://www.theverge.com/2022/4/14/23024230/youtube-shorts-video-sampling-remixing) in a Short, or Clips, which can be converted into Shorts, the Edit into a Short tool can‚Äôt be used on other users‚Äô uploads. It‚Äôll only show up in the Create menu if you‚Äôre viewing a video you uploaded.

YouTube has put a lot of focus on Shorts since it [started rolling out the feature in 2020](https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/14/21436158/youtube-starts-tiktok-competitor-short-form-video-instagram-reels-beta-test). It‚Äôs tried to incentivize creators to use the format by [setting up a fund](https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/3/22606291/youtube-shorts-fund-launches-100-million) that paid creators if they uploaded Shorts. [As ](https://techcrunch.com/2022/07/28/youtubes-new-tool-lets-creators-turn-their-own-videos-into-shorts/)*[TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2022/07/28/youtubes-new-tool-lets-creators-turn-their-own-videos-into-shorts/)*[ notes](https://techcrunch.com/2022/07/28/youtubes-new-tool-lets-creators-turn-their-own-videos-into-shorts/), the company has also been padding out its library by converting existing videos to Shorts, as long as they were filmed vertically and under 60 seconds long. Last month, YouTube said that [over 1.5 billion people](https://www.theverge.com/2022/6/15/23167577/youtube-shorts-viewers-advertising-creator-monetization) watched Shorts each month.

### Uniswap

Uniswap ÁöÑÂü∫Á°ÄÊòØ**ÊÅíÂÆö‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨Âºè**Ôºå**x \* y = k**ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØËµÑ‰∫ß X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØËµÑ‰∫ß Y ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåk ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∏∏Êï∞„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊØè‰∏™Ê±†‰ªÖÂåÖÂê´‰∏§‰∏™ËµÑ‰∫ß X Âíå YÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îËØ•ÂÖ¨ÂºèÁ°Æ‰øù‰∏§ËÄÖÁöÑÊØîÁéáÁõ∏Á≠â„ÄÇ

 
 

‰∏ãÂõæÊòæÁ§∫‰∫ÜÊÅíÂÆö‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨ÂºèÁöÑÂõæÂΩ¢ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØ X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØÊ±†‰∏≠ Y ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåÊõ≤Á∫ø‰∏äÁÇπÁöÑÊñúÁéá‰ª£Ë°®‰∫ÜÁé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†º„ÄÇ

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pHfu64kPxkEIIJxC7L1W6.PNG?height=283&width=349)

ËøôÊúÄÂ•ΩÁî®‰∏Ä‰∏™‰æãÂ≠êÊù•Ëß£ÈáäÔºö

ÂÅáËÆæ AVAX ‰∏∫ 100 ÁæéÂÖÉÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ AVAX/USDC Ê±†Áî± **20 ‰∏™ AVAX Âíå 2000 ‰∏™ USDC** ÁªÑÊàê„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫ 20 ‰∏™ AVAX ÁöÑ‰ª∑Ê†ºÂíå 2000 ‰∏™ USDC Áõ∏Á≠âÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ËµÑ‰∫ß‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÊØî‰æãÊòØ 1:1„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊàë‰ª¨**‰ª§ËµÑ‰∫ß X ‰∏∫ AVAXÔºåËµÑ‰∫ß Y ‰∏∫ USDC**ÔºåÈÇ£‰πà‰ΩøÁî®Â∏∏Êï∞‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•ÂæóÂà∞ k = 20 \* 2000 = 40000„ÄÇ

 
 

Ëøô‰∏™‰πòÁßØÂú®‰∫§Êç¢ÊúüÈó¥‰øùÊåÅ‰∏çÂèòÔºåÈô§ÈùûÂ¢ûÂä†‰∫ÜÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß„ÄÇ

 
 

Áé∞Âú®ÂÅáËÆæ Alice ÊÉ≥Ë¶Å‰∫§Êç¢ÊéâÂ•πÁöÑ 5 ‰∏™ AVAX„ÄÇÈÇ£‰πàÂ•π‰ºöÂæóÂà∞Â§öÂ∞ë USDC ‰Ωú‰∏∫ÂõûÊä•Ôºü

 
 

ÈáçÊñ∞ÊéíÂàó y ÁöÑÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂæóÂà∞ y = k/x„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•‰∫§Êç¢ÂêéÊ±†‰∏≠ÁöÑ USDC Êï∞Èáè‰∏∫ y = 40000 / (20+5) = 1600 USDC„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª• Alice Áî® **5 ‰∏™ AVAX Êî∂Âà∞‰∫Ü 400 USDC**„ÄÇ

 
 

ËØ•Ê±†Áé∞Âú®ÂåÖÊã¨ **25 AVAX Âíå 1600 USDC**„ÄÇAVAX ÁöÑÁé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†ºÁé∞Âú®‰ªé 100 USDC Âèò‰∏∫ 1600/25 = 64 USDCÔºàÊÑüË∞¢ Alice ÂêëÊàë‰ª¨ÊâÄÊúâ‰∫∫ÂÄæÈîÄÔºâ„ÄÇ

title: „ÄåÂÖ•Èó®ÁßëÊôÆ „ÄçDeFi Ëµ∑Ê∫êÔºöÁÆÄË¶ÅÂõûÈ°æÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰ª£ AMM
body:
ÂéüÊñá‰ΩúËÄÖÔºöJoe Content

ÁºñËØëÔºöBTX Capital

> ÂØºËØªÔºöËá™‰ªé Vitalik 2017 Âπ¥Âú®„ÄäÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÊù° On Path Independence„Äã‰∏≠ÊèêÂá∫‰∫ÜÂÅöÔºàAMMÔºâ‰πãÂêéÔºåAMM Êàê‰∏∫ DeFi ÁöÑÊµÅË°å„ÄÇUniswap ÊòØÂΩìÊó∂ÁöÑÁÉ≠Èó®Ôºå‰ΩÜ‰πüÊúâÂæàÂ§öÂÖ∂‰ªñÁöÑ AMM„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂú®Êú¨Êñá‰∏≠‰∏Ä‰∏Ä‰ªãÁªçÂÆÉ‰ª¨„ÄÇ

### Uniswap

Uniswap ÁöÑÂü∫Á°ÄÊòØ**Âõ∫ÂÆö‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨Âºè**Ôºå**x \* y = k**ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØËµÑ‰∫ß X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØËµÑ‰∫ß Y ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåk ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âçï‰Ωç„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊØè‰∏™Ê±†Âè™ÂåÖÂê´‰∏§‰∏™ËµÑ‰∫ß X Âíå YÔºåÂÖ¨ÂºèËØÅÊòéÔºåËøôÊòØÁúüÁöÑ„ÄÇ

‰∏ãÂõæÊúâÁ≠âÈáè‰πòÊ≥ïÁöÑÂõæÂΩ¢ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØ X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØÊ±†‰∏≠ Y ÁöÑÊõ≤Á∫øÊòæÁ§∫ÁöÑÔºå‰∏äÁÇπÁöÑÊñúÁéá‰ª£Ë°®Áé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†º„ÄÇ

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pHfu64kPxkEIIJxC7L1W6.PNG?height=283&width=349)

ËøôÁî®‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúÄÂ•ΩÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÊù•Ëß£ÈáäÔºö

ÂÅáËÆæ AVAX ‰∏∫ 100 ÁæéÂÖÉÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ AVAXUSDC Áî±**20 ‰∏™ AVAX ÂíåÂ¶ÇÊûú 2000 ‰∏™ USDC**ÁªÑÊàê„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫ 20 ‰∏™ AVAX Âíå 2000 ‰∏™ USDCÔºåËµÑ‰∫ß‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÊØî‰æãÊòØ 1:1„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨**X ‰∏∫ AVAX ÔºåËµÑ‰∫ß Y ‰∏∫ USDC**ÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Â§ö‰ΩøÁî®Ê¨°ÁßØÂàÜÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•ÂæóÂà∞ k = 20 \* 2000 = 40000„ÄÇ

Ëøô‰∏™Êî∂ÁõäÂú®‰∫§Êç¢ÊúüÈó¥‰øùÊåÅ‰∏çÂèòÔºå‰πòÁùÄÂ¢ûÂä†‰∫ÜÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß„ÄÇ

Áé∞Âú® Alice ÊÉ≥Ë¶Å‰∫§Êç¢Â•πÁöÑ 5 ‰∏™ AVAX„ÄÇÈÇ£‰πàÂ•π‰ºöÂæóÂà∞Â§öÂ∞ë USDC ‰Ωú‰∏∫ÂõûÊä•Ôºü

ÈáçÊñ∞ÊéíÂàóyÁöÑÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÂæóÂà∞Êàë‰ª¨y = k/x„ÄÇÂÖëÊç¢ÂêéÊ±†‰∏≠ÁöÑUSDCÊï∞Èáè‰∏∫y = 40000 / (20+5) = 1600 USDC„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•AliceÁî®**5‰∏™AVAXÊî∂Âà∞‰∫Ü400 USDC**„ÄÇ

ËØ•Ê¨æÁé∞Âú®25 AVAX**ÂåÖÂê´1600** USDC„ÄÇAVAXÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÁé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†ºÁé∞Âú®‰ªé100 USDCÂèòÊàê1600/25 = 64 USDCÔºàÊÑüË∞¢AliceÂêëÊâÄÊúâ‰∫∫ÂÄæÈîÄ„ÄÇ

ËØ•‰∫§ÊòìÁöÑ‰ª∑Ê†ºÂΩ±Âìç‰∏∫ (64-100) / 100 = -36%„ÄÇ

Âõ†‰∏∫Êõ≤Á∫øÊòØÂá∏ÂáΩÊï∞ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÂΩì‰Ω†‰πòÈöè‰ª∑Ê†ºÂèòÂåñÊó∂ÔºåÊñúÁéá‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇ

Áúã‰∏ãÂõæ„ÄÇ Êõ≤Á∫øÂú®ÂêÑËá™ÁöÑÊñúÁéáÂíåÈ¢ÑÊµã‰ΩçÁΩÆÁöÑÂΩ±Âìç„ÄÇ

Ëøô‰∫õÈóÆÈ¢òÁöÑÈ¢ÑÊúüÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÁ°Æ‰øùÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß‰ºöÊ∑±Ôºå‰ª∑Ê†ºÂΩ±Âìç„ÄÇ

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xLZusYiHNxGvXN5MEonAG.JPEG?height=563&width=761)

Â¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÂÜçÊ¨°Ê£ÄÊü•ËØ•ÂõæÔºå‰ºöÊ≥®ÊÑèÂà∞ÂÆÉ‰∏ç‰ºö‰∏é‰Ω† x Êàñ x ËΩ¥ËµÑ‰∫ßÁõ∏‰∫§Âç≥‰∏∫‰Ω†ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†Ôºå‰∏∫Êï¥‰∏™‰ª∑Ê†ºËåÉÂõ¥Ôºà‰∏∫ 0Ôºå‚àûÔºâÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊã•ÊúâÊù•‰∫§ÊòìÊâßË°å„ÄÇ

ÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÊèê‰æõ‰∫ÜÈùûÂ∏∏Â•ΩÁöÑÂäüËÉΩÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÂÄüÁî®‰∫Ü DeFiÔºåÁé∞Âú®ÂèØ‰ª•ÂïÜ‰∏ö‰∏äËØ¥‰∏Ä‰∏ãÔºåÊàñËÄÖÂõ†‰∏∫ÊùéÂõõÈÉΩÂú®‰∏≠ÔºåË¥üË¥£ÂÆåÊàêËøô‰ª∂ÊîøÂ∫úÔºåÂ§ßÂûãÊú∫ÊûÑÁöÑÂ∑•‰Ωú„ÄÇ

## Êõ≤Á∫ø

Uniswap Â∞Ü‰ΩøÁî®‰ª∑Ê†ºÈóÆÈ¢ò‰Ωú‰∏∫Âü∫Á°Ä‰∏çÂèòÈáèÔºåÂÖ∂ÊòØ‰ª∑Ê†º**ÂΩ±Âìç**„ÄÇ

Á≠âÂºèÂíåÂÖ¨Âºè‰∏∫**x + y = k**ÔºåÂõæÂΩ¢Â¶Ç‰∏ãÊâÄÁ§∫Ôºö

A \* (x + y) + xy = k

**ÊòØÂÄçÊï∞ÔºåÊòØ‰ª£Ë°®‰∫∫Áâ©„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÂæà‰∏çÂπ≥Ë°°ÔºåÂàô‰∏Ä‰∏™Áõ∏ÂΩì‰∏çÈîôÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÔºåÁªÑÁªáÊ±†ÈúÄË¶ÅÁº©Â∞è‰∏Ä‰∏™*ÊîæÂ§ß***Ôºàx+yÔºâ„ÄÇÊ≠§Êó∂ÔºåÂÆÉ‰ºöÂá∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∏ÇÈõÜ„ÄÇ

### Uniswap

Uniswap ÁöÑÂü∫Á°ÄÊòØ**ÊÅíÂÆö‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨Âºè**Ôºå**x \* y = k**ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØËµÑ‰∫ß X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØËµÑ‰∫ß Y ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåk ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∏∏Êï∞„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊØè‰∏™Ê±†‰ªÖÂåÖÂê´‰∏§‰∏™ËµÑ‰∫ß X Âíå YÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îËØ•ÂÖ¨ÂºèÁ°Æ‰øù‰∏§ËÄÖÁöÑÊØîÁéáÁõ∏Á≠â„ÄÇ

 
 

‰∏ãÂõæÊòæÁ§∫‰∫ÜÊÅíÂÆö‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨ÂºèÁöÑÂõæÂΩ¢ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØ X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØÊ±†‰∏≠ Y ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåÊõ≤Á∫ø‰∏äÁÇπÁöÑÊñúÁéá‰ª£Ë°®‰∫ÜÁé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†º„ÄÇ

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pHfu64kPxkEIIJxC7L1W6.PNG?height=283&width=349)

ËøôÊúÄÂ•ΩÁî®‰∏Ä‰∏™‰æãÂ≠êÊù•Ëß£ÈáäÔºö

ÂÅáËÆæ AVAX ‰∏∫ 100 ÁæéÂÖÉÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ AVAX/USDC Ê±†Áî± **20 ‰∏™ AVAX Âíå 2000 ‰∏™ USDC** ÁªÑÊàê„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫ 20 ‰∏™ AVAX ÁöÑ‰ª∑Ê†ºÂíå 2000 ‰∏™ USDC Áõ∏Á≠âÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ËµÑ‰∫ß‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÊØî‰æãÊòØ 1:1„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊàë‰ª¨**‰ª§ËµÑ‰∫ß X ‰∏∫ AVAXÔºåËµÑ‰∫ß Y ‰∏∫ USDC**ÔºåÈÇ£‰πà‰ΩøÁî®Â∏∏Êï∞‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•ÂæóÂà∞ k = 20 \* 2000 = 40000„ÄÇ

 
 

Ëøô‰∏™‰πòÁßØÂú®‰∫§Êç¢ÊúüÈó¥‰øùÊåÅ‰∏çÂèòÔºåÈô§ÈùûÂ¢ûÂä†‰∫ÜÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß„ÄÇ

 
 

Áé∞Âú®ÂÅáËÆæ Alice ÊÉ≥Ë¶Å‰∫§Êç¢ÊéâÂ•πÁöÑ 5 ‰∏™ AVAX„ÄÇÈÇ£‰πàÂ•π‰ºöÂæóÂà∞Â§öÂ∞ë USDC ‰Ωú‰∏∫ÂõûÊä•Ôºü

 
 

ÈáçÊñ∞ÊéíÂàó y ÁöÑÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂæóÂà∞ y = k/x„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•‰∫§Êç¢ÂêéÊ±†‰∏≠ÁöÑ USDC Êï∞Èáè‰∏∫ y = 40000 / (20+5) = 1600 USDC„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª• Alice Áî® **5 ‰∏™ AVAX Êî∂Âà∞‰∫Ü 400 USDC**„ÄÇ

 
 

ËØ•Ê±†Áé∞Âú®ÂåÖÊã¨ **25 AVAX Âíå 1600 USDC**„ÄÇAVAX ÁöÑÁé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†ºÁé∞Âú®‰ªé 100 USDC Âèò‰∏∫ 1600/25 = 64 USDCÔºàÊÑüË∞¢ Alice ÂêëÊàë‰ª¨ÊâÄÊúâ‰∫∫ÂÄæÈîÄÔºâ„ÄÇ

 
 

ËØ•‰∫§ÊòìÁöÑ‰ª∑Ê†ºÂΩ±Âìç‰∏∫ (64-100) / 100 = -36%„ÄÇ

 
 

‰ª∑Ê†ºÂΩ±ÂìçÂèØËÉΩÊòØÊÅíÂÆö‰πòÁßØÂÅöÂ∏ÇÂïÜÁöÑÂºäÁ´Ø‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫Êõ≤Á∫øÊòØÂá∏ÂáΩÊï∞ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÂΩì‰Ω†Ê≤øÁùÄÊõ≤Á∫øÁßªÂä®Êó∂ÔºåÊñúÁéá‰ºö‰∏çÊñ≠ÂèòÂåñ„ÄÇ

title: Ethereum Merge and the Impact on Supply Dynamics
body:
Last week, the excitement around Ethereum‚Äôs upcoming Merge was rekindled when Tim Beiko provided a soft roadmap that suggested the Merge will be pressing forward on September 19th of this year. On the one hand, this date can (and almost certainly will) change. On the other, there was enough certainty about the Merge being completed that a precise date could be estimated.¬† After all, the Merge has been on the Ethereum roadmap for years. So it excites the community for the Merge, one of the most anticipated events in cryptocurrency history, to be *actually happening* after a thoroughly memefied delay (Soon‚Ñ¢).¬†

There are two major reasons the Merge is exciting for Ethereum: one is **energy usage reduction** and the other is a **shift in the supply dynamics of ETH**. This article focuses on the supply dynamics shift and the downstream effects on the Ethereum ecosystem and DeFi.¬†

## What is changing from an ETH supply perspective

One way to view the Merge is a change in block producers on the Ethereum blockchain from miners to validators who stake ETH. Blocks on Ethereum today are produced by computers running software using their time and computation power to process transactions and produce blocks. This is known as ‚Äúmining‚Äù according to the proof-of-work (PoW) consensus protocol.¬†

The Merge will replace the PoW consensus protocol with a proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus protocol for Ethereum‚Äôs execution layer. It‚Äôs called the ‚ÄúMerge‚Äù and not the ‚ÄúSwitch‚Äù because the PoS consensus protocol already exists as the Beacon Chain, where validators currently runnode software to process transactions and create new blocks on that chain. The Merge will ‚Äúmerge‚Äù the new consensus layer the Beacon Chain provides with the existing Ethereum execution layer and stop the use of mining.

Ok, so **how does this affect ETH supply?**

Currently, new ETH issuance comes from two places:

* Mining rewards \~13,000 ETH/day
* Staking rewards \~1,600 ETH/day (at current staked ETH levels)

After the Merge, the Mining rewards issuance will be eliminated. At a purely mechanical level, the Merge will dramatically cut ETH issuance based on recent estimates.¬†

But another aspect of¬† the circulating supply is a bit more speculative but no less powerful. **Post-merge block production will be inherently more ETH-intensive** than under a proof-of-work regime.¬†

To illustrate what I mean, imagine the inputs for starting or expanding a mining operation today. You need:

* The hardware necessary to build and maintain a mining rig
* Electricity to run the mining rig
* Depending on the scale, ancillary equipment to support mining (ventilation, energy monitoring, wiring, etc.)

By and large, miners need to convert the ETH they earn from mining to fiat in order to pay for the above, which provides inherent selling pressure from the block production business.

Contrast with what‚Äôs needed to receive rewards via staking. You need:

* Hardware that runs both an Ethereum execution client and consensus client while connected to the internet
* Electricity to maintain that hardware
* To deposit 32 ETH

The first three bullets are quite similar, but it‚Äôs important to note that the hardware and electricity comparison is night-and-day. Under PoW, there is an incentive to invest in more powerful (and expensive) hardware to increase compensation. This has created a mining arms race for more powerful equipment (that consumes more energy). With the Merge, there are no such incentives for validators, and the software can be run on a simple laptop.

So to add all of that up. Block production prior to the Merge requires upfront investment in expensive hardware. That hardware is generally purchased by larger miners by selling ETH for fiat. After the Merge, block production requires an upfront investment of deposited ETH. Before the Merge, block production requires management of high energy consumption and externalities (e.g. heat ventilation). Also paid for by selling ETH for fiat. After the Merge, maintenance costs do remain but are significantly reduced. The bottom line is that the block production business moves from one that sells a lot of ETH to convert into hardware and energy to one that requires deposits of ETH to start or expand and less ETH conversion to hardware/energy on an ongoing basis. This is less intuitive than ‚Äúthere will be less ETH issuance,‚Äù but will have a powerful effect on the circulating supply of ETH.

To summarize, **the Merge will** (1) **reduce the issuance of ETH directly** and (2) **restructure ETH incentives for block production**. You will also often hear or see people talk about ETH becoming net deflationary after the Merge. That isn‚Äôt necessarily true or a mechanical certainty based on the Merge. But based on estimates of issuance reduction for ETH and estimates of fee burn from network usage, it appears that may be the case upon a successful Merge.

## How will the Merge affect DeFi?

There are **no direct consequences of the Merge** for the **application layer of Ethereum** (of which DeFi is a part). But a host of second-order effects can be anticipated from a reduction of supply for the ecosystem‚Äôs native asset. However, I want to state that the previous section covered fairly straightforward facts about the Merge and how they alter the landscape for ETH as an asset, the following section is a little more speculative in nature.

### Liquid staking protocols

Liquid staking protocols a vertical of DeFi that wouldn‚Äôt exist without proof-of-stake as a concept. Liquid staking protocols such as Lido or RocketPool allow users to stake ETH (or other PoS assets) and receive a fungible token representing a share of ETH staked with the platform. That ETH cannot be retrieved unless the Merge occurs successfully. A part of the reason these tokens, such as stETH, trade at a discount to ETH is the risk of an unsuccessful Merge. With the Merge completed, that risk is removed!

¬†Furthermore, the Merge is expected to increase the ETH return due to a reallocation of transaction fees currently accrue to miners. Recent estimates indicate that the APR for staking will increase to \~7%, approximately 50% higher than the base issuance APR (as of June 2022). So there‚Äôs also an expected increase in the fees going to these liquid staking protocols and the staked collateral these tokens represent.

### ETH as Reserve Asset in DeFi

As mentioned above, the Merge has no direct effects on major DeFi protocols such as Uniswap or Maker. But, ETH‚Äôs use as a reserve asset means the effects of supply limitation or reduction will be felt in DeFi. ETH is the primary asset for collateral backing in Maker and the most significant non-stablecoin asset used to balance transactions in Uniswap. A reduced supply of ETH can mean expanded collateral value for the minting of DAI. The DEX impacts are less straightforward but should be considered if the Merge introduces more volatility for ETH.

### Rollups and Layer 2

It‚Äôs important to note that the Merge will not reduce transaction fees or increase throughput on Ethereum. There‚Äôs been a conflation of the Merge with separate Ethereum roadmap plans. But the Merge is not primarily designed to address scaling. However, it is part of a rollup-centric roadmap. Designed to address problems like energy usage and incentives while scaling is addressed on layer 2, and the stage is set for sharding in the future. With the Merge out of the way, this may clear the way for activity to move to L2s as the narrative (and developer attention) shifts from ETH as an asset back to how to accommodate widespread use of Ethereum blockspace.

### Possible negative ecosystem effects

There‚Äôs also been a suggestion that there will be a supply glut when staked ETH ‚Äúunlocks‚Äù upon the Merge. First, that‚Äôs a misconception. Staked ETH will not unlock until an estimated 6-12 months after the Merge when the planned Shanghai upgrade to Ethereum occurs. Second, validator exits (removal of the 32 ETH deposit) are rate limited to mitigate instability. There will be a significant supply of ETH that is newly liquid when the Shanghai upgrade occurs, but given the current rate of issuance of ETH pre-Merge versus total anticipated issuance to stakers, that amount will not be unprecedented for ETH markets. Furthermore, as validators are removed, the APR for validators that remain will rise, incentivizing continued staking.

## Conclusion

One of the most exciting events in cryptocurrency history is nearing, and it should dramatically change narratives around Ethereum and the supply of the native asset for its ecosystem. DeFi protocols and users are preparing for the Merge in various ways, but like any major event that affects the markets, only time will tell the full story of the Merge‚Äôs impact on DeFi and Ethereum.

## Uniswap

Uniswap ÁöÑÂü∫Á°ÄÊòØ**Âõ∫ÂÆö‰πòÁßØÂÖ¨Âºè**Ôºå**x \* y = k**ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØËµÑ‰∫ß X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØËµÑ‰∫ß Y ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåk ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âçï‰Ωç„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊØè‰∏™Ê±†Âè™ÂåÖÂê´‰∏§‰∏™ËµÑ‰∫ß X Âíå YÔºåÂÖ¨ÂºèËØÅÊòéÔºåËøôÊòØÁúüÁöÑ„ÄÇ

‰∏ãÂõæÊúâÁ≠âÈáè‰πòÊ≥ïÁöÑÂõæÂΩ¢ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØ X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØÊ±†‰∏≠ Y ÁöÑÊõ≤Á∫øÊòæÁ§∫ÁöÑÔºå‰∏äÁÇπÁöÑÊñúÁéá‰ª£Ë°®Áé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†º„ÄÇ

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pHfu64kPxkEIIJxC7L1W6.PNG?height=283&width=349)

ËøôÁî®‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúÄÂ•ΩÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÊù•Ëß£ÈáäÔºö

ÂÅáËÆæ AVAX ‰∏∫ 100 ÁæéÂÖÉÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ AVAXUSDC Áî±**20 ‰∏™ AVAX ÂíåÂ¶ÇÊûú 2000 ‰∏™ USDC**ÁªÑÊàê„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫ 20 ‰∏™ AVAX Âíå 2000 ‰∏™ USDCÔºåËµÑ‰∫ß‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÊØî‰æãÊòØ 1:1„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨**X ‰∏∫ AVAX ÔºåËµÑ‰∫ß Y ‰∏∫ USDC**ÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Â§ö‰ΩøÁî®Ê¨°ÁßØÂàÜÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•ÂæóÂà∞ k = 20 \* 2000 = 40000„ÄÇ

Ëøô‰∏™Êî∂ÁõäÂú®‰∫§Êç¢ÊúüÈó¥‰øùÊåÅ‰∏çÂèòÔºå‰πòÁùÄÂ¢ûÂä†‰∫ÜÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß„ÄÇ

Áé∞Âú® Alice ÊÉ≥Ë¶Å‰∫§Êç¢Â•πÁöÑ 5 ‰∏™ AVAX„ÄÇÈÇ£‰πàÂ•π‰ºöÂæóÂà∞Â§öÂ∞ë USDC ‰Ωú‰∏∫ÂõûÊä•Ôºü

ÈáçÊñ∞ÊéíÂàóyÁöÑÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÂæóÂà∞Êàë‰ª¨y = k/x„ÄÇÂÖëÊç¢ÂêéÊ±†‰∏≠ÁöÑUSDCÊï∞Èáè‰∏∫y = 40000 / (20+5) = 1600 USDC„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•AliceÁî®**5‰∏™AVAXÊî∂Âà∞‰∫Ü400 USDC**„ÄÇ

ËØ•Ê¨æÁé∞Âú®25 AVAX**ÂåÖÂê´1600** USDC„ÄÇAVAXÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÁé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†ºÁé∞Âú®‰ªé100 USDCÂèòÊàê1600/25 = 64 USDCÔºàÊÑüË∞¢AliceÂêëÊâÄÊúâ‰∫∫ÂÄæÈîÄ„ÄÇ

ËØ•‰∫§ÊòìÁöÑ‰ª∑Ê†ºÂΩ±Âìç‰∏∫ (64-100) / 100 = -36%„ÄÇ

title: Metagrave will overturn the traditional funeral industry!
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-WNuEVc5r5l4u5NfZBfnM.png?height=623&width=1269)

1„ÄÅDevelopment of funeral industry

What is the funeral industry?The Funeral Services Industry is a small industry dedicated to arranging and conducting funerals according to the wishes of its clients.There's¬†an¬†old¬†saying¬†people¬†sleep in the grave¬†when they die, which means¬†people¬†are¬†buried in the earth after death. With the evolution of the times, the funeral industry is also developing,and today there are¬†a variety of graveyards and burial methods.

First,¬†the sea burial¬†is born. Sea Burial is a practice where cremated remains are dispersed into the sea. It breaks through the traditional concept of people¬†sleeping¬†in the grave. People come from nature and return to nature. It is another major reform after burial. Then there is the birth of cremation, which means burning human bodies into ashes and then placing them in a mourning hall or burying them underground. Cremation can be said to be a forced way to produce under the current state of land shortage. Its advantage is that it greatly saves land space, and there is also a sense of ceremony that can express people's sadness.

2„ÄÅMetaverse and Metagrave

Metagrave is a meta-universe graveyard platform based on ETH, BSC, SOL and other public chain technologies.In the world of metagrave, we can build a graveyard to honor¬†dead¬†loved¬†ones as in the real world, and we can also write a family tree to inherit for generations.Metagrave will offer the same ritual items as exhibited in the real world in the form of NFT for honoring our dead relatives, friends, pets, etc.

As the project gets¬†going, Metagrave will be updated from 2D to 3D. At that time, Metagrave will introduce the memorial hall, where users can display beautiful pictures of relatives, friends, pets, etc. These pictures can be photos, videos, sounds, or even 3D models. We will also develop the communication skills for these 3D models.

Metagrave is a milestone in the field of metaverse. In the world of metaverse, metagrave has found a connecting point between people in the virtual world and the real world, meeting an idealized need for people to leave the real world and live in another world. In addition, after the project team quits the NFT sales task, it will decide whether to establish a community department through voting. The community has the right to sell NFT sacrifices. At the same time, during the early financing period, all donated users will have the opportunity to receive generous airdrops from the project.

3„ÄÅMetagrave that overturns the traditional funeral industry

As Metagrave go¬†into¬†the¬†sacrificial industry, the world's ¬•10trillion sacrificial industry is actually being reconstructed by the metaverse. Despite¬†the secular interests, Metagrave has really made the death of a life just a biological¬†death, and human virtual life can exist forever. He has even created a new field, that is,the life technology service industry. At the technical level, Metagrave, like Decentraland, is also based on utilitarianism. Therefore, for the personal assets of players and strong community attributes , Metagrave is even better than Decentraland. And similar virtual real estate platforms in the metaverse often attract users to invest, including the reason for their land price rise, but also because there are some famous people's land right next to them. For the graves of these technology industries, if they are buried next to the graves of celebrities, stars or great men, then this value is immeasurable.

Judging from¬†the company's investment,¬†KFC¬†Capital¬†and¬†Dreamer Capital both¬†participated in the¬†multi-million dollar¬†large-scale financing of¬†Metagrave,¬†which means that some top financial institutions are optimistic about the¬†future¬†development¬†of¬†Metagrave.Capital is always the forerunner, which also shows that the future of the Metaverse graveyard is full of infinite imagination.

## Uniswap

‰∏ãÂõæÊúâÁ≠âÈáè‰πòÊ≥ïÁöÑÂõæÂΩ¢ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ x ÊòØ X ÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåy ÊòØÊ±†‰∏≠ Y ÁöÑÊõ≤Á∫øÊòæÁ§∫ÁöÑÔºå‰∏äÁÇπÁöÑÊñúÁéá‰ª£Ë°®Áé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†º„ÄÇ

ËøôÁî®‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúÄÂ•ΩÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÊù•Ëß£ÈáäÔºö

ÂÅáËÆæ AVAX ‰∏∫ 100 ÁæéÂÖÉÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ AVAXUSDC Áî±**20 ‰∏™ AVAX ÂíåÂ¶ÇÊûú 2000 ‰∏™ USDC**ÁªÑÊàê„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫ 20 ‰∏™ AVAX Âíå 2000 ‰∏™ USDCÔºåËµÑ‰∫ß‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÊØî‰æãÊòØ 1:1„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨**X ‰∏∫ AVAX ÔºåËµÑ‰∫ß Y ‰∏∫ USDC**ÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Â§ö‰ΩøÁî®Ê¨°ÁßØÂàÜÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•ÂæóÂà∞ k = 20 \* 2000 = 40000„ÄÇ

Ëøô‰∏™Êî∂ÁõäÂú®‰∫§Êç¢ÊúüÈó¥‰øùÊåÅ‰∏çÂèòÔºå‰πòÁùÄÂ¢ûÂä†‰∫ÜÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß„ÄÇ

ÈáçÊñ∞ÊéíÂàóyÁöÑÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÂæóÂà∞Êàë‰ª¨y = k/x„ÄÇÂÖëÊç¢ÂêéÊ±†‰∏≠ÁöÑUSDCÊï∞Èáè‰∏∫y = 40000 / (20+5) = 1600 USDC„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•AliceÁî®**5‰∏™AVAXÊî∂Âà∞‰∫Ü400 USDC**„ÄÇ

ËØ•Ê¨æÁé∞Âú®25 AVAX**ÂåÖÂê´1600** USDC„ÄÇAVAXÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÁé∞Ë¥ß‰ª∑Ê†ºÁé∞Âú®‰ªé100 USDCÂèòÊàê1600/25 = 64 USDCÔºàÊÑüË∞¢AliceÂêëÊâÄÊúâ‰∫∫ÂÄæÈîÄ„ÄÇ

Âõ†‰∏∫Êõ≤Á∫øÊòØÂá∏ÂáΩÊï∞ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÂΩì‰Ω†‰πòÈöè‰ª∑Ê†ºÂèòÂåñÊó∂ÔºåÊñúÁéá‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇ

Áúã‰∏ãÂõæ„ÄÇ Êõ≤Á∫øÂú®ÂêÑËá™ÁöÑÊñúÁéáÂíåÈ¢ÑÊµã‰ΩçÁΩÆÁöÑÂΩ±Âìç„ÄÇ

title: Metagrave will overturn the traditional funeral industry!
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-WNuEVc5r5l4u5NfZBfnM.png?height=623&width=1269)

1„ÄÅDevelopment of funeral industry

What is the funeral industry?The Funeral Services Industry is a small industry dedicated to arranging and conducting funerals according to the wishes of its clients.There's¬†an¬†old¬†saying¬†people¬†sleep in the grave¬†when they die, which means¬†people¬†are¬†buried in the earth after death. With the evolution of the times, the funeral industry is also developing,and today there are¬†a variety of graveyards and burial methods.

First,¬†the sea burial¬†is born. Sea Burial is a practice where cremated remains are dispersed into the sea. It breaks through the traditional concept of people¬†sleeping¬†in the grave. People come from nature and return to nature. It is another major reform after burial. Then there is the birth of cremation, which means burning human bodies into ashes and then placing them in a mourning hall or burying them underground. Cremation can be said to be a forced way to produce under the current state of land shortage. Its advantage is that it greatly saves land space, and there is also a sense of ceremony that can express people's sadness.

2„ÄÅMetaverse and Metagrave

Metagrave is a meta-universe graveyard platform based on ETH, BSC, SOL and other public chain technologies.In the world of metagrave, we can build a graveyard to honor¬†dead¬†loved¬†ones as in the real world, and we can also write a family tree to inherit for generations.Metagrave will offer the same ritual items as exhibited in the real world in the form of NFT for honoring our dead relatives, friends, pets, etc.

As the project gets¬†going, Metagrave will be updated from 2D to 3D. At that time, Metagrave will introduce the memorial hall, where users can display beautiful pictures of relatives, friends, pets, etc. These pictures can be photos, videos, sounds, or even 3D models. We will also develop the communication skills for these 3D models.

Metagrave is a milestone in the field of metaverse. In the world of metaverse, metagrave has found a connecting point between people in the virtual world and the real world, meeting an idealized need for people to leave the real world and live in another world. In addition, after the project team quits the NFT sales task, it will decide whether to establish a community department through voting. The community has the right to sell NFT sacrifices. At the same time, during the early financing period, all donated users will have the opportunity to receive generous airdrops from the project.

3„ÄÅMetagrave that overturns the traditional funeral industry

As Metagrave go¬†into¬†the¬†sacrificial industry, the world's ¬•10trillion sacrificial industry is actually being reconstructed by the metaverse. Despite¬†the secular interests, Metagrave has really made the death of a life just a biological¬†death, and human virtual life can exist forever. He has even created a new field, that is,the life technology service industry. At the technical level, Metagrave, like Decentraland, is also based on utilitarianism. Therefore, for the personal assets of players and strong community attributes , Metagrave is even better than Decentraland. And similar virtual real estate platforms in the metaverse often attract users to invest, including the reason for their land price rise, but also because there are some famous people's land right next to them. For the graves of these technology industries, if they are buried next to the graves of celebrities, stars or great men, then this value is immeasurable.

Judging from¬†the company's investment,¬†KFC¬†Capital¬†and¬†Dreamer Capital both¬†participated in the¬†multi-million dollar¬†large-scale financing of¬†Metagrave,¬†which means that some top financial institutions are optimistic about the¬†future¬†development¬†of¬†Metagrave.Capital is always the forerunner, which also shows that the future of the Metaverse graveyard is full of infinite imagination.

title: Liability
body: On the top level of this hierarchy, the central bank serves as the bank of the crown (the state) and of other banks. Gold currency is still the highest form of money, but now it has started to lose its function of medium of exchange, as economic agents use either banknotes or checking accounts for the payments.

title: Debt
body: On the basis of the additional reserve, banks can lend more without having to worry about their own liquidity. The macroeconomic demand is increased through two channels: both the state and private agents can finance their excessive spending by debt.

title: Google‚Äôs new Play Store rules target annoying ads and copycat crypto apps
body:
Google is trying to cut down on annoying, unskippable ads in Android apps and overall bad behavior in the Play Store ([via ](https://techcrunch.com/2022/07/28/google-announces-new-play-store-policies-around-intrusive-ads-impersonation-and-more/)*[TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2022/07/28/google-announces-new-play-store-policies-around-intrusive-ads-impersonation-and-more/)*). The company announced [wide-ranging policy changes](https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/12253906) on Wednesday that update rules across several categories to be more specific, clamping down on loopholes developers may have used to skirt existing rules.

One of the changes that will impact your everyday phone usage the most is for ads. Google says its updated guidelines, which will go into effect on September 30th, help ensure ‚Äúhigh quality experiences for users when they are using Google Play apps.‚Äù The new policy tells developers that apps can‚Äôt pop up a full-screen ad that won‚Äôt let you close it after 15 seconds. There are some exceptions ‚Äî if you voluntarily choose to watch an ad to get some sort of reward points, or if they pop up during a break in the action, those rules won‚Äôt necessarily apply.

Google‚Äôs [current policy](https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/9857753?hl=en&ref_topic=9857752#zippy=%2Cexamples-of-common-violations) says ads ‚Äúmust be easily dismissible without penalty‚Äù and that you have to be able to close out of full-screen ads, but the 15-second benchmark is new. While that‚Äôs still a bit of a wait, it does make it so that you won‚Äôt have to sit through a two-minute long ad where the (tiny, hard to see) ‚Äúx‚Äù only appears after 70 seconds, right in the middle of a game or while trying to do something else.

*One of Google‚Äôs examples of a rule-breaking ad.*

Gif: Google

The new rules also specify that ads shouldn‚Äôt be ‚Äúunexpected,‚Äù popping up right after you load a level or article. Again, the current rules already say that surprise disruptive ads aren‚Äôt allowed, but the new rules give additional concrete examples of violations.

It‚Äôs worth noting that the ad policies for apps [made for children](https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/9898834?hl=en&ref_topic=9877766#zippy=%2Cexamples-of-common-violations) are stricter. While Google‚Äôs not changing a ton about what types of ads developers can show to kids, it will be making some changes to the tools that developers use to deliver those ads, starting in November.

Google‚Äôs also making changes to how apps can implement and use Android‚Äôs built-in VPN (or **v**irtual **p**rivate **n**etwork) tools. Apps won‚Äôt be allowed to implement their own VPNs to collect user data unless they get explicit permission from the user, nor will they be able to use VPNs to help users bypass or change ads from other apps. Mishaal Rahman, a technical editor for Esper, pointed out on Twitter that this [could help clamp down on ad fraud](https://twitter.com/MishaalRahman/status/1552684224595038209?s=20&t=Cj8DBfTEW2lVTmzcM74KaA) where users pretend to be clicking on ads from one country while actually being in another [but says](https://twitter.com/MishaalRahman/status/1552335931666997248) that it could *also* affect things like DuckDuckGo‚Äôs [privacy-focused app tracking protection](https://www.theverge.com/2021/11/20/22793068/duckduckgo-tool-prevent-apps-tracking-android-users).

body: If macroeconomic supply cannot adapt to macroeconomic demand, prices start to increase. What private agents see in this situation is that the purchasing power of their checking accounts or banknotes is falling.

body:

ÁÑ∂ËÄåÔºåËÆæËÆ°ËÄÖÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÈôêÂà∂Ê≤ªÁêÜÂäüËÉΩÁöÑËåÉÂõ¥Êù•ÈôêÂà∂ÊîªÂáªÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄº„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ≤ªÁêÜÂè™ÂåÖÊã¨Êõ¥ÊîπÈ°πÁõÆ‰∏≠Êüê‰∫õÂèÇÊï∞ÁöÑÊùÉÂäõÔºà‰æãÂ¶ÇË¥∑Ê¨æÂçèËÆÆÁöÑÂà©ÁéáÔºâÔºåÈÇ£‰πàÊΩúÂú®ÊîªÂáªÁöÑËåÉÂõ¥Ë¶ÅÊØîÊ≤ªÁêÜÂÖÅËÆ∏ÂØπÊ≤ªÁêÜÊô∫ËÉΩÂêàÁ∫¶ËøõË°åÂÖ®Èù¢ÊéßÂà∂Êó∂Ë¶ÅÁ™ÑÂæóÂ§ö„ÄÇ

### 2„ÄÅÂ¢ûÂä†Ëé∑ÂæóÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÁöÑÊàêÊú¨

È°πÁõÆÊñπËøòÂèØ‰ª•ÈááÂèñÊé™ÊñΩ‰ΩøËé∑ÂæóÊîªÂáªÊâÄÈúÄÁöÑÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÂèòÂæóÊõ¥Âä†Âõ∞Èöæ„ÄÇ‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßË∂äÂº∫ÔºåÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂ∞±Ë∂äÂÆπÊòìËé∑ÂæóÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÔºåËøôÂá†‰πéÊòØËá™Áõ∏ÁüõÁõæÁöÑÔºåÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂèØËÉΩÂ∏åÊúõ‰∏∫‰∫Ü‰øùÊä§Ê≤ªÁêÜËÄåÂáèÂ∞ëÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß„ÄÇ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•Â∞ùËØïÁõ¥Êé•Èôç‰Ωé‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÁü≠ÊúüÂèØ‰∫§ÊòìÊÄßÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÂú®ÊäÄÊúØ‰∏äÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÂèØË°å„ÄÇ

‰∏∫‰∫ÜÈó¥Êé•ÂáèÂ∞ëÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÔºåÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂèØ‰ª•Êèê‰æõÊøÄÂä±Êé™ÊñΩÔºå‰Ωø‰∏™‰∫∫‰ª£Â∏ÅÊåÅÊúâ‰∫∫‰∏çÂ§™ÊÑøÊÑèÂá∫ÂîÆ„ÄÇËøôÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÊøÄÂä±ÊÄßË¥®ÊäºÊù•ÂÆûÁé∞ÔºåÊàñËÄÖÈÄöËøáËµã‰∫à‰ª£Â∏ÅË∂ÖË∂äÁ∫ØÁ≤πÊ≤ªÁêÜÁöÑÁã¨Á´ã‰ª∑ÂÄºÊù•ÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ‰ª£Â∏ÅÊåÅÊúâ‰∫∫Ëé∑ÂæóÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄºË∂äÈ´òÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∞±Ë∂äËÉΩ‰∏éÈ°πÁõÆÁöÑÊàêÂäü‰øùÊåÅ‰∏ÄËá¥„ÄÇ

Áã¨Á´ã‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÂèØËÉΩÂåÖÊã¨‰∫≤Ë∫´ÂèÇ‰∏éÊ¥ªÂä®ÊàñÁ§æ‰∫§‰ΩìÈ™å„ÄÇËá≥ÂÖ≥ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊòØÔºåËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÂØπ‰∏éÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂêà‰ΩúÁöÑ‰∏™‰∫∫Êù•ËØ¥ÊòØÂæàÊúâ‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÂØπÊîªÂáªËÄÖÊù•ËØ¥ÊòØÊó†Áî®ÁöÑ„ÄÇÊèê‰æõËøô‰∫õÂ•ΩÂ§Ñ‰ºöÊèêÈ´òÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂú®Ëé∑Âèñ‰ª£Â∏ÅÊó∂Èù¢‰∏¥ÁöÑÊúâÊïà‰ª∑Ê†ºÔºöÁî±‰∫éÁã¨Á´ãÁöÑÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÔºåÂΩìÂâçÊåÅÊúâ‰∫∫Â∞Ü‰∏çÂ§™ÊÑøÊÑèÂá∫ÂîÆÔºåËøô‰ºöÊèêÈ´òÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰ª∑Ê†ºÔºåÁÑ∂ËÄåÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂ÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂøÖÈ°ª‰ªòÂá∫Êõ¥È´òÁöÑ‰ª£‰ª∑Ôºå‰ΩÜÁã¨Á´ãÂäüËÉΩÁöÑÂ≠òÂú®Âπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÊèêÈ´òÊîªÂáªËÄÖËé∑Âèñ‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄº„ÄÇ

### 3„ÄÅÂ¢ûÂä†ÊâßË°åÊîªÂáªÁöÑÊàêÊú¨

Èô§‰∫ÜÊèêÈ´òÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÁöÑÊàêÊú¨Â§ñÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËøòÂèØ‰ª•ÂºïÂÖ•Êë©Êì¶Ôºå‰ΩøÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂç≥‰ΩøÂú®Ëé∑Âæó‰ª£Â∏ÅÂêé‰πüÊõ¥ÈöæË°å‰ΩøÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉ„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåËÆæËÆ°‰∫∫ÂëòÂèØËÉΩÈúÄË¶ÅÊüêÁßçÁî®Êà∑Ë∫´‰ªΩÈ™åËØÅÊâçËÉΩÂèÇ‰∏éÊäïÁ•®Ôºå‰æãÂ¶Ç KYC Ê£ÄÊü•ÊàñÂ£∞Ë™âÂàÜÊï∞ÈòàÂÄº„ÄÇ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÁîöËá≥ÂèØ‰ª•È¶ñÂÖàÈôêÂà∂Êú™ÁªèËÆ§ËØÅÁöÑÂèÇ‰∏éËÄÖËé∑ÂèñÊäïÁ•®‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑËÉΩÂäõÔºåÂèØËÉΩÈúÄË¶Å‰∏Ä‰∫õÁé∞ÊúâÁöÑÈ™åËØÅËÄÖÊù•ËØÅÊòéÊñ∞ÂèÇ‰∏éÊñπÁöÑÂêàÊ≥ïÊÄß„ÄÇ

‰ªéÊüêÁßçÊÑè‰πâ‰∏äËØ¥ÔºåËøôÊ≠£ÊòØËÆ∏Â§öÈ°πÁõÆÂàÜÈÖçÂÖ∂ÂàùÂßã‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÊñπÂºèÔºåÁ°Æ‰øùÂèó‰ø°‰ªªÊñπÊéßÂà∂ÂæàÂ§ß‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜÁöÑÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉ„ÄÇÔºàÂæàÂ§öÊùÉÁõäËØÅÊòéËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°à‰ΩøÁî®Á±ª‰ººÁöÑÊäÄÊúØÊù•‰øùÊä§ÂÖ∂ÂÆâÂÖ®ÊÄßÔºåÂç≥‰∏•Ê†ºÊéßÂà∂Ë∞ÅÊúâÊùÉËé∑ÂæóÊó©ÊúüÊùÉÁõäÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÈÄêÊ≠•Âéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñÔºâ

ÊàñËÄÖÔºåÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂèØ‰ª•ËøôÊ†∑ÂÅöÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÊîªÂáªËÄÖÊéßÂà∂‰∫ÜÂ§ßÈáèÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Âú®ÈÄöËøáÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°àÊó∂‰ªçÁÑ∂Èù¢‰∏¥ÁùÄÂõ∞Èöæ„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºå‰∏Ä‰∫õÈ°πÁõÆÊúâÊó∂Èó¥ÈîÅÁöÑËÆæÂÆöÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Âú®‰∫§Êç¢ÂêéÁöÑ‰∏ÄÊÆµÊó∂Èó¥ÂÜÖÊó†Ê≥ï‰ΩøÁî®‰ª£Â∏ÅËøõË°åÊäïÁ•®„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåËØïÂõæË¥≠‰π∞ÊàñÂÄüÂÖ•Â§ßÈáè‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂ∞ÜÈù¢‰∏¥È¢ùÂ§ñÊàêÊú¨ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨ÈúÄË¶ÅÁ≠âÂæÖÊâçËÉΩÁúüÊ≠£ÊäïÁ•®ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊäïÁ•®ÊàêÂëòÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊ≥®ÊÑèÂà∞Âπ∂ÈòªÊ≠¢‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÊΩúÂú®ÊîªÂáªÁöÑÈ£éÈô©„ÄÇÂßîÊâòÂú®ËøôÈáå‰πüÂæàÊúâÂ∏ÆÂä©ÔºåÈÄöËøáËµã‰∫àÁßØÊûÅ‰ΩÜÈùûÊÅ∂ÊÑèÁöÑÂèÇ‰∏éËÄÖ‰ª£Ë°®‰ªñ‰ª¨ÊäïÁ•®ÁöÑÊùÉÂà©Ôºå‰∏çÊÉ≥Âú®Ê≤ªÁêÜ‰∏≠ÂèëÊå•ÁâπÂà´ÁßØÊûÅ‰ΩúÁî®ÁöÑ‰∏™‰∫∫Ôºå‰ªçÁÑ∂ÂèØ‰ª•‰∏∫‰øùÊä§Á≥ªÁªüË¥°ÁåÆ‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉ„ÄÇ

‰∏Ä‰∫õÈ°πÁõÆËøò‰ΩøÁî®‰∫ÜÂê¶ÂÜ≥ÊùÉÊú∫Âà∂ÔºåÂÖÅËÆ∏Â∞ÜÊäïÁ•®Êé®Ëøü‰∏ÄÊÆµÊó∂Èó¥Ôºå‰ª•ÊèêÈÜí‰∏çÊ¥ªË∑ÉÁöÑÈÄâÊ∞ëÊ≥®ÊÑèÊΩúÂú®Âç±Èô©ÁöÑÊèêÊ°à„ÄÇÂú®ËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÊñπÊ°à‰∏ãÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÊîªÂáªËÄÖÊèêÂá∫ÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°àÔºåÈÄâÊ∞ë‰πüÊúâËÉΩÂäõÂÅöÂá∫ÂõûÂ∫îÂπ∂ÂÖ≥Èó≠ÂÆÉ„ÄÇËøô‰∫õËÆæËÆ°ËÉåÂêéÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÊòØÔºåÈòªÊ≠¢ÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂÅ∑ÂÅ∑ÈÄöËøáÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°àÔºåÂπ∂‰∏∫È°πÁõÆÁ§æÂå∫Êèê‰æõÊó∂Èó¥Êù•Âà∂ÂÆöÂìçÂ∫î„ÄÇÁêÜÊÉ≥ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÊòéÁ°ÆÁ¨¶ÂêàÂçèËÆÆÂà©ÁõäÁöÑÊèêÊ°à‰∏çÂøÖÈù¢ÂØπËøô‰∫õÈöúÁ¢ç„ÄÇ

‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÂú® Nouns DAO ‰∏≠ÔºåÂê¶ÂÜ≥ÊùÉÊòØÁî± Nouns Âü∫Èáë‰ºöÊåÅÊúâÁöÑÔºåÁõ¥Âà∞ DAO Êú¨Ë∫´ÂáÜÂ§áÂ•ΩÂÆûÁé∞Êõø‰ª£ÊñπÊ°à‰∏∫Ê≠¢„ÄÇÊ≠£Â¶Ç‰ªñ‰ª¨Âú®ÁΩëÁ´ô‰∏äÊâÄÂÜôÁöÑÈÇ£Ê†∑Ôºö

>  
 ‚ÄúNouns Âü∫Èáë‰ºöÂ∞ÜÂê¶ÂÜ≥ÈÇ£‰∫õÁªô Nouns DAO Êàñ Nouns Âü∫Èáë‰ºöÂ∏¶Êù•ÈáçÂ§ßÊ≥ïÂæãÈ£éÈô©ÊàñÂ≠òÂú®È£éÈô©ÁöÑÊèêÊ°à„ÄÇ‚Äù

\*\*\*

È°πÁõÆÊñπÂøÖÈ°ªËææÊàêÂπ≥Ë°°Ôºå‰ª•ÂÖÅËÆ∏ÂØπÁ§æÂå∫ÂèòÂåñÔºàÊúâÊó∂ÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÂèóÊ¨¢ËøéÔºâ‰øùÊåÅ‰∏ÄÂÆöÁ®ãÂ∫¶ÁöÑÂºÄÊîæÊÄßÔºåÂêåÊó∂‰∏çÂÖÅËÆ∏ÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°à‰ªéÁºùÈöô‰∏≠Ê∫úËµ∞„ÄÇÈÄöÂ∏∏Êù•ËØ¥ÔºåÂè™ÈúÄË¶Å‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°àÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÂçèËÆÆÂ§±ÊïàÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Ê∏ÖÊ•öÂú∞‰∫ÜËß£Êé•ÂèóÂíåÊãíÁªùÊèêÊ°àÁöÑÈ£éÈô©ÊùÉË°°Ëá≥ÂÖ≥ÈáçË¶Å„ÄÇÂΩìÁÑ∂ÔºåÂú®Á°Æ‰øùÊ≤ªÁêÜÂÆâÂÖ®Âíå‰ΩøÊ≤ªÁêÜÊàê‰∏∫ÂèØËÉΩ‰πãÈó¥Â≠òÂú®ÁùÄÈ´òÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÁöÑÊùÉË°°ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫‰ªª‰ΩïÂºïÂÖ•Êë©Êì¶‰ª•ÈòªÊ≠¢ÊΩúÂú®ÊîªÂáªËÄÖÁöÑÊú∫Âà∂ÔºåÂΩìÁÑ∂‰πü‰ºö‰ΩøÊ≤ªÁêÜËøáÁ®ãÊõ¥ÂÖ∑ÊåëÊàòÊÄß„ÄÇ

Êàë‰ª¨Âú®ËøôÈáåÊ¶ÇËø∞ÁöÑËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÔºå‰ªã‰∫éÂÆåÂÖ®Âéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñÊ≤ªÁêÜÂíå‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂçèËÆÆÁöÑÊï¥‰ΩìÂÅ•Â∫∑ËÄåÁâ∫Áâ≤ÈÉ®ÂàÜÂéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñ‰πãÈó¥„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÊ°ÜÊû∂Âº∫Ë∞É‰∫ÜÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂú®ÂØªÊ±ÇÁ°Æ‰øùÊ≤ªÁêÜÊîªÂáª‰∏ç‰ºöÊúâÂà©ÂèØÂõæÊó∂ÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄâÊã©ÁöÑ‰∏çÂêåË∑ØÂæÑ„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨Â∏åÊúõÁ§æÂå∫Â∞Ü‰ΩøÁî®ËØ•Ê°ÜÊû∂ÈÄöËøáËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÂÆûÈ™åËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•ÂºÄÂèëËøô‰∫õÊú∫Âà∂Ôºå‰Ωø DAO Âú®Êú™Êù•Êõ¥Âä†ÂÆâÂÖ®„ÄÇ

body:
> Ê≥®ÔºöÂéüÊñáÊù•Ëá™ a16zÔºå‰ΩúËÄÖÊòØ Pranav Garimidi, Scott Duke Kominers ‰ª•Âèä Tim¬†RoughgardenÔºåÊú¨ÊñáÁî±DeFi‰πãÈÅìÁøªËØëÁºñËæë„ÄÇ

È°πÁõÆÊñπËøòÂèØ‰ª•ÈááÂèñÊé™ÊñΩ‰ΩøËé∑ÂæóÊîªÂáªÊâÄÈúÄÁöÑÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÂèòÂæóÊõ¥Âä†Âõ∞Èöæ„ÄÇ‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßË∂äÂº∫ÔºåÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂ∞±Ë∂äÂÆπÊòìËé∑ÂæóÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÔºåËøôÂá†‰πéÊòØËá™Áõ∏ÁüõÁõæÁöÑÔºåÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂèØËÉΩÂ∏åÊúõ‰∏∫‰∫Ü‰øùÊä§Ê≤ªÁêÜËÄåÂáèÂ∞ëÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß„ÄÇ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•Â∞ùËØïÁõ¥Êé•Èôç‰Ωé‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÁü≠ÊúüÂèØ‰∫§ÊòìÊÄßÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÂú®ÊäÄÊúØ‰∏äÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÂèØË°å„ÄÇ

‰∏∫‰∫ÜÈó¥Êé•ÂáèÂ∞ëÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÔºåÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂèØ‰ª•Êèê‰æõÊøÄÂä±Êé™ÊñΩÔºå‰Ωø‰∏™‰∫∫‰ª£Â∏ÅÊåÅÊúâ‰∫∫‰∏çÂ§™ÊÑøÊÑèÂá∫ÂîÆ„ÄÇËøôÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÊøÄÂä±ÊÄßË¥®ÊäºÊù•ÂÆûÁé∞ÔºåÊàñËÄÖÈÄöËøáËµã‰∫à‰ª£Â∏ÅË∂ÖË∂äÁ∫ØÁ≤πÊ≤ªÁêÜÁöÑÁã¨Á´ã‰ª∑ÂÄºÊù•ÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ‰ª£Â∏ÅÊåÅÊúâ‰∫∫Ëé∑ÂæóÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄºË∂äÈ´òÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∞±Ë∂äËÉΩ‰∏éÈ°πÁõÆÁöÑÊàêÂäü‰øùÊåÅ‰∏ÄËá¥„ÄÇ

Áã¨Á´ã‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÂèØËÉΩÂåÖÊã¨‰∫≤Ë∫´ÂèÇ‰∏éÊ¥ªÂä®ÊàñÁ§æ‰∫§‰ΩìÈ™å„ÄÇËá≥ÂÖ≥ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊòØÔºåËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÂØπ‰∏éÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂêà‰ΩúÁöÑ‰∏™‰∫∫Êù•ËØ¥ÊòØÂæàÊúâ‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÂØπÊîªÂáªËÄÖÊù•ËØ¥ÊòØÊó†Áî®ÁöÑ„ÄÇÊèê‰æõËøô‰∫õÂ•ΩÂ§Ñ‰ºöÊèêÈ´òÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂú®Ëé∑Âèñ‰ª£Â∏ÅÊó∂Èù¢‰∏¥ÁöÑÊúâÊïà‰ª∑Ê†ºÔºöÁî±‰∫éÁã¨Á´ãÁöÑÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÔºåÂΩìÂâçÊåÅÊúâ‰∫∫Â∞Ü‰∏çÂ§™ÊÑøÊÑèÂá∫ÂîÆÔºåËøô‰ºöÊèêÈ´òÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰ª∑Ê†ºÔºåÁÑ∂ËÄåÔºåËôΩÁÑ∂ÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂøÖÈ°ª‰ªòÂá∫Êõ¥È´òÁöÑ‰ª£‰ª∑Ôºå‰ΩÜÁã¨Á´ãÂäüËÉΩÁöÑÂ≠òÂú®Âπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÊèêÈ´òÊîªÂáªËÄÖËé∑Âèñ‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄº„ÄÇ

### 3„ÄÅÂ¢ûÂä†ÊâßË°åÊîªÂáªÁöÑÊàêÊú¨

Èô§‰∫ÜÊèêÈ´òÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÁöÑÊàêÊú¨Â§ñÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËøòÂèØ‰ª•ÂºïÂÖ•Êë©Êì¶Ôºå‰ΩøÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂç≥‰ΩøÂú®Ëé∑Âæó‰ª£Â∏ÅÂêé‰πüÊõ¥ÈöæË°å‰ΩøÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉ„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåËÆæËÆ°‰∫∫ÂëòÂèØËÉΩÈúÄË¶ÅÊüêÁßçÁî®Êà∑Ë∫´‰ªΩÈ™åËØÅÊâçËÉΩÂèÇ‰∏éÊäïÁ•®Ôºå‰æãÂ¶Ç KYC Ê£ÄÊü•ÊàñÂ£∞Ë™âÂàÜÊï∞ÈòàÂÄº„ÄÇ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÁîöËá≥ÂèØ‰ª•È¶ñÂÖàÈôêÂà∂Êú™ÁªèËÆ§ËØÅÁöÑÂèÇ‰∏éËÄÖËé∑ÂèñÊäïÁ•®‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑËÉΩÂäõÔºåÂèØËÉΩÈúÄË¶Å‰∏Ä‰∫õÁé∞ÊúâÁöÑÈ™åËØÅËÄÖÊù•ËØÅÊòéÊñ∞ÂèÇ‰∏éÊñπÁöÑÂêàÊ≥ïÊÄß„ÄÇ

‰ªéÊüêÁßçÊÑè‰πâ‰∏äËØ¥ÔºåËøôÊ≠£ÊòØËÆ∏Â§öÈ°πÁõÆÂàÜÈÖçÂÖ∂ÂàùÂßã‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÊñπÂºèÔºåÁ°Æ‰øùÂèó‰ø°‰ªªÊñπÊéßÂà∂ÂæàÂ§ß‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜÁöÑÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉ„ÄÇÔºàÂæàÂ§öÊùÉÁõäËØÅÊòéËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°à‰ΩøÁî®Á±ª‰ººÁöÑÊäÄÊúØÊù•‰øùÊä§ÂÖ∂ÂÆâÂÖ®ÊÄßÔºåÂç≥‰∏•Ê†ºÊéßÂà∂Ë∞ÅÊúâÊùÉËé∑ÂæóÊó©ÊúüÊùÉÁõäÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÈÄêÊ≠•Âéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñÔºâ

ÊàñËÄÖÔºåÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂèØ‰ª•ËøôÊ†∑ÂÅöÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÊîªÂáªËÄÖÊéßÂà∂‰∫ÜÂ§ßÈáèÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Âú®ÈÄöËøáÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°àÊó∂‰ªçÁÑ∂Èù¢‰∏¥ÁùÄÂõ∞Èöæ„ÄÇ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºå‰∏Ä‰∫õÈ°πÁõÆÊúâÊó∂Èó¥ÈîÅÁöÑËÆæÂÆöÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Âú®‰∫§Êç¢ÂêéÁöÑ‰∏ÄÊÆµÊó∂Èó¥ÂÜÖÊó†Ê≥ï‰ΩøÁî®‰ª£Â∏ÅËøõË°åÊäïÁ•®„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåËØïÂõæË¥≠‰π∞ÊàñÂÄüÂÖ•Â§ßÈáè‰ª£Â∏ÅÁöÑÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂ∞ÜÈù¢‰∏¥È¢ùÂ§ñÊàêÊú¨ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨ÈúÄË¶ÅÁ≠âÂæÖÊâçËÉΩÁúüÊ≠£ÊäïÁ•®ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊäïÁ•®ÊàêÂëòÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊ≥®ÊÑèÂà∞Âπ∂ÈòªÊ≠¢‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÊΩúÂú®ÊîªÂáªÁöÑÈ£éÈô©„ÄÇÂßîÊâòÂú®ËøôÈáå‰πüÂæàÊúâÂ∏ÆÂä©ÔºåÈÄöËøáËµã‰∫àÁßØÊûÅ‰ΩÜÈùûÊÅ∂ÊÑèÁöÑÂèÇ‰∏éËÄÖ‰ª£Ë°®‰ªñ‰ª¨ÊäïÁ•®ÁöÑÊùÉÂà©Ôºå‰∏çÊÉ≥Âú®Ê≤ªÁêÜ‰∏≠ÂèëÊå•ÁâπÂà´ÁßØÊûÅ‰ΩúÁî®ÁöÑ‰∏™‰∫∫Ôºå‰ªçÁÑ∂ÂèØ‰ª•‰∏∫‰øùÊä§Á≥ªÁªüË¥°ÁåÆ‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÊäïÁ•®ÊùÉ„ÄÇ

‰∏Ä‰∫õÈ°πÁõÆËøò‰ΩøÁî®‰∫ÜÂê¶ÂÜ≥ÊùÉÊú∫Âà∂ÔºåÂÖÅËÆ∏Â∞ÜÊäïÁ•®Êé®Ëøü‰∏ÄÊÆµÊó∂Èó¥Ôºå‰ª•ÊèêÈÜí‰∏çÊ¥ªË∑ÉÁöÑÈÄâÊ∞ëÊ≥®ÊÑèÊΩúÂú®Âç±Èô©ÁöÑÊèêÊ°à„ÄÇÂú®ËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÊñπÊ°à‰∏ãÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÊîªÂáªËÄÖÊèêÂá∫ÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°àÔºåÈÄâÊ∞ë‰πüÊúâËÉΩÂäõÂÅöÂá∫ÂõûÂ∫îÂπ∂ÂÖ≥Èó≠ÂÆÉ„ÄÇËøô‰∫õËÆæËÆ°ËÉåÂêéÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÊòØÔºåÈòªÊ≠¢ÊîªÂáªËÄÖÂÅ∑ÂÅ∑ÈÄöËøáÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°àÔºåÂπ∂‰∏∫È°πÁõÆÁ§æÂå∫Êèê‰æõÊó∂Èó¥Êù•Âà∂ÂÆöÂìçÂ∫î„ÄÇÁêÜÊÉ≥ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÊòéÁ°ÆÁ¨¶ÂêàÂçèËÆÆÂà©ÁõäÁöÑÊèêÊ°à‰∏çÂøÖÈù¢ÂØπËøô‰∫õÈöúÁ¢ç„ÄÇ

‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÂú® Nouns DAO ‰∏≠ÔºåÂê¶ÂÜ≥ÊùÉÊòØÁî± Nouns Âü∫Èáë‰ºöÊåÅÊúâÁöÑÔºåÁõ¥Âà∞ DAO Êú¨Ë∫´ÂáÜÂ§áÂ•ΩÂÆûÁé∞Êõø‰ª£ÊñπÊ°à‰∏∫Ê≠¢„ÄÇÊ≠£Â¶Ç‰ªñ‰ª¨Âú®ÁΩëÁ´ô‰∏äÊâÄÂÜôÁöÑÈÇ£Ê†∑Ôºö

>
