\*\*\*

È°πÁõÆÊñπÂøÖÈ°ªËææÊàêÂπ≥Ë°°Ôºå‰ª•ÂÖÅËÆ∏ÂØπÁ§æÂå∫ÂèòÂåñÔºàÊúâÊó∂ÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÂèóÊ¨¢ËøéÔºâ‰øùÊåÅ‰∏ÄÂÆöÁ®ãÂ∫¶ÁöÑÂºÄÊîæÊÄßÔºåÂêåÊó∂‰∏çÂÖÅËÆ∏ÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°à‰ªéÁºùÈöô‰∏≠Ê∫úËµ∞„ÄÇÈÄöÂ∏∏Êù•ËØ¥ÔºåÂè™ÈúÄË¶Å‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊÅ∂ÊÑèÊèêÊ°àÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÂçèËÆÆÂ§±ÊïàÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Ê∏ÖÊ•öÂú∞‰∫ÜËß£Êé•ÂèóÂíåÊãíÁªùÊèêÊ°àÁöÑÈ£éÈô©ÊùÉË°°Ëá≥ÂÖ≥ÈáçË¶Å„ÄÇÂΩìÁÑ∂ÔºåÂú®Á°Æ‰øùÊ≤ªÁêÜÂÆâÂÖ®Âíå‰ΩøÊ≤ªÁêÜÊàê‰∏∫ÂèØËÉΩ‰πãÈó¥Â≠òÂú®ÁùÄÈ´òÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÁöÑÊùÉË°°ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫‰ªª‰ΩïÂºïÂÖ•Êë©Êì¶‰ª•ÈòªÊ≠¢ÊΩúÂú®ÊîªÂáªËÄÖÁöÑÊú∫Âà∂ÔºåÂΩìÁÑ∂‰πü‰ºö‰ΩøÊ≤ªÁêÜËøáÁ®ãÊõ¥ÂÖ∑ÊåëÊàòÊÄß„ÄÇ

Êàë‰ª¨Âú®ËøôÈáåÊ¶ÇËø∞ÁöÑËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÔºå‰ªã‰∫éÂÆåÂÖ®Âéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñÊ≤ªÁêÜÂíå‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂçèËÆÆÁöÑÊï¥‰ΩìÂÅ•Â∫∑ËÄåÁâ∫Áâ≤ÈÉ®ÂàÜÂéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñ‰πãÈó¥„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÊ°ÜÊû∂Âº∫Ë∞É‰∫ÜÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂú®ÂØªÊ±ÇÁ°Æ‰øùÊ≤ªÁêÜÊîªÂáª‰∏ç‰ºöÊúâÂà©ÂèØÂõæÊó∂ÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄâÊã©ÁöÑ‰∏çÂêåË∑ØÂæÑ„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨Â∏åÊúõÁ§æÂå∫Â∞Ü‰ΩøÁî®ËØ•Ê°ÜÊû∂ÈÄöËøáËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÂÆûÈ™åËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•ÂºÄÂèëËøô‰∫õÊú∫Âà∂Ôºå‰Ωø DAO Âú®Êú™Êù•Êõ¥Âä†ÂÆâÂÖ®„ÄÇ

title: Mozhi Says
body:
10\.9

If money is credit, then consensus is money.

If regulation hurries into an area, this area will experience the last madness.

10\.11

If our wallet address becomes ID, will we become ‚Äú‰∏â‰Ωì‰∫∫‚ÄùÔºü

10\.14

We, human beings, are always tending to overestimate long-term technology progress. Like we thought we would have space travel by now 50 years ago, but we only have smart phones. However, we always underestimate short-term technology progress, like what blockchain could do to reform our existing system.

10\.20

Security tokenizes, or token securitizes. Same thing.

10\.21

Foreseeing the future is one thing; knowing the timing is another. I couldn‚Äôt agree more.

\-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

11\.1

In crypto, is code really law? Hard to say. But information is power.

11\.2

Two things must be scarce in metaverse: attention and computing power. I don‚Äôt want ANY company to own both. Cause I am not in that company.

11\.3

If it looks like a dead end, it‚Äôs because you look at it in the wrong way. So, stand higher, or push harder, there‚Äôs always a way. Personally, I prefer the former.

11\.3

Under promise and over deliver. Quite like us.

11\.8

Popa in the pool,

Swimming like a fool,

A tool, a wool,

I think it‚Äôs cool.

11\.9

Governors are smart, don‚Äôt underestimate them. It‚Äôs not them want to regulate. It‚Äôs the common people. They need time to accept innovation. They are the ones resist new things. And during most times, they are right. Just not this time. We need to be more patient and consistent. No real advance comes at its first try. We focus on the silent middle, and welcome them to take a shot.

11\.10

Armies, Gold, Flags? The most powerful thing in the world is stories. So, where is your story with Sypool? Cz I have a lot.

11\.15

Right, we couldn‚Äôt leave the earth by dragging our own hair. But since we have stand on the ground, why do we still dream of flying?

12\.1

Every pain would become a gain somewhere in the future, take it easy, we need time to enrich ourselves.

\-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

12\.3

I like its ending, everyday is Day 1.

12\.3

WAGMI. We‚Äôre all gonna make it.

12\.14

Don‚Äôt love your stock, and your token. Decide on Status quo, not past emotion. Hard but a must.

\-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1\.7

It finally comes, no matter how we expected. Every one gambles, but long lives the diversified portfolio.

1\.18

Buy because of need not like; marry because of love not need.

1\.25

The market crushes. Again. Then we realize how crypto becomes more and more similar  to hi-tech company stock. And The prize is not only driven by fomo or regulation, but also peace and war on the other side of the Earth. I say that‚Äôs a progress: the more it related, the stronger it would be.

1\.26

Few lives over a hundred years; many worry like a thousand years‚Äô old. Nothing stays unchanged.

‰∫∫Áîü‰∏çËøáÁôæÔºåÂ∏∏ÊÄÄÂçÉÂ≤ÅÂøß„ÄÇ

2\.11

During the Gold Rush, It‚Äôs a good business to sell shovel and jeans. When developers are digging crypto gold, let‚Äôs sell them infrastructure.

2\.16

I have been thinking about the run-away from ETH. The more I thought, the more I believed it‚Äôs a fake question. End-user wouldn‚Äôt care, cuz they need Dapps, not specific pub chains. With the easiness of cross chain and CEX, moving to a new eco couldn‚Äôt be easier. So, the real question would be for new Dapp developers, which chain would they deploy their Dapp on first? For this industry‚Äôs status quo, the more innovative a project is, the more necessary it should choose ETH.

3\.2

‚ÄúReminder: Ethereum is neutral, but I am not.‚Äù

We are all not.

3\.7

AC has gone.

We stay.

3\.8

Ironically, blockchain doesn‚Äôt belong to everyone. When the dragon killer becomes the dragon, why am I not surprised?

3\.11

Network, social value, pricing model, it seems I‚Äôve found something big.

3\.12

Come with hope, and leave with nothing. Isn‚Äôt that what life should be? Right, rabbithole jumpers? (PS level 7)

3\.15

Every story has another side. We have plans, but others have theirs as well.

3\.25

The deeper I dive into crypto, the more frequently I get lost in the market‚Äôs ups and downs. Abnormal returns are everywhere, and it‚Äôs tired to chasing waves. Pick the hard road, cuz it‚Äôs the right thing to do.

4\.1

Solana is back.

4\.13

Timing: quit because of success, not of failure.

5\.7

Now I‚Äôm thinking of DAO. I miss Satoshi, nothing‚Äôs more DAO than BTC.

5\.9

Classification means two things: source and destination.

5\.15

Today I brought some LUNA. Here is how I manage my expection: I wouldn‚Äôt regret I bought too little if the price returns to historical high, either I wouldn‚Äôt regret I bought too much if it turns zero. How about that?

5\.20

I was reviewing BAYC‚Äôs former announcements. Have to admit this ending maked me smile, might try it some time.

‚ÄúWe didn't think this was that confusing, but we're just four dudes who haven't slept in days.‚Äù

5\.23

‚ÄúPessimists are always right; but only optimists could succeed.‚Äù A stand-up comedian.

Be optimistic, be reasonable, and be successful.

6\.4

Recent research: DAO= core + outside staker + option

6\.10

‚ÄúA storm is coming, so we need the best talents with us to survive.‚Äù

When it rains and you don‚Äôt have an umbrella, sing in the rain.

7\.1

Finished a Web3 report, built something bigger than myself; left something in my record.

7\.6

A friend of mine saidÔºöAfter tasting watermelon and peach, he is soul-binded with this summer. I think he is right, but what‚Äôs more is the singing of cicadas, the shadow of the tree, and the one I miss.

7\.13

Today I was figuring out the regulation systems on Web3. And I made it.

Finally, it comes to a rule: Minimized judgement is the best valution, cuz feeling is an over-symplified and a black box of reasoning.

7\.21

Today, I was arguing with a friend about relationships and cooperations. And all of a sudden, I realized the answer to a long-haunting question of my dad. He once tried to convince me to be nice with everyone and have a good relationship with everyone, so one day, you will never know who would help you or give you a chance or cooperate with you.

I was biologically against it, I believed good relationship could only be developed from cooperations, so be fair to everyone, and don‚Äôt trying to remain a good relation with them, instead, trying to look for cooperation chance with everyone in different aspect.

At that time, we ended up unpleasantly.

Years later, until today, I found we were both right in different ways and under different circumstances. His method was under a small community where everyone was familar with each other. Being labeled ‚Äúnice‚Äù is a good way to get advantage. (And his job is a dentisit which requires a lot of acquaintances‚Äô relationships. On the contray, mine was suitable in a more stranger-like society, we need to cooperate with strangers from all over the world. So, have boundary, be fair, not be nice. Just like what we are doing in a DAO.

On thought of that, I found a bit more peace.

7\.26

Digitialization is not necessarily good, we just don‚Äôt have a choice.

7\.29

I found an explanation for the ‚Äúseeing mountain‚Äù theory. 

The thery is built to describe differnet levels of cognition. The first level is, that when you see a mountain, it is just a mountain. The second level is that when you see it, what you see is more than a mountain. The third level is that a mountain is still a mountain.

It‚Äôs more easy-describing in Chinese.

But it is also the process of diving into an area. First it is a necessity to focus on certain isolated spots, or events. That‚Äôs when a mountain is just a mountain. Then, those spots begins to connect with each other until they become a network. That‚Äôs the perspective of system making a mountain more than a mountain. Finally, when the network become more and more stable and tight, every spot could be abstracted as several simple principles. That‚Äôs how a mountain turns back to a mountain.

Êà™Ê≠¢Âà∞Ê≠§Ôºå [geth](https://github.com/HugePages/go-ethereum/tree/master/cmd/geth) ‰∏≠Áõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶Å‰ª£Á†ÅÂ∑≤Áªè‰∫ÜËß£Â§ßÊ¶ÇÔºåÂêéÁª≠Á©øÊèí‰∫ÜËß£ËÆ∞ÂΩïÂÖ≥‰∫é `cmd` Ê®°Âùó‰∏≠ÂÖ∂‰ªñÂëΩ‰ª§ÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶Å‰ª£Á†Å„ÄÇÂêéÁª≠ËßÑÂàí‰∫ÜËß£ `geth` ÁöÑ‰∏öÂä°Ê†∏ÂøÉ‰ª£Á†Å (ÂàóË°®Â¶Ç‰∏ãüëáÔºâÔºö

1. Âü∫Á°ÄÁªÑ‰ª∂ÔºàÂØÜÁ†ÅÂ≠¶„ÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∫èÂàóÂåñ/ÂèçÂ∫èÂàóÂåñ„ÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂ≠òÂÇ®ÔºâÔºö
   1. üîñ rlp - ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂ∫èÂàóÂåñ-ÈÄíÂΩíÁ∫øÊÄßÂâçÁºÄ(Recursive Linear Prefix)Ê®°Âùó
   2. üîñ trie - ÊîπËøõÁöÑÈªòÂÖãÂ∞î+ÂâçÁºÄÊ†ë MPT(Merkle Patricia Tries)
   3. ‚ùáÔ∏è ethdb - ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂ†ÜÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ìÁöÑÊìç‰Ωú‰ª£Á†Å,ÂåÖÂê´‰∫ÜlevelDBÂíåÂÜÖÂ≠òÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ì
   4. ‚ùáÔ∏è common - ÂÖ¨Áî®Â∑•ÂÖ∑,Â¶Ç:debug„ÄÅÊï∞Â≠¶Áõ∏ÂÖ≥„ÄÅbitÂ∑•ÂÖ∑Á≠â
   5. ‚ùáÔ∏è internal - È°πÁõÆÂÜÖÈÉ®‰ΩøÁî®Â∑•ÂÖ∑‰ª£Á†Å,Â¶ÇÊûÑÂª∫„ÄÅdebug„ÄÅË∞ÉÁî®ÊúçÂä°API„ÄÅÊµãËØïÊåáÂçó„ÄÅÊµãËØïÊó•Âøó„ÄÅweb3jsÊâ©Â±ïÁ≠â
2. ÁΩëÁªúÂ±ÇÔºàp2p„ÄÅrpcÔºâÔºö
   1. üîñ p2p - ÁÇπÂØπÁÇπÁΩëÁªúÂçèËÆÆÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÂÆûÁé∞
   2. üîñ rpc - ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäRPCÊúçÂä°   
3. ‰∏öÂä°Â±ÇÔºàË¥¶Êà∑‰ΩìÁ≥ª„ÄÅ‰∫§Êòì„ÄÅÂÖ±ËØÜÊú∫Âà∂„ÄÅgas„ÄÅevmÁ≠âÔºâÔºö
   1. üîñ accounts - ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁöÑÈí±ÂåÖ„ÄÅÂú∞ÂùÄ„ÄÅË¥¶Âè∑Á≥ªÁªü,‰∏çÂêå‰∫é Bitcoin ÁöÑ UTXO Ê®°Âºè
   2. üîñconsensus - ÂÖ±ËØÜÊú∫Âà∂,ÂÆûÁé∞‰∏çÂêåÁöÑ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂÖ±ËØÜÊú∫Âà∂ÂºïÊìé
   3. ‚ùáÔ∏è core - Á≥ªÁªüÊ†∏ÂøÉÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÁªìÊûÑÂíåÂü∫Á°ÄÊ®°Âùó,Â¶Ç ËôöÊãüÊú∫ „ÄÅÁä∂ÊÄÅÊ®°Âùó„ÄÅÊâπÈáèÊï∞ÊçÆÁöÑÂ∏ÉÈöÜËøáÊª§Âô® „ÄÅRawDB„ÄÅÊ±áÁºñÊ®°Âùó
   4. ‚ùáÔ∏è eth - ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂçèËÆÆÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÊ®°Âùó,ÂåÖÂê´‰∫ÜËäÇÁÇπÂèëÁé∞„ÄÅÂÖ®ËäÇÁÇπÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∏ãËΩΩ„ÄÅethÈÖçÁΩÆ„ÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆËé∑Âèñ(base header„ÄÅ‰∫§Êòì„ÄÅÂå∫Âùó)„ÄÅÂçèËÆÆ(ÂπøÊí≠„ÄÅÁÇπÂØπÁÇπÁ≠â)„ÄÅgasÊ®°Âùó
   5. üîñminer - Êèê‰æõ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁöÑÂå∫ÂùóÂàõÂª∫ÂíåÊåñÁüø

‚ùáÔ∏è :  Á©øÊèíÂú®ÂÖ∂‰ªñÊ®°Âùó‰∫ÜËß£„ÄÅÂàÜÊûê‰ª£Á†Å„ÄÇ

body: Money is created by the members of the banking system in three ways: ‚Ä¢ by granting loans either in a non-securitised or in a securitised form, ‚Ä¢ by buying foreign exchange, ‚Ä¢ by buying securities on the secondary market (i.e. issued securities).

title: What I think about NFT : [from a 16-year-old student]-1
body:
## What is NFT ?

NFT aka Non-Fungible Token. Not like ETH or BTC are FT(Fumgible Token), every NFT can only exsist one on blockchain in smart contract. 

![Is this NFT ? haha, yes mate](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0UlxQdWX2qG2mHDe-t-Rh.jpg?height=640&width=960)

### What knid of things can be NFT ?

Like JPGS, vedios, articles, magzines, books, ID cards and even ticktes can be NFT. 

Maybe after something become NFT will be ~~ex**pen**sive~~

![hahaha](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OpO7kq68hx-YdQyGGMn_C.png?height=426&width=452)

### What is the NFT use for ?

NFT can be Identify of memberships, prove of ownership, translate prove, profile picture, luxury.

### Can NFT be copied ?

physically it can copy and download to your computer of phone. But it only have one JPGS in blockchain. although many copies aroung the world, real owner will actually own the NFT. it depend on the information on blockchain in smart contract.

![Nooooo my NFT](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/BVaItP7TyCgUrF9Hb3z5E.jpg?height=817&width=800)


---

Currently PFP NFT is like the identify of community. Some people take NFT as a method of making money(called flip). As a result,  now people are consider more about art, famous or not, do celebrities buy and whatnot.

### How can we explain to elderly?

For me maybe I will explain like that. I will compare those web2 big brand with NFT project. Like: Those NFT like some brands in our life such as Nike, rulax‚Ä¶ those NFT project will become a web3 brand in the end. but they will reach by growing community, let holders decide want to do next and let everyone become part of the brand. Not only user but also the creater and promoter. NFT is the uprate web2 brand.And like the web2 brand, there are many small or big brand even fake or similar project. So want we can do is to be careful and trust the brand we like.

## What I expect NFT ?

### Advantages:

I think NFT can use in many different kinds of aspect. In our daily life, we can live with NFT. maybe when we are born, we can have a NFT ID card and record every information with us or even everyone can have a personal blockchain. In the school, our score, activities and so on. Companies can also make their stock as a NFT. So many ways we can use.

### Disadvantages:

If wallet or blockchain get hacked, everything we have will gone. And privacy problems are also should be pay attention. In one word, Be careful, Be auspect and be awareness.

title: Commercial
body: In these cases, a commercial bank from the second level of the banking system creates money. However, the costumer might be a commercial bank as well, in this case, it is the central bank who creates money. Out of the three methods of money creation, buying foreign exchange and buying securities are secondary.

title: What I think about NFT : [from a 16-year-old student]-1
body:
## What is NFT ?

NFT aka Non-Fungible Token. Not like ETH or BTC are FT(Fumgible Token), every NFT can only exsist one on blockchain in smart contract.

![Is this NFT ? haha, yes mate](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0UlxQdWX2qG2mHDe-t-Rh.jpg?height=640&width=960)

### What knid of things can be NFT ?

Like JPGS, vedios, articles, magzines, books, ID cards and even ticktes can be NFT.

Maybe after something become NFT will be ~~ex**pen**sive~~

![hahaha](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OpO7kq68hx-YdQyGGMn_C.png?height=426&width=452)

### What is the NFT use for ?

NFT can be Identify of memberships, prove of ownership, translate prove, profile picture, luxury.

### Can NFT be copied ?

physically it can copy and download to your computer of phone. But it only have one JPGS in blockchain. although many copies aroung the world, real owner will actually own the NFT. it depend on the information on blockchain in smart contract.

![Nooooo my NFT](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/BVaItP7TyCgUrF9Hb3z5E.jpg?height=817&width=800)


---

Currently PFP NFT is like the identify of community. Some people take NFT as a method of making money(called flip). As a result,  now people are consider more about art, famous or not, do celebrities buy and whatnot.

### How can we explain to elderly?

For me maybe I will explain like that. I will compare those web2 big brand with NFT project. Like: Those NFT like some brands in our life such as Nike, rulax‚Ä¶ those NFT project will become a web3 brand in the end. but they will reach by growing community, let holders decide want to do next and let everyone become part of the brand. Not only user but also the creater and promoter. NFT is the uprate web2 brand.And like the web2 brand, there are many small or big brand even fake or similar project. So want we can do is to be careful and trust the brand we like.

## What I expect NFT ?

### Advantages:

I think NFT can use in many different kinds of aspect. In our daily life, we can live with NFT. maybe when we are born, we can have a NFT ID card and record every information with us or even everyone can have a personal blockchain. In the school, our score, activities and so on. Companies can also make their stock as a NFT. So many ways we can use.

### Disadvantages:

If wallet or blockchain get hacked, everything we have will gone. And privacy problems are also should be pay attention. In one word, Be careful, Be auspect and be awareness.

Thanks mates for reading, Those want I say are NFA, please DYOR

You can find me here:

[https://www.instagram.com/](https://www.instagram.com/)

[https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100083999348237](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100083999348237)

# Weekly Roundup - Week #30

In this weeks roundup we take a look at the first project on the APENFT marketplace launchpad, dive into what a DAO is and look at 3 exciting Web3 projects currently not getting the recognition they might deserve.

¬†

# DappRadar Mobile App Now Available in Public Beta - 2 MIN READ

The mobile app gives users access to the most vital features of DappRadar, and we will add more features in the coming months.

ÊåâÂå∫ÂüüËßÇÂØüÔºåÂåóÁæé‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÊòØÈ£éÊäï‰∫§ÊòìÁöÑÁÉ≠ÁÇπÂú∞Âå∫ÔºåÊà™Ëá≥ 6 ÊúàÔºåÈ£éÊäï‰∫§ÊòìÈ¢ùÁ∫¶‰∏∫114 ‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÔºåËÄåÂéªÂπ¥ÂÖ®Âπ¥‰∏∫ 156 ‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉ„ÄÇÂú®Â§ßÂûãÊäïËµÑÊ°à‰∏≠Ôºå1 ÊúàÔºå‰∏ªÊâìÁæéÂõΩÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÁöÑÂä†ÂØÜËµÑ‰∫ß‰∫§ÊòìÂπ≥Âè∞FTXÁ≠πÈõÜ‰∫Ü4‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÔºõ3 ÊúàÔºåÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÂºÄÂèëÂïÜ ConsenSys ÂÆåÊàê‰∫Ü4.5 ‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑËûçËµÑÔºõ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúàÂêéÔºåÁ®≥ÂÆöÂ∏ÅÂèëË°åÂïÜCircle Á≠πÈõÜ‰∫Ü4 ‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉ„ÄÇËÄåÂú®Ê¨ßÊ¥≤Ôºå‰ªäÂπ¥‰∏äÂçäÂπ¥Â∑≤ÁªèÊúâ22 ‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑÈ£éÈô©ÊäïËµÑÊ≥®ÂÖ•Âä†ÂØÜË°å‰∏ö„ÄÇ

‰ªéËµÑÈáëËßÑÊ®°ÁúãÔºåÂåÖÊã¨Âä†ÂØÜËµÑ‰∫ß‰∫§ÊòìÂπ≥Âè∞Âú®ÂÜÖÁöÑCeFi‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÊòØËûçËµÑËßÑÊ®°ËæÉÈ´òÁöÑË°å‰∏ö„ÄÇÊú¨Âë®Ôºà7Êúà22Êó•Ëá≥28Êó•ÔºâÔºåËé∑ÂæóËûçËµÑÁöÑCeFiÂä†ÂØÜËµÑ‰∫ß‰ºÅ‰∏öÁ±ªÂûãÊ∂µÁõñ‰∫§ÊòìÂπ≥Âè∞„ÄÅ‰∫§ÊòìÁ≠ñÁï•Âπ≥Âè∞„ÄÅÂÄüË¥∑Âπ≥Âè∞„ÄÅËµÑ‰∫ßÊâòÁÆ°ÂíåÈí±ÂåÖÊúçÂä°ÂïÜÁ≠â„ÄÇ

ËÄåÊú¨Âë®ÔºåÂê∏ÂºïÂ§ßÈ¢ùÊäïËµÑÁöÑÈ¢ÜÂüü‰ªçÁÑ∂ÈõÜ‰∏≠Âú®Web3Ë°å‰∏öÔºåÈô§‰∫ÜËØ∏Â¶ÇÂÆâÂÖ®„ÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÁ≠âÊäÄÊúØÊúçÂä°ÂïÜÂ§ñÔºåË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÂ§öÁöÑÂ∫îÁî®Á±ªÂÖ¨Âè∏Ëé∑ÂæóËûçËµÑÔºåÂú∫ÊôØÂåÖÊã¨Â™í‰ΩìÁ±ªÂ∫îÁî®„ÄÅÁ§æ‰∫§Á±ªÂ∫îÁî®„ÄÅÂüüÂêçÊúçÂä°Á±ªÁ≠â„ÄÇÁõ∏ËæÉËÄåË®ÄÔºåDeFi„ÄÅÈìæÊ∏∏„ÄÅNFTÂú∫ÊôØÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÂØπÈ£éÊäïÁöÑÂê∏ÂºïÂäõ‰∏ãÈôçÔºå‰ΩÜÂçï‰∏™È°πÁõÆÁöÑËûçËµÑÈ¢ùËæÉÈ´ò„ÄÇ

> **Web3.0ËµõÈÅì**

*   **Coinfeeds**

CoinfeedsÁî± Moyi Dang Âíå Bhavya Agarwal ÂÖ±ÂêåÂàõÁ´ãÔºåÊó®Âú®ÈÄöËøá NLPÔºàËá™ÁÑ∂ËØ≠Ë®ÄÂ§ÑÁêÜÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÁî®Êú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†Êù•ÂâñÊûêÊñáÊú¨ÁöÑÁªìÊûÑÂíåÂê´‰πâÔºâÊù•ËÅöÂêàÂåÖÊã¨ Twitter„ÄÅDiscord„ÄÅTelegram Á≠â‰∏çÂêåÁ§æ‰∫§ÁΩëÁªúÁöÑÊåáÊ†áÂíåËßÅËß£Ôºå‰ª•Â∏ÆÂä©‰ºÅ‰∏ö„ÄÅÊäïËµÑËÄÖÂíå Web3 Áî®Êà∑ÂÅöÂá∫Êõ¥ÊúâÊïàÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÈ©±Âä®ÂÜ≥Á≠ñ„ÄÇ

7Êúà26Êó•Ê∂àÊÅØÔºåWeb3 Èü≥‰πêÂàùÂàõÂÖ¨Âè∏ SpiderVille ÂÆ£Â∏ÉÂÆåÊàê 100 ‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑpre-seed ËΩÆËûçËµÑÔºåÈü≥‰πêÁü•ËØÜ‰∫ßÊùÉÂü∫ÈáëÂèäÁßëÊäÄÂÖ¨Âè∏Contents Technologies„ÄÅ ‰∏âÊòüÁîµÂ≠êÂÖ¨Âè∏È£éÈô©ÊäïËµÑÈÉ®Èó® Samsung Next Âíå‰∏ÄÊâπÂ§©‰ΩøÊäïËµÑ‰∫∫ÂèÇÊäï„ÄÇ

*   **Fanzee**

7Êúà25Êó•Ê∂àÊÅØÔºåÂü∫‰∫éTONÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÁöÑÁ≤â‰∏ùÂπ≥Âè∞Fanzee ÂÆåÊàê 200 ‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉÁßçÂ≠êËΩÆËûçËµÑÔºåTONcoin.fundÂíå First Stage Labs È¢ÜÊäïÔºåÂÖ∂‰ªñÊäïËµÑÊñπÂåÖÊã¨ MEXC Pioneer„ÄÅHuobi„ÄÅKuCoin Ventures„ÄÅVLG Digital„ÄÅOrbs.comÁ≠â„ÄÇËØ•Âπ≥Âè∞Â∞ÜÊääËµÑÈáëÁî®‰∫éÂõ¢ÈòüÂèëÂ±ï„ÄÅÂèëÂ±ïÂÖ∂‰ΩìËÇ≤Ëø∑ÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåÂä†Âø´Âπ≥Âè∞ÂºÄÂèë„ÄÇ

> **CeFiË°å‰∏ö**

*   **CLST**

CLSTÊó®Âú®ÈÄöËøá‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÁΩëÁªú‰∏∫ÂØπÂÜ≤Âü∫Èáë„ÄÅË¥∏ÊòìÂÖ¨Âè∏„ÄÅËµÑ‰∫ßÁÆ°ÁêÜÂÖ¨Âè∏ÂíåÈì∂Ë°åÂú®ÂÜÖÁöÑÊú∫ÊûÑÊèê‰æõÊï∞Â≠óËµÑ‰∫ßÊäµÊäºÂìÅÁÆ°ÁêÜÂäüËÉΩÔºåÂåÖÊã¨Ëá™Âä®ÂåñÊó†ÊäµÊäºÂÄüË¥∑ÂíåÁü≠ÊúüÂÄüË¥∑Â∏ÇÂú∫‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰ª∑Ê†ºË∞àÂà§ÂíåÁªìÁÆó„ÄÇ

*   **Sumo Signals**

Sumo SignalsÊèê‰æõÁã¨ÁâπÁöÑ‰∫∫Â∑•Êô∫ËÉΩÂ•óÂà©‰∫§ÊòìÊåáÊ†áÔºåÂ∏ÆÂä©Âä†ÂØÜ‰∫§ÊòìËÄÖÊâßË°åÊúâÂà©ÂèØÂõæÁöÑ‰∫§Êòì„ÄÇËØ•‰∫ßÂìÅÁî±Êó•Êú¨Â∑•Á®ãÂ∏àÂõ¢ÈòüÂºÄÂèë„ÄÇSumo ÁöÑ AI Êú∫Âô®‰∫∫ÊØèÂ§©Êèê‰æõÊï∞‰ª•ÂçÉËÆ°ÁöÑÂ•óÂà©‰ø°Âè∑‰æõ‰∫§ÊòìËÄÖÈÄâÊã©„ÄÇËøô‰∫õÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫‰ΩøÁî®‰∫∫Â∑•Êô∫ËÉΩÁ≠õÈÄâÊï∞ÁôæÁßçÂä†ÂØÜËµÑ‰∫ßÔºåÂØªÊâæ‰π∞ÂÖ•ÊàñÂçñÂá∫‰ø°Âè∑„ÄÇËøô‰∫õ‰∫∫Â∑•Êô∫ËÉΩÊú∫Âô®‰∫∫Êó®Âú®Â¢ûÂä†ÊúâÂà©ÂèØÂõæÁöÑ‰∫§ÊòìÊú∫‰ºöÂπ∂ÂáèÂ∞ëÂπ≥ÂùáÊçüÂ§±„ÄÇ

*   **Atato**

title: Digital Objects
body:
We imbue our dreams with the flow of time,,,

Blocks sit along each other and it‚Äôs rhythm persists.

To craft, an index of knowledge; an archive sought.

Can we see now? Can we touch?

Travelling with us, without. Among us, without.

title: CoinEx Futures Video Competition Concluded After Triggering a Trading Boom
body:
To give back to its loyal futures users and to provide more futures traders with a chance to share their skills and present themselves, CoinEx launched the CoinEx Futures Video Competition on June 22, 2022, with a huge prize pool. Participants could win incredible rewards by uploading original YouTube videos featuring CoinEx Futures as required by the competition.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ekd5PVAgUyxvxRwaIHqHj.png?height=646&width=1034)

After the event was launched, CoinEx received thousands of well-made videos from global users. You can search for \[CoinEx Futures\] on YouTube to check out these excellent works. In addition, the competition also started a futures trading boom on CoinEx. During the event, many users experienced the futures trading process on CoinEx to make their videos. More importantly, they made extra bucks by trading futures and were amazed by CoinEx Futures.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mL2nd6I6VkN9NGPBWWL-w.png?height=392&width=716)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/gIvic0StH1K5FGDVGLmN4.png?height=426&width=742)

Of the entries submitted by CoinEx‚Äôs global users, many participants recorded and illustrated how they traded futures on CoinEx (Web & App). Meanwhile, some participants also introduced the features of CoinEx Futures to help out beginners. Some other participants also shared their trading experiences and strategies with other futures investors in light of the current market environment. Based on the views and feedback of these entries, many more crypto users, except for the participants, have learned about CoinEx Futures via the competition.

The competition assessed the entries from multiple dimensions and determined one First Prize Winner ($1,500 prize), one Second Prize Winner ($1,000 prize), and one Third Prize Winner ($500 prize). In addition, CoinEx also offered a $2,000 excellence prize, which was equally shared by 20 outstanding participants.

Participants of the competition won prizes, shared experiences with other crypto investors, and learned more about CoinEx. For CoinEx, the event has not only enhanced its ties with users and increased its user stickiness but also helped it collect feedback about CoinEx Futures from users across the globe. As evidenced by the competition, CoinEx has always put users first and is never blindly driven by financial gains during the five years of growth. As it brings secure, stable, and reliable trading experiences to crypto adopters, the exchange has also provided them with more benefits and helped users grow as the platform advances.

As crypto platforms suffer constant security breaches, CoinEx, with a zero-accident record, has earned the recognition of over 3 million crypto users worldwide. Moreover, the exchange is committed to making crypto trading easier. With user-friendly, convenient operations and smooth, reliable, stable trading experiences, CoinEx Futures has been praised by plenty of futures investors and won their recognition.¬†

Although the CoinEx Futures Video Competition rounded off, CoinEx has not stopped giving away more benefits to futures traders. The CoinEx Futures Trading Competition is heating up, and users could join the event now to share the incredible prize pool! Additionally, the CoinEx Futures Star Ambassador Program is also coming soon, and users could win 60% referral commissions by asking friends to trade futures on CoinEx! Users can also follow CoinEx on SNS platforms to learn more about the relevant events. Despite the current bearish conditions, CoinEx will be there for general crypto investors through thick and thin and bring them more benefits. Meanwhile, the exchange will also prepare itself for the next crypto bull together with users and seek further success.

title: Zero-Knowledge-Proof Mining
body:
The definition of ZKP is very broad. According to ‚Äú[Why and How zk-SNARK Works](https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.07221),‚Äù there is a **prover** who wants to convince a **verifier** that some **statement** is true, and the ZKP protocol should satisfy three properties:

1. Completeness ‚Äî if the **statement** is true then a **prover** can convince a **verifier**
2. Soundness ‚Äî a cheating **prover** can not convince a **verifier** of a false **statement**
3. Zero-knowledge ‚Äî the interaction only reveals if a **statement** is true and nothing else

A ZKP protocol

For example, Alice wants to convince Bob that she knows Carol‚Äôs phone number. She calls Carol. Then Carol‚Äôs phone rings and shows it‚Äôs Alice calling. In this way, Alice proves to Bob her knowledge of the phone number without revealing what the number is. It is also a ZKP protocol.

When we talk about ZKP in the context of blockchain, it often refers to a particular branch of algorithms within the definition. These algorithms are called zkSNARKs (Zero-Knowledge Succinct Non-Interactive Argument of Knowledge) in most cases and have the following properties.

1. **Non-Interactive** proving process. The proving process only needs the prover to send a **proof** to the verifier.
2. **Succinct** proof. The **proof** has a small size, and verifiers can quickly verify it.
3. **Programmable** statement. The algorithm can convert any **statement** into a [QAP](https://medium.com/@VitalikButerin/quadratic-arithmetic-programs-from-zero-to-hero-f6d558cea649) (Quadratic Arithmetic Program) for proving.

You can refer to ‚Äú[awesome zero knowledge proofs](https://github.com/matter-labs/awesome-zero-knowledge-proofs)‚Äù for detailed ZKP algorithms used in blockchains. Their development follows such a trend: the computation speed is getting faster, the reliance on the ‚Äú[trusted setup](https://vitalik.ca/general/2022/03/14/trustedsetup.html)‚Äù is getting lower, and the proof size is getting smaller. Some algorithms and their related projects are listed as follows.

1. **Pinocchio** (ZCash Sprout version): the earliest introduction of ZKP to the blockchain.
2. **Groth16** (ZCash Sapling version, Filecoin): faster than Pinocchio.
3. **ZK-STARKs** (StarkWare): no trusted setup.
4. **PLONK** (zkSync), **Marlin** (Aleo): universal trusted setup
5. **Halo 2** (ZCash NU5 version): no trusted setup, recursive

ZKP has properties suitable for the blockchain. First, compared to other proving systems like Merkle proof and signatures, ZKP is able to prove any statement, bringing varieties to the on-chain logic. Second, its proof is succinct, costing less gas when verified on-chain.

The earliest usage of ZKP emphasizes its feature of zero-knowledge, proving transaction validities without revealing any transaction information, for example, ZCash. Later, ZKP experienced a bottleneck period. People find that blockchain privacy is not strongly needed, and ZKP is not user-friendly because it takes a long time to compute.

Recently, ZKP regained people‚Äôs attention because of its usage in blockchain scalability. By proving the validity of a large piece of data, ZKP scales the computation and storage capacities of the blockchain. Some proved data and their related projects:

1. L2 transactions: zk-Rollup projects like zkSync, StarkWare
2. L1 transactions: Mina
3. Off-chain data: Filecoin

Discussions on ZKP are very lively these days. [Paradigm](https://www.paradigm.xyz/2022/04/zk-hardware) analyzes the hardware acceleration of ZKP and thinks FPGA is better than GPU and ASIC. [a16z](https://a16z.com/2022/04/15/zero-knowledge-proofs-hardware-decentralization-innovation/) summarizes an overview of the ZKP. Presentations at ‚Äú[Zero Knowledge Summit Amsterdam](https://youtu.be/SCIuwh9ya8U)‚Äù provide many thoughts and new ideas on ZKP.

## Mining

This year, Ethereum will switch from PoW to PoS so that the blockchain mining market will shrink significantly. Although storage mining has emerged in recent years, including Filecoin, Chia, and Arweave, it is still unable to meet the market vacancy caused by the exit of Ethereum.

On the other hand, ZKP has some early applications in blockchain mining. There is a marketplace in [Mina](https://docs.minaprotocol.com/en/architecture/snark-workers) for ZKP workers to submit their generated proofs to earn tokens. In [Filecoin](https://spec.filecoin.io/#section-algorithms.pos.porep), miners need to generate ZKP for every data sector stored off-chain, thus gaining storage power.

Mina ZKP marketplace

We can see that traditional hash mining is surrounded by controversies about energy-wasting, meaningless computation. Therefore, the blockchain area is trying to find a meaningful mining method. The properties of ZKP (proving arbitrary statement, complex proving but simple verification) provide more possibilities to the blockchain mining market.

# Opportunities

We are focusing on some ZKP mining projects this year.

## Filecoin

Filecoin leverages ZKP to prove off-chain data through algorithms named [Proof of Replication](https://spec.filecoin.io/#section-algorithms.pos.porep) and [Proof of Spacetime](https://spec.filecoin.io/#section-algorithms.pos.post). We think Filecoin mining will continue to be popular this year for three reasons:

1. Due to its [economic model](https://filfox.info/en/stats/miner), the sector pledge has decreased from 0.25 to 0.16 FIL in the past year.
2. The price of FIL has dropped significantly, further reducing its mining cost.
3. The roadmap of [FVM](https://fvm.filecoin.io/) smart contracts brings a positive signal to the project.

Sector Initial Pledge Variations (FIL/32GiB)

## Aleo

Aleo starts the first ‚ÄúProof of ZKP‚Äù mining mode in which the miner‚Äôs computing power is determined by how many proofs it can compute per unit of time. The mining algorithm is named [PoSW](https://developer.aleo.org/advanced/posw/posw/) (Proof of Succinct Work) and can be described in short as follows:

```
pseudo_random(zk_prove(nonce)) < target_difficulty
```

`zk_prove()` is to generate a proof of ‚Äúthe current block containing its transactions‚Äù with `nonce` as its input. `target_difficulty` is adjusted according to the computing power of the whole network. You can see that PoSW and PoW are mostly the same, with the only difference being that PoW computes hashes while PoSW computes ZKPs.

In addition, Aleo developed the first ‚Äúprivate smart contracts‚Äù Leo. Although there are other ZKP-based smart contracts like zkSync‚Äôs zkEVM, StarkWare‚Äôs Cairo, and Mina‚Äôs zkApps, none of them support privacy.

## Decentralized ZK-Rollups

Current designs of ZK-Rollups are centralized: only specific operators can submit transaction batches and validity proofs to L1. [Vitalik](https://vitalik.ca/general/2021/01/05/rollup.html) gives several suggestions for making the operator decentralized, like sequencer auction, random selection from PoS set, and DPoS voting. Both [zkSync](https://docs.zksync.io/userdocs/decentralization.html) and [StarkNet](https://starkware.co/starknet/) have clear roadmaps to decentralized ZK-Rollups. There are also some cutting-edge researches, like [Polygon Hermes](https://ethresear.ch/t/proof-of-efficiency-a-new-consensus-mechanism-for-zk-rollups/11988), [StarkNet](https://community.starknet.io/t/starknet-decentralization-tendermint-based-suggestion/998), [PoVP](https://ethresear.ch/t/a-design-of-decentralized-zk-rollups-based-on-eip-4844/12434), and [taikocha.in](http://taikocha.in/).

Decentralized ZK-Rollups bring a new mining mode: miners can submit their generated proofs and thus earn rewards. It‚Äôs similar to the ZKP marketplace in Mina. But the marketplace is not the best solution since some proofs will be wasted due to no one buying. We need a parallel computing architecture for ZKP to aggregate power from all miners.

title: Tetu and Outcome‚Äôs TVL KPI Options: a win for liquidity & strategic community initiatives
body:
The team at [Outcome.Finance](http://outcome.finance/) and the [SuperUMAn DAO](https://twitter.com/SuperUmans?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor) are excited to support a new collaboration that will empower users to deposit TETU as collateral in UMA, and mint options tokens empowered and secured by UMA‚Äôs optimistic oracle, known as KPI options.

These KPI Options track the TVL of the UMA-USDC LP on [TetuSwap](https://app.tetu.io/). In the settlement, users will be able to claim TETU in case of profit from the options.

> *KPI options will earn a profit if the TVL of the UMA-USDC LP reaches a target TVL on the Expiry Date. Once minted the KPI options tokens can only be redeemed on expiry date.*

KPI options are among the suite of optimistic DAO tooling of Outcome.Finance.

## What is Outcome.Finance?

Outcome.Finance uses UMA‚Äôs optimistic oracle (OO) to secure various DAO tools to help DAOs achieve better outcomes. Outcome uses this data as the foundation for a collection of incentives and governance tools, and KPI options are among them.

These tools are available to DAOs directly, but are also white labeled and offered by other protocols.

## Showcasing the value of KPI options

KPI options allow DAO teams to tokenize their preferred KPI metric to align incentives such as TVL, and achieve specific Outcomes. KPI options metrics can be tracked on DefiLlama, subgraph or any other API as long as it is open sourced and provides a consistent view of historical state to be verified through the OO.

DAO teams can select the desired payout function that would translate the raw value of the KPI metric to the payout amount for token holders based on previously provided parameters. Currently, KPI options support binary options, linear functions and stepwise payouts subject to reaching predefined KPI milestones.

> *This particular collaboration demonstrates that Outcome‚Äôs toolings, empowered by UMA‚Äôs OO, can thrive in the multi-chain ecosystem while showcasing UMA‚Äôs overall support for the SuperUMAn‚Äôs strategic decision to engage with Polygon.*

The integration of KPI options will expand the provision of liquidity on Polygon while the OO will remain secure in its foundational voting system. This not only shows that KPI options work, but also that Tetu is effective at spinning up advantage and marketplace access to swap KPIs quickly and with little friction.

## Community growth a key part of optimistic DAO tooling

Outcome‚Äôs KPI options were also created with the aim of providing the growth of several DeFi Project communities. By the very structure of the KPI options, every KPI option holder has an incentive to grow that KPI because their option will be worth more.

title: The State of Decentralized Storage (Progress)
body:
As the centralized services have become an increasingly critical part of how we live our lives online, so the need for alternatives becomes ever greater. Humanity will need a better internet that can harness the web infrastructure far more efficiently. That‚Äôs where project like [Filecoin](https://www.filecoin.com/) and [Arweave](https://www.arweave.org/) comes in, let‚Äôs dig in!.

# Demystifying Storage

Internet is increasingly centralized, fragile and inefficient. Most cloud storage services are provided by companies that have absolute control ([centralized data monopolies](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/amazon-web-services-outage-cloud-b1762074.html)) over the data stored on their servers and suffers from vulnerable choke-points (poor data safety).

This model requires users to trust the service provider. [They must trust the company](https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/06/technology/amazon-apple-facebook-google-antitrust-report.html) to not modify the stored data nor censor them by denying access to the service. Furthermore, the users have no way of verifying that the data has not been manipulated since it was uploaded unless they have a copy of the original data.

## Filecoin vs Arweave

Thanks to its decentralized nature, the power of the network lies in its community. Filecoin itself isn't the gatekeeper for storage, the community is. In short, Filecoin allows anyone to rent-out free space on their computer to other users who are looking to store data. It can be thought as similar to the Airbnb model, which allows anyone to rent out a room in their house or even the entire house.

Filecoin is a decentralized peer-to-peer network that allows its users to store and retrieve data on the internet, robust foundation to store the world most valuable data sets and alternative to conventional cloud storage services. An alternative to costly cloud storage with open platform and a market economy that allowing users to take advantage (store, request, and transfer data) of its unmatched network capabilities via a verifiable marketplace.

The four key features that Filecoin bundles together:

1. **Connects clients with storage providers**

   Clients and storage providers make deals (i.e., storage agreements) to store or retrieve data using [FIL as the medium of exchange](https://docs.filecoin.io/about-filecoin/how-filecoin-works/); connects people who have excess storage space with people who want to store data, efficiently priced (minimizing financial barriers) and geographically decentralized storage.
2. **The network is completely [open-source](https://github.com/filecoin-project/community#forums)**

   Enabling people from all over the world to participate, meaning that anyone can store data on the network or become a storage provider. The price of storage depends on supply and demand.
3. **Built on [InterPlanetary File System (IPFS)](https://ipfs.io/)**

   Using Filecoin directly requires technical skills, protocols can be built on top of Filecoin and IPFS ([adds economic incentives to store files on IPFS](https://docs.filecoin.io/about-filecoin/ipfs-and-filecoin/)). These protocols make interacting with the blockchain easier.
4. **The Filecoin protocol runs on an advanced and novel proof system**

   A blockchain that incentivizes its miners (i.e. node operators) to store other users data in return for block rewards paid in Filecoin (FIL) tokens using a combination of [Proof of Spacetime (PoSt) and Proof of Replication (PoRep)](https://filecoin.io/filecoin.pdf), to provide unmatched efficiency and reliability. The miners store data and have to provide frequent cryptographic proofs for it. Users can verify that their data is stored correctly by looking at the cryptographic proofs on the blockchain.

Over the previous decade, advances in blockchain technology have enabled applications that were not possible before. Storing valuable data including sensitive information on another machine may appear suspicious at first glance. It is feasible to establish a large-scale data storage network utilizing modern blockchain technology, where it is practically difficult to modify the stored data without breaking the chain.

With Filecoin, they breaks down the data before storing it to ensure that attackers cannot access the data saved by anyone anywhere in the network. As a result, if a malicious actor attempts to access a file stored in the system, they will only see nonsensical data fragments.

![How the Filecoin network operates](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/msIY7ysRjR7zTdVnq7Rp_.png?height=705&width=1160)

There is an enormous amount of data information available, and it is critical to be able to authenticate its veracity. For example, government documents, laws and other legal documents, scientific data and reports, cultural heritage, etc. Moreover, many people‚Äôs trust in institutions, governments, and companies has diminished, creating a demand for trustless ways of storing data.

The global cloud storage market is dominated by large tech companies such as Amazon, Microsoft, and Google. These companies‚Äô cloud infrastructure services‚Äô combined yearly revenue exceeds 100 billion USD, although this number includes both storage and computing.

![Circulating market caps of notable cloud storage services built on blockchain](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dA2cYo9tiamfBVXAWz25A.png?height=832&width=1456)

Filecoin competes with large tech companies, conventional tech startups, and other blockchain protocols. Its on-chain competitors include Akash Network, Arweave, Siacoin, and Storj. Filecoin is the largest cloud storage service built on blockchain as measured by storage capacity or valuation, but how much do we have to play with?

## F\*undamentalizatorrrr

Filecoin generates revenue by charging fees for computation, storage, and transactions on the blockchain. The fees are paid in FIL. A fraction of the fees are burnt to reduce the supply of FIL, while the remaining is paid to miners. Potential future revenue streams for storage providers may include other fees, such as fees from smart contract apps or decentralized compute services.

![Distribution of FIL](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tf0WwlCdqdaXbWL7cgp2T.png?height=832&width=1456)

The maximum supply of FIL is 2 billion, of which 220 million are in circulation. As indicated in the diagram above, the tokens are allocated to miners, Protocol Labs, investors, and the Filecoin Foundation. Protocol Labs, investors, and the Filecoin Foundation are on a 6-year linear vesting schedule. The miners will receive the tokens allocated to them as block rewards over several decades depending on network usage. The price of FIL, shown in the figure below, peaked in April 2021 and has since fallen near its ICO price.

![Price of FIL](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/EksswnGvRZd6IjjWZK2ZQ.png?height=413&width=992)

The figure below shows Filecoin‚Äôs circulating market cap (i.e. the amount of FIL in circulation multiplied by its price) and total revenue (i.e. fees paid). Filecoin‚Äôs revenue also peaked in April 2022 with 264% growth as active storage deals grew 128% and network storage capacity grew 7%. However it‚Äôs still whopping 74% lower on year-over-year basis.

![Filecoin‚Äôs circulating market cap and total revenue](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jgSxnEfvMJwP8Gy9zX9of.png?height=439&width=994)

Filecoin‚Äôs relatively low current revenue is partially explained by a [protocol upgrade](https://filecoin.io/blog/posts/filecoin-v13-hyperdrive-network-upgrade-unlocks-10-25x-increase-in-storage-onboarding/) that increased the blockchain throughput by an order of magnitude (a mechanism to scale throughput to 10‚Äì25x of its original capacity) and by the Chinese authorities‚Äô crackdown on cryptocurrency mining.

A key implication protocol upgrade was that storage proofs were aggregated, which significantly reduced congestion and freed up blockspace. While the protocol upgrade benefited most network participants, it hurt the protocol revenue because it led to a reduction in transaction fees.

The network‚Äôs storage capacity has also kept growing, increasing the supply of storage and reducing its cost. The figure below shows how the fees are split between the protocol (i.e. FIL tokenholders) and supply-side participants (i.e. miners). Burning a portion of the fees is comparable to a share buyback and thus counted as protocol revenue, although, supply-side revenue decreased 4% in FIL terms year-over-year, corresponding to a 48% decline in USD terms. Near-zero storage fees impacted supply side revenue since it limited storage providers revenue to just block rewards and tips.

![Distribution of revenue between the protocol and supply-side participants.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YCkCMc-rG2o_u61Kx82IO.png?height=832&width=1456)

Regardless of overall market conditions, Filecoin‚Äôs committed storage capacity has [grown steadily during the past year](https://filecoin.io/blog/posts/filecoin-news-46/) reached over 17.8EiB. This network capacity is equivalent to more than centralized entity. Filecoin‚Äôs storage capacity is supplied by over 4,000 decentralized storage providers distributed around the globe (supply dynamics tell only one side of the story about the network activity. The other side is told through Filecoin demand in the context of actively stored data).

## Catasthrope

Filecoin continue to onboard demand, it stands a chance to be a prominent provider of decentralized storage and cloud services for Web3 and traditional apps. While decentralized storage is still in its early days, the Filecoin ecosystem continues to thrive, as over +1460 projects are currently being built on Filecoin. Filecoin is being leveraged by several use cases, including:

* NFTs
* Web3
* Gaming
* Metaverse
* Audio/Video.

In the future, the adoption of decentralized storage solutions and the integration of smart contracts built on top may open the door to novel applications. Open data initiatives and decentralized compute may enable the next generation of apps beyond storage. Filecoin‚Äôs main goal is to prove its reliability as a storage provider and potentially become an enabler of a wide range of data-intensive services.

title: Belief systems + web3 (...and magic)
body:
*Context: most weeks, I go to [Gitcoin‚Äôs Public Library](https://gitcoin.co/), a nourishing Wednesday chat where a different host proposes an obsession or idea and the group talks it through. This is a write-up of mine ‚Äî not a formal talk or proposal as such, but a funny fragment of an idea that‚Äôs been circulating around my head.*

When I was a kid, I was obsessed with TV magicians.

I grew up in a very small village in the English countryside in the 1980s and I spent a lot of that decade watching cheesy older men in suits perform close-up sleight of hand or the ol‚Äô three ball trick. It didn‚Äôt matter that the only people who looked like me on screen were getting sawn in half, wearing feathers and a frozen smile; in a life that‚Äôs so far been full of brilliant rabbit holes it‚Äôs clear that magic is one of my longest-standing fascinations.

![Paul Daniels; the OG cheesy British magician](https://media.giphy.com/media/QRwGbYHWGwafm/giphy.gif)

*What does this have to do with technology?* I used to ask myself (you‚Äôre probably thinking something similar).

Well, let‚Äôs start by defining our terms. I‚Äôve always thought of magic in two ways; there‚Äôs *performative magic* and *belief magic*.

Performative magic is one of the most honest exchanges between people; whether it‚Äôs you and a card shark on the street today, or Houdini escaping from handcuffs in the East River a hundred years ago, in both cases you‚Äôre watching artists perform what you both call *tricks*. The magic happens in the ether between the magician or performer and the audience. The audience, whether one person or a hundred, knows they‚Äôre being fooled and is delighted by it.

The history of performative magic, and how social changes have impacted it, is fascinating. Such as how the growth of railroads led to the rise of travelling magicians, who often dealt in unorthodox medical cures on the side (cocaine toothache drops, anyone?) or how in the late Victorian era, many historians link the rise of seances to women seeking more economic freedom in the field of spiritualism.

But this piece is about belief magic, which [Merriam-Webster](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/magic) defines as ‚Äúthe use of means (such as charms or spells) believed to have supernatural power over natural forces‚Äù and especially how belief magic is represented in culture. After all, culture, from films to books to art, has always shaped society, just as we shape it. We lack deep decent research on the actual take-up and practice of belief magic and how widespread certain belief systems were, but in a post-graduate degree I did on representations of magic in culture, it was clear magic flourishes in destabilising times.¬†

Think back to that cheesy older man above in his tux. In the 80s, the UK had a cartoon villain of a leader in Margaret Thatcher; London‚Äôs financial centre, the City, grew as our unions weakened; and by the end of the decade, raves were dawning as an expression of anti-establishment fury as the social mobility many families like mine had benefited from was already fading away.

Think Salem in the 1690s, with clashing groups trying to build a world they thought was new. Or, more recently, [covens casting spells](https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2019/aug/07/monsters-men-magic-trump-awoke-angry-feminist-witches) to prevent Trump‚Äôs re-election.

Especially, magic flourished during the British Renaissance. It‚Äôs an era I love, with huge leaps forward in invention and knowledge-sharing like the printing press, double-entry accounting and the humble pencil. In a fit of pique, Henry VIII broke with Rome and forged a new religion. New countries and continents were explored and exploited. And England felt under threat at home and abroad, with multiple conflicts with Scotland, France, Spain, and beyond.

Critically, for part of this time, the UK had a female monarch, Queen Elizabeth I, who was both highly educated and visibly unmarried. In the conventions of the era, poets and writers (nearly all men) would write stories celebrating their King for his vigour and intellect. I‚Äôm generalising, of course (get in touch with me if you want to nerd out), but women were celebrated for being wives and mothers. As the ruler was seen to subvert nature, as some would have it, we also see an incredible outpouring of the supernatural in the cultural artefacts of the era, from Prospero in *the Tempest*, to *Dr Faustus*, the *Witch of Edmonton*, and many more.

The witches, wizards and magicians in plays and books both thrilled and scared their audiences, and most got their comeuppance by the end of the story.

The monarch who followed Elizabeth I was King James I , who was so obsessed with witches as a source of all evil in the world that he wrote the notorious book [Daemonologie (a study of witchcraft) ](https://www.bl.uk/collection-items/king-james-vi-and-is-demonology-1597) and kickstarted the witch trials that would see thousands of people, nearly all women, tried and executed in the following decades.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vwDFRFz262gIVJ0VASYiJ.png?height=1060&width=1352)

Why have institutions such as the church and the state always been so threatened by magic?

Part of the answer derives from who practices it; again, there are few robust studies of the trials, but less than 15% of those executed were men. Often the women prosecuted were unmarried and intelligent, while lacking the formal education given to their male peers. Often, these women knew herbal remedies to heal ailments or talked back to men in authority.

And magical knowledge tends to be passed from person to person, rather than disseminated top down.

Both then and now, belief magic is ultimately decentralised and community-led (just ask a modern practitioner how they feel about the [Magic Circle](https://themagiccircle.co.uk/)‚Äôs elitism). Just like the homemade pamphlets that circulated and enabled citizens to criticise the monarchy or church, their information channels do not rely on conventional means.

*As institutions have tried to exert control over the masses, magic is an attempt ‚Äî often by marginalised people in society ‚Äî to subvert that control.*

At its heart, belief magic is a combination of *community knowledge + solidarity networks + folklore.*

By community knowledge, I mean beliefs, truths and cures passed down over time.

By solidarity networks, I mean acting with trust, in small self-selecting groups.

By folklore, I mean the ritualistic repetition of the first to build the second.

You can see the line I‚Äôm drawing between the act or art of belief magic and what it means to be working in any emergent technology space; especially this emergent space we call web3, trying to build all three elements at once from the ashes of past scenes that didn‚Äôt feel so magical.

Or maybe that‚Äôs unfair. Because of when I was born (1980), I grew up both analogue and digital. Even as I began working as a community builder for startups and in big tech, the technology industry developed experiences and conveniences beyond my wildest dreams.

You push a button and a taxi arrives (that may not sound like a wild dream, but you try growing up in a rural area).

You can ask a supercomputer for any obscure topic, and some kind of answer will appear. You open a product and it delights you.

You meet your partner through a funny Twitter account in a way that feels so standard in 2022 but felt intensely magical at the time.

But, over time, these tricks began to feel performative ‚Äî an act of smoke and mirrors ‚Äî where the magic disappeared right between the huge corporation telling me it was working in my interest and for the public good, and my actual experience of it.

*What does magic have to do with web3?* you‚Äôre probably asking yourself. After all, one has thousands of years of history, and the other‚Äôs so incredibly new.

Let‚Äôs consider that formula:

*community knowledge + solidarity networks + folklore.*

The web3 communities I‚Äôm in have powerful ideologies; these are spaces with shared perspectives and rituals that have emerged over a compressed period of time. This manner of collective world-building in and around projects (in the best possible way, I wouldn‚Äôt use the word company) was called *lorecraft* in [this memorable piece](https://studio.ribbonfarm.com/p/lands-of-lorecraft?s=r) by Venkatesh Rao.

For a great example of lorecraft, let‚Äôs look at [Crypto Coven](https://www.cryptocoven.xyz/). This high femme female-led NFT collection chose witches as their core avatar due to how much they defy traditional expectations and hold agency and power, and *coven* to emphasise collective creation. But even this short description minimises the craft and care at the heart of this project, both what the original five founders conceived, and how the community around it has taken this world in unexpected and beautiful directions.

Another is Dom Hoffman‚Äôs spooky, brilliant [Corruption(s\*)](https://twitter.com/elistonberg/status/1461342536954486787?s=20). After a collection of portal-like NFTs launched without ceremony, a community formed to decipher what they meant both individually and together. Soon, they learnt that if left alone (as in untraded) the insight bar on the bottom right of the image increased over time; if sold or transferred, the insight slows down and changes the look of the NFT itself. Over time, the artist and those interacting with the artwork began sending messages back and forth on-chain.

In both cases, there‚Äôs a sense of mystery or necessary key to unlock understanding, powered by secret knowledge that travels back and forth. And, while there was an initial steward or creator, this folklore tends to be decentralised, community-led and learnt from peers.

Beyond that, the community knowledge is also emerging, as the broader web3 community increasingly begins to document what works, even if, like magic, so much of this world can seem impenetrable to those not yet in it (and we need to work harder on magical user experiences).

The very structure of DAOs (decentralised autonomous organisations) themselves provide solidarity networks, with increasing collaboration between DAOs to build a broader scene. It‚Äôs early but this blend of *community knowledge + solidarity networks + folklore* exists, right now.

And, for all the criticisms (some fair, some not) I‚Äôve seen levied at this space by non-believers, I‚Äôve seen, with my own eyes, magic being made nearly every day ‚Äî through refreshed optimism, through hard work done fast, through groups coming together to do what individuals alone cannot.

*At heart, magic embraces the power that small solidarity networks have to change the world through changing their own perceptions of reality.*

This belief is central to Web3 ideology, and we should be heartened by the sheer longevity of magic, despite the best efforts of large institutions, to bring together like-minded people in service of the best possible futures.

*Thanks to Scott Moore and the Gitcoin public library community for giving me the space to explore this, and the [Foster community](https://www.foster.co/) for help editing. Especially, thanks to Stuart Waterman, Heenal Rajani, Ben Percefeld and Maxwell Kantar for comments and suggestions on this in-progress.*

title: Tiny Bytes: Thoughts on Privacy
body:
Hi,

Had a fantastic time chatting with a friend tonight (hi, Ryan, if you‚Äôre reading this).

Something that was brought up was privacy in public spaces. Given all the technological advances and our ability to use them to monitor, will public spaces ever have privacy again?

## The Person in the Park

One framing we talked about was it would be like every time you go to the park, there is always someone else there. If a crime happens, someone is watching it. If you fall, someone is watching. If you are smoking, someone is watching. If you want to be alone, someone is watching.

What is interesting about this analogy is ‚Äúwho is the person in the park?‚Äù Are they friendly? Are they a snitch? Do they know me? Are they following me?

The technology used and the rules we set around their use will dictate who that person in the park is. The person could just be a friendly stranger. They don‚Äôt know who I am and would call an ambulance if I fell down. They could be an obsessive stalker, knowing exactly who I am, tracking what I do, and following me outside the park. Is the person an undercover cop? A salesman?

## Are people allowed to do things without being tracked?

I like the idea of smart cities. I like my cell phone. I like the internet. I like technology. I‚Äôm not sure how I feel about everything needing to be tracked.

Tracking data are foundational to many of the advances humans have made. To send a message, we need to track it. To create so many goods, we need to track those goods. To know how well my heart is doing, we need to monitor it.¬†

(There‚Äôs also another topic: generating data isn‚Äôt new, just out ability to track it is).

But do we need to track everything?

I‚Äôm conflicted. I see that there are benefits. More data means more insights and better decisions. I don‚Äôt know if this means better outcomes. We could be measuring poor indicators or interpreting the data wrong. Our flawed understanding of measuring intelligence lead to justifications for eugenics.

There is also something unsettling about everything being tracked. I feel less free to experiment and fail if I know I‚Äôm being measured. When learning an instrument or trying to draw, if someone was watching me, I‚Äôd feel too insecure and not get into as much.

Does it make a difference if the person watching me isn‚Äôt doing anything malicious? I think so. It‚Äôs almost impossible to know the person watching me isn‚Äôt going to do something that makes me uncomfortable. Maybe they‚Äôre watching me draw and say a comment that makes me self-conscious. Perhaps my video recommendations all become about drawing even though I‚Äôve moved on.

I see this fear when I talk to people about privacy. They understand they are being tracked and don‚Äôt know what will happen. What is Facebook going to do with my data? I don‚Äôt know. Even if the person monitoring me is clear about how data is initially used, I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs not going to be used for another purpose. E.g., a Singapore contract tracing app was initially used just for contract tracing. 1 year later, the police were given access to the location data.

## 

Night,

Lucas

p.s. had some other ideas that I didn‚Äôt get to

Can people ever be alone anymore?

    I like alone time but that isn‚Äôt always alone. I can be on internet which is tracked.

    People were using other mediums to connect, even while alone (books to connect to other‚Äôs thoughts). -- Less tracking involved tho.

To be really, really alone I‚Äôm out in the woods. Though it‚Äôs a good idea for people to know where you are.

    An idea in here about how people inherently want to be connected.

## ‰∏Ä. ÂâçË®ÄÔºö

ÁªèÂéÜËøá‰∫åÁ∫ßÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÁöÑË°ÄËÖ•È£éÈõ®ÔºåÂè™‰ºöÂºÄÂ§öÂíåÂºÄÁ©∫ÁöÑÊàëÔºåÂéåÂÄ¶‰∫ÜÊØèÂ§©Á©øË∂äÁâõÁÜäÔºåÁúãÁùÄ‰∏ÄÂàÜÈíüÁ∫øÔºåÂíåÁæ§Âèã‰ª¨ÂêπÂòòÔºö‚ÄùÁâõÊù•‰∫Ü‚Äú ‚ÄùÁÄëÂ∏É‰∫Ü‚Äú „ÄÇ

Á≤óÁï•ÁªüËÆ°Ôºå‰∏ÄÂ§©‰πãÂÜÖÔºåÂñä‰∫ÜÊúâ50Ê¨°ÁöÑÁâõÁÜäËΩÆÂõûÔºåËôΩ‰πêÊ≠§‰∏çÁñ≤Ôºå‰ΩÜÁúãÁùÄ‰ªì‰ΩçÈÇ£ÁÇπÊµÆÂä®ËµÑ‰∫ßÔºå ÊöóÊöóÂÜ≥ÂøÉËá™Â∑±Ë¶ÅÂÅöÂá∫ÊîπÂèòÔºå‰ΩÜÁ¨¨‰∫åÂ§©‰ªçÁÑ∂ÂπªÊÉ≥ÁùÄ‰∏ÄÊ≥¢Êö¥ÂØåÔºå Âπ∂ÂÆâÊÖ∞Ëá™Â∑±ËØ¥:‚ÄùÂ∏ÅÂúàÂ§©Â§©ÈÉΩÊúâÊú∫‰ºöÔºÅ‚Äù

Áõ¥Âà∞‰∏âÊúà‰∏≠Êó¨Ôºå‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÂíåÁæ§ÂèãÂêπÁâõËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠Ôºå‰∫ÜËß£Âà∞‰∫Ü‚ÄúÁ©∫Êäï‚ÄùÁöÑÈ≠ÖÂäõ„ÄÇ

Âú®Ëøô‰πãÂâçÔºåÊàë‰ªéÊú™Êï¢ÊÉ≥Ë±°Âà∞ÊúâËøô‰πà‰∏ÄÁßçÁã¨ÁâπÁöÑÂïÜ‰∏öÊ®°ÂºèÔºö ‚ÄùÁ©∫Êäï‚Äú

Ë∞àÂà∞Êó©ÊúüÁ¶èÂà©Ôºö Êàë‰∏çÁî±Ëá™‰∏ªÊÉ≥Âà∞ ÊãºÂ§öÂ§öÊãâÊñ∞ÔºåÁ†ç‰∏ÄÂàÄ„ÄÇ ÊâÄ‰ª•ÂØπÊ≠§Ê≤°ÊúâÂæàÂ•ΩÁöÑÂç∞Ë±°„ÄÇDYDXÔºåENSÁ©∫ÊäïÂ∞ùÂà∞ÁîúÂ§¥ÂêéÔºåÊàëÊàê‰∫Ü‚Äú Á©∫Êäï‰ø°‰ª∞ËÄÖ‚Äù„ÄÇ ‰ΩïË∞à‰ø°‰ª∞ÔºåÁúüÈáëÁôΩÈì∂ËµöÂà∞Êâã‰∫ÜÔºåÂèòÊúâ‰∫Ü‰ø°‰ª∞„ÄÇ

‚Äú Á©∫Êäï‚Äù ÊòØÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂÅöÂÆ£‰º†ÁöÑÁ≠πÁ†ÅÔºå È°πÁõÆÊñπÂ¶ÇÂêå17Â≤ÅÂ∞ëÂ•≥ÔºåÂê´ÁæûÂæÖÊîæ„ÄÇ ‰ª•Á©∫Êäï‰∏∫È•µÔºå ‰æøËÉΩÂê∏ÂºïÂà∞‰∏ÄÂ§ßÊâπÊó©ÊúüËøΩÈöèËÄÖÔºåÂØπÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÈûçÂâçÈ©¨Âêé„ÄÇ ‰ΩÜÊòØÂ§™ÂÆπÊòìÂæóÂà∞ÁöÑÁî®Êà∑‰æø‰∏ç‰ºöÁèçÊÉúÔºåÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÂºÄÂßãÊãâÈ´òÈó®ÊßõÔºåÁ≠õÈÄâÈ©∏È©¨ÔºåËøôÂæàÁ¨¶ÂêàÊó∂‰ª£ÂèëÂ±ïÁöÑË∂ãÂäøÔºåÁ©∫ÊäïÊúâÈôêÔºåÂä†Ê∑±ÂÜÖÂç∑„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÊòØÊúÄÁªàÂè™ÂèØËÉΩÊòØÂ∞èÁôΩÊÑüÂà∞‰∫ëÈáåÈõæÈáåÔºåËÄåÊàêÁÜüËÄÅÁªÉÁöÑ‚ÄùÁ©∫ÊäïÁåé‰∫∫‚Äú  ÊääÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÊë∏ÁöÑÈó®Ê∏Ö„ÄÇÊ≤°ÊúâÂ§ßÈáèÊñ∞‰∫∫ÂÖ•Âú∫ÔºåÊúÄÁªàÁªìÊûú‰∏çË®ÄËÄåÂñª„ÄÇ

title: Which Liquid Staking Derivative should I use?
body:
In this article, I will be covering Liquid Staking Derivatives, which are tokens that provide you with yield on ETH, derived from ETH staking rewards. Please feel free to skip forward to the various sections if you‚Äôre already familiar with the mentioned topics.

# TLDR;

* Decentralized + non-custodial pool = 100% transparency for user deposits
* More node operators in pool = more diverse = less chance of getting slashed
* Rocket Pool = most decentralized *and* diverse liquid staking protocol
* rETH is the only LSD with deep insurance (>200%) for slashing protection
* Yield is hardly ever free - even in the most risk/trust minimized pools, you may still face software bugs or smart contract risks.

# What is Ethereum Staking?

Many familiar with ‚Äòstaking‚Äô - where you deposit tokens somewhere, and you gain a reward for locking your token up. But why are they paying you? It is important to understand where the yield is coming from. 

Some apps pay you to lock up your tokens as that reduces selling pressure (eg. ‚Äòstake‚Äô $CAKE for more $CAKE). In proof-of-stake networks, validators provide a stake of tokens as collateral while providing a service to the network. They are paid when they do their job well, and penalized when they don‚Äôt. Other networks allow you to delegate and entrust your tokens to a node operator to earn yield.

In [Ethereum proof-of-stake](https://ethereum.org/en/staking/), staking has the following properties:

* Validators can be created per 32 ETH
* They are paid ETH rewards for proposing correct blocks, and validating others‚Äô blocks
* They can be penalized (slashed) if they attempt to be malicious
* Designed to encourage a diverse set of stakers
  * The goal is to reduce centralization risks
  * Low hardware requirements (it can run off a Raspberry Pi)
  * Low penalty for being offline => If you are down for a day, you only need to stay online for another day to break-even on the penalty
  * Penalty grows with # of impacted validators - discourages people from running too many validators with the same configuration/client software

Even with the [low barriers to entry](https://thedailygwei.substack.com/p/staking-at-home-the-daily-gwei-515) on the infrastructure end, some users are still excluded because of various reasons:

1. They don‚Äôt have 32 ether
2. They don‚Äôt want to run a machine for various reasons
3. They don‚Äôt want to lock up capital or wait for withdrawals / exit queue in order to access their capital
   1. It is impossible to withdraw staked ETH from the Ethereum protocol as of writing. It is estimated that this will only be enabled 6 months after the Merge (transition to proof-of-stake).

The demand for this is *huge* - [Cardano, for example, has over 70% of its supply delegated](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/cardano/staked-cardano-reaches-high/) because barriers to extra yield are low. As of writing, only about 11.5% (14m out of 120m) of ETH are staked.

# What are Liquid Staking Derivatives (LSDs)?

Enter LSDs. To simulate the ‚Äòdelegated‚Äô proof-of-stake user experience, numerous entities have risen up to the occasion. You give them ether, they stake it on your behalf, charge a commission on the rewards, and give you an IOU token (the LSD). Centralised Exchanges do it (Kraken with ETH2.0, Binance with BETH), staking pools do it. You don‚Äôt even need 32 ETH to start. Users are spared from running a validator, and have *some* access to capital. Pool operators make money, everyone‚Äôs happy. 

Most LSDs are also ERC20 tokens which are accepted for use in DeFi. For example, Lido‚Äôs stETH is accepted as collateral in Maker, Aave, and Alchemix. Rocket Pool‚Äôs rETH proposal for Maker and Aave are in flight and should be implemented shortly, and it is already live on Alchemix. This offers users more flexibility and capital efficiency.

# What are my options, which should I use?

A breakdown of risks are shown on [ethereum.org/staking/pools](https://ethereum.org/en/staking/pools/). 

![Overview of staking pools](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dGaRrZrXIMq37MtPPxw0b.png?height=2308&width=2156)

I could go on all day about how Pool A or Pool B is too big, concentrates too much power, and is bad for the Ethereum ecosystem in general. But today I‚Äôll like to focus on a few factors that I think deserve more attention:

### Non-Custodial / Trustless 

With the fall of even trusted names (Mt Gox, Celsius, 3AC) in previous years and 2022, it is getting harder to be convinced that a single company / entity will full control of your funds will act in good faith over an extended period of time. Opt for trustless and transparent pools.

### Decentralization / Node Operator Count

Node operator represents the person/entity who is operating a validating node. A single node operator can run almost any number of validators on that node. Validators running on the same node are exposed to similar hardware/client bug/configuration risks.

Node operator count as of writing (July 2022), in the 2 biggest pools:

Lido: 21

Rocket Pool: 1331

### Slashing / Downside protection

Rocket Pool is the only pool that allows permissionless node operators. This means that it also requires node operators to put up collateral in order to stake on the users‚Äô behalf. A side effect of that is that rETH is the LSD with the most slashing protection. This makes rETH particularly suitable for DAOs/Treasuries where downside to the principle is an absolute no-no.

![Illustration of backing behind 16 ETH](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FEutFgIq32ehb7as1i0mb.png?height=922&width=1380)

# Conclusion

* Decentralized + non-custodial pool = 100% transparency for user deposits
* More node operators in pool = more diverse = less chance of getting slashed
* Rocket Pool = most decentralized *and* diverse liquid staking protocol
* rETH is the only LSD with deep insurance (>200%) for slashing protection
* Yield is hardly ever free - even in the most risk/trust minimized pools, you may still face software bugs or smart contract risks.

### Disclosure

I own some rETH and RPL.

title: driven
body:
GM, human actions are not actually driven by presenting facts and reasoning. Human actions are driven by imaginary results.

People have never longed for the truth, and they will walk away when confronted with unpalatable evidence. They are more willing to worship error if it is tempting to them. Whoever can supply them with illusion becomes their master easily; whoever disillusiones them becomes their victim.

title: KNN3 x Next.ID Partnership ‚Äî An Identity Focused Case Study
body:
# What is KNN3?

If Web3 and blockchain technology have a common criticism, it is that data is extremely hard to make sense of. It sometimes feels as though developers speak a completely different language as they discuss their findings on Etherscan or any other block explorer, and this is a major cause of friction for newcomers into the Web3 space.

After all, the quicker Web3 grows, the greater the need for avenues of understanding the data that comes out of it.

Enter KNN3. KNN3 is a direct result of this environment, providing simple-to-understand explanations of on-chain relationships in graphic/pictorial form. Although it is primarily a backend protocol, KNN3‚Äôs existence enables and facilitates generations of developers to build on an easy-to-translate interface, effectively lowering the barrier of entry to build consumer-facing dApps.

Ultimately, KNN3 aims to be completely community-driven, in order to unlock greater applications of on-chain data collaboration.

# How KNN3 works with Next.ID: A case study

KNN3 is a social graph protocol. This means that as users generate footprints on blockchains, KNN3 aggregates these to interpret the connections among users, converting them into relational connectors. All 100% verifiable on-chain.

Next.ID, on the other hand, is a Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS) protocol that aggregates digital identities across Web2 and Web3, allowing users to create permissionless DID (decentralized identifiers) called Avatars.

With the permissionless integration of Next.ID and the introduction of Next.ID‚Äôs Avatars, KNN3‚Äôs graphs are given brand new life:

* there is now an **identity-first** component to the data
* Avatars provide off-chain identity data for more **comprehensive** profiles

## Identity-first data

KNN3 aggregates data in a neutral manner, allowing for the eventual empowerment of social dApps and AI analytics. Next.ID provides a subjective perspective of the data, with a focus on streamlining identity.

This allows for work done with KNN3 to take on a completely new dimension, using the synergy between KNN3 and Next.ID to create new forms of social graphs and networks.

## Comprehensive data across Web2 and Web3

As KNN3 is focused on aggregating blockchain data, Next.ID covers one blindspot by providing access to Web2 data as well. If users‚Äô Avatars are connected to their Web2 accounts like Twitter and Discord, KNN3 will now have access to these connections, allowing it a much more comprehensive view of the social graph.

Based on the Avatars‚Äô associations of users‚Äô Web2 (Twitter) and Web3 (blockchain wallets) accounts on Next.ID, KNN3 can now provide users with social graphs mapped across Web2 and Web3. With these graphs, developers and users will have a more streamlined experience of Web3, as well as access to previously-unheard of usage scenarios like social relationship discovery/recommendation and a robust reputation system.

Contributed by: [@zengjiajun](https://twitter.com/zengjiajun_eth) and [@sohchris](http://twitter.com/sohchris)

title: Own up if you f*ck up
body:
Maybe you stumbled upon this while still actively considering to break the ‚Äúbig news‚Äù to your answerable party.  

Easier said than done, looks better on paper than in person, but here‚Äôs some brownie points for owning up if you‚Äôre wrong, from a leader‚Äôs perspective.

## You Take Everyone Into Consideration

Especially if you are in a position of authority, you already know what your mates are going to have to go through to blind rush a project. 

Lack of sleep, absolutely hating what you used to love, refilling your 5th cup of coffee, being irritable at your partner, doubting your work quality. 

Being among [the 73% of millenials](https://www.forbes.com/sites/sarahlandrum/2016/10/05/3-times-when-millennials-should-say-no-at-work/?sh=2f2524091e85) who find it hard to say ‚Äúno‚Äù, more often that not we depend on figures of authority to promote the right culture. 

## Deadlines Are More Considerate Than You Think 

Assuming you already have the desirable traits of finishing your project under normal circumstances, things just *happen* in life. 

You lose a loved one, your car broke down, your cat went into labour, in most cases clients are more than willing to accept a deadline extension on compassionate grounds.

This is why pay-to-complete-fast should be discouraged if the minus of the equation is having someone unwillingly stay up at odd hours. They didn‚Äôt sign up for that.

## Your Quality Of Work Is Questionable

Time is no state of matter, but one thing they do have in common is that you simply cannot squeeze a few week‚Äôs worth of work into 3 days. 

Just like a fruit when you cut corners, there‚Äôs only so much inefficiencies you discover before you start cutting the product itself. 

You will start feeding your starving to do list with half baked work, in the same way a person who couldn‚Äôt care less about his job would. 

## The Balance Of Being Humble Yet Responsible

I get it, this is not ideal for everyone if your project is a life or death situation. Surgeon, if you‚Äôre reading this please do get back to your operation and consider to have others on shift to step in next time. 

Nor is something serious enough to own up, if its a university paper you have no interest about I‚Äôd give it a pass.

‰ΩÜÊòØÊúÄÁªàÂè™ÂèØËÉΩÊòØÂ∞èÁôΩÊÑüÂà∞‰∫ëÈáåÈõæÈáåÔºåËÄåÊàêÁÜüËÄÅÁªÉÁöÑ‚ÄùÁ©∫ÊäïÁåé‰∫∫‚Äú  ÊääÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÊë∏ÁöÑÈó®Ê∏Ö„ÄÇÊ≤°ÊúâÂ§ßÈáèÊñ∞‰∫∫ÂÖ•Âú∫ÔºåÊúÄÁªàÁªìÊûú‰∏çË®ÄËÄåÂñª„ÄÇ

title: The Twitter Blue subscription is getting more expensive
body:
People frequently express their amazement that Twitter is free, but for some people, it isn‚Äôt ‚Äî Twitter Blue [launched last year in several countries](https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/3/22464291/twitter-blue-subscription-service-canada-australia-undo-reader-mode), tacking on a few extra features for anyone willing to pay $2.99 per month. Today the service told subscribers it‚Äôs increasing the price (via [Matt Navara](https://twitter.com/MattNavarra/status/1552808984389849088)), and in the US, [it‚Äôs jumping up to $4.99 per month](https://help.twitter.com/en/using-twitter/twitter-blue-help#price-increase). That probably won‚Äôt break the pockets of information addicts who are choosing to pay for a service that still includes advertisements in their feed, but it might be enough to make people ask themselves if it‚Äôs worthwhile.

The add-ons in the Twitter Blue package range from extremely useful (an undo tweet window to fix typos, a customizable navigation bar, a list of Top Articles shared by people you follow, and [ad-free access to articles](https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/28/21111865/scroll-ad-free-website-subscription-launches) on sites including *The Verge*) to trivial (the ability to choose from different app icons) to questionable ([NFT hexagon profile pics](https://www.theverge.com/2022/1/20/22893502/nft-twitter-profile-picture-crypto-wallet-opensea-coinbase-right-click)).

RELATED

#### Twitter shouldn‚Äôt be hiding basic app improvements behind its Blue paywall

In an email to users, the Twitter Blue team insists the higher rate ‚Äúhelps us continue to build some of the features you‚Äôve been asking for, improve upon the current ones you already love and sustain our mission of supporting journalism.‚Äù
