‰Ωú‰∏∫ÁªèÂéÜËøáÂΩìÂπ¥ÂàÜÂèâÊΩÆÁöÑÁ¨îËÄÖÔºåÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÂÖ∂Êú¨Ë∫´ÁöÑÁîüÊÄÅÊïàÂ∫îÂæàÂ∞èÔºåÂÜ≥ÂÆöÂàÜÂèâÂÖ¥‰∫°ÁöÑËá™ÁÑ∂Â∞±ÊòØÁÆóÂäõ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂØπ‰∫é‰ªäÂ§©ÁöÑÂàÜÂèâËÆ®ËÆ∫ÔºåÁ¨îËÄÖËÆ§‰∏∫ËØùËØ≠ÊùÉ‰∏ªÂØºÂ∑≤Áªè‰ªé‰πãÂâçÁöÑÁüøÂ∑•ËΩ¨ÁßªÂà∞‰∫ÜËµÑ‰∫ßÊñπÔºåËÄå PoS Êú¨Ë∫´‰πüÊòØÊúâÂà©‰∫éËµÑ‰∫ßÊñπÁöÑ„ÄÇÂêàÂπ∂Êú¨Ë∫´ËøòÊúâÂè¶Â§ñ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÖ≥‰∫éÊÑè‰πâÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂç≥ÂàÜÁâáÂíå Rollup ÁöÑÈÄâÊã©ÔºåÁ¨îËÄÖËÆ§‰∏∫ÊâßË°åÂ±ÇÁöÑÂÅèÂ•Ω‰∏çÂ§™‰ºöÂΩ±ÂìçÂÖ±ËØÜÂ±ÇÁöÑÈÄâÊã©ÔºåÊúÄÁªà‰∫∫Ê∞ëËøòÊòØ‰ºöÈÄâÊã©Ê≠£Á°ÆÁöÑÈÅìË∑Ø„ÄÇ

ÂØπ‰∫é PoW ÁüøÂ∑•Êù•ËÆ≤ÔºåÁ¨îËÄÖ‰πüÂÄæÂêë‰∫éÊú™Êù•‰ºöÊúâÂè¶Â§ñ‰∏ÄÊù° PoW ETH ÁöÑÂá∫Áé∞„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊåâÁÖß‰∏ÄËà¨ÈÄªËæëÁªùÂ§ßÂ§öÊï∞ÁîüÊÄÅÂÜÖÈ°πÁõÆÊñπÈÉΩ‰ºöÈÄâÊã© PoS„ÄÇÊúÄÂêéÂèØËÉΩÂè™Êúâ‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄ‰ºöÈÄâÊã©Êé•Á∫≥ÂàÜÂèâÔºåÈÇ£Êàë‰ª¨ÂÅáËÆæ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁöÑ‰∏ÄÊ¥æÁúüÁöÑ‰æùÈù† PoW ÁüøÂ∑•ÂàÜÂèâ‰∫ÜÔºåÂÆÉÊú¨Ë∫´ÊúâÊó†ÂÆûÁî®‰ª∑ÂÄºÔºüÂæàÁÆÄÂçïÔºåÁîüÊÄÅÈÉΩÈúÄË¶ÅÈáçÂª∫‰∫ÜÔºåÂ∞±Âá≠ÁüøÂ∑•‰πüËÉΩÂú®Â¶Ç‰ªäÊéÄËµ∑‰øùÁöáÁöÑÊªîÂ§©Â∑®Êµ™Ôºü

ETH-PoW (ETH-P) ÂàÜÂèâÂú∫ÊôØ‰∏ã‰ºöÂèëÁîü‰ªÄ‰πàÔºüÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂá∫Áé∞ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÂú∫ÊôØÔºöÊâÄÊúâ‰æùËµñÂ§ñÈÉ®È¢ÑË®ÄÊú∫ÁöÑ DeFi ÈÉΩÂ∞ÜÂ§±Ë¥•ÔºåÂÄüË¥∑ÂçèËÆÆ„ÄÅMakerDAO Á≠âÂ∞ÜÂÅúÊ≠¢ËøêË°åÔºå‰ΩÜÂàÜÂèâÁöÑ DAI ‰ªçÁÑ∂ÂèØ‰ª•Âú® DEX ‰∏≠ËΩ¨ÁßªÂíå‰∫§ÊòìÔºõWETH-ETH-P ÂêàÁ∫¶‰ªçÁÑ∂ÊúâÊïàÔºåÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂú® WETH/ETH ÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÊ±†‰∏≠ÁúãÂà∞Â§ßÈáèÂ•óÂà©ÔºõLido stETHÔºå‰∏ÄÊó¶ÂàÜÂèâ‰ª£Â∏ÅËé∑ÂæóÊúâÊÑè‰πâÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄºÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∞Ü‰∏çÂæó‰∏çÂ§ÑÁêÜÂ∞Ü ETH-P ‰ª£Â∏ÅÂàÜÈÖçÁªôÂÖ∂Ë¥®ÊäºËÄÖÔºåÂØπ‰∫éÊâÄÊúâ CEXÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∞ÜÊúâ‰πâÂä°Â∞ÜÂàÜÂèâ‰ª£Â∏ÅÂàÜÈÖçÁªô‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑ ETH Â≠òÊ¨æ‰∫∫ÔºåËøôÊ≠£Âú®ÂèëÁîüÊàê‰∏∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁúüÊ≠£ÁöÑÁÉÇÊëäÂ≠ê„ÄÇ

Â¶ÇÊûúÂàÜÂèâ‰ª£Â∏ÅËé∑ÂæóÊúâÊÑè‰πâÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄºÔºåMaker ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöË¢´Ëø´ÊâìÂºÄ‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÈ¢ÑË®ÄÊú∫ÊîØÊåÅÔºå‰ª•‰æøÁ≥ªÁªüÂèØ‰ª•Âú® ETH-P Èìæ‰∏äËøêË°åÔºåÊ≥ïÂÆöË¥ßÂ∏Å USDT/USDC/BUSD/TUSD Á≠âÂ∞ÜÊ≤°Êúâ‰ª∑ÂÄºÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ËØ∑Ê≥®ÊÑèËøô‰∫õ‰ª£Â∏Å‰∏é WETH/ETH-P ÈÖçÂØπÁöÑÊ±†ÔºõÂØπ‰∫éÂÄüË¥∑ÂçèËÆÆÂíå DEX LP ÁöÑÂ≠òÊ¨æ‰∫∫ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂèØËÉΩÁöÑËØùÔºåÊúÄÂ•ΩÂ∞ÜÊâÄÊúâ‰∏é ETH-P Áõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑ‰ª£Â∏ÅÊèêÂèñÂà∞ÊÇ®ÁöÑÈí±ÂåÖ‰∏≠ÔºõÂπ≥Êéâ‰Ω†ÁöÑ ETH perp/leverage Â§¥ÂØ∏ÔºåËøôÂèØËÉΩÊòØÂä®Ëç°ÂíåÊÆãÈÖ∑ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂë®Ôºõ‰∏çÂÖ≥ÂøÉ ETH-P ‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÊôÆÈÄöÁî®Êà∑Ôºå‰Ω†‰∏çÈúÄË¶ÅÂÅö‰ªª‰Ωï‰∫ãÊÉÖÔºõÊ≥ïÂ∏ÅÁ®≥ÂÆöÂ∏ÅÂèëË°åËÄÖÔºàTether„ÄÅCircle Á≠âÔºâÂ∞Ü‰ªÖÊîØÊåÅ PoS ÈìæÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Â§ßÂ§öÊï∞ DeFi„ÄÅCeFi„ÄÅCEX Â∞ÜÁ¥ßÈöèÂÖ∂Âêé„ÄÇ

ÂàÜÂèâ ETHÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØÊüêÁü•ÂêçÊâãÊú∫ÂéÇË¶ÅÊääÂô®‰ª∂ A ÊõøÊç¢ÊàêÊÄß‰ª∑ÊØîÊõ¥È´òÁöÑÂô®‰ª∂ BÔºåÂô®‰ª∂ A ÁöÑ‰æõÂ∫îÂïÜ‰ª¨ÊÄí‰∫ÜÔºåËØ¥‰Ω†‰∏çÊ≠£Áªü‰∫ÜÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Ë¶ÅÈáçÊñ∞Âª∫‰∏™ÊâãÊú∫ÂéÇÁªôÂñúÊ¨¢Áî®Âô®‰ª∂ A ÁöÑÊâãÊú∫Áî®Êà∑ÔºÅÊàëÂè™ËÉΩÁ•ùÁ¶è‰ªñ‰ª¨Âä†Ê≤πÔºåÂÅöÂ§ßÂÅöÂº∫„ÄÇËá≥‰∫é‰π∞‰ªñ‰ª¨ÊâãÊú∫ÁöÑÁî®Êà∑ÔºåÊàëÂè™ËÉΩËØ¥‰Ω†ÂñúÊ¨¢Â∞±Â•Ω„ÄÇ

‚ÄúÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÂØπÊú™Êù•2Âà∞3Âπ¥ÊúâÈïøËøúÁöÑÁúãÊ≥ïÔºåÈÇ£‰πàÊé•‰∏ãÊù•ÁöÑ6Âà∞8‰∏™ÊúàÂ∞ÜÊòØ‰Ω†CryptoËÅå‰∏öÁîüÊ∂Ø‰∏≠ÊúÄÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÂá†‰∏™Êúà‚Äî‚Äî‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúüÊ≠£ÂÆö‰ΩçËá™Â∑±ÔºåÁî®ÂæàÂ∞ëÁöÑËµÑÊú¨ËµöÂæàÂ§öÈí±„ÄÇ‚ÄùTwitterÂçö‰∏ªCryptoGodJohnÂØπ‰∫éËøô‰∏ÄËΩÆÁÜäÂ∏ÇÂèëË°®‰∫ÜËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑËßÇÁÇπ„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÈìæËå∂È¶ÜÈááËÆøÁöÑÈÇ£‰Ωç‰∏çÊÑøÂÖ∑ÂêçÁöÑCryptoÂü∫ÈáëÂêà‰ºô‰∫∫ÂàôÊúâ‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÁúãÊ≥ïÔºå‰ªñËÆ§‰∏∫‚ÄúÁâõÂ∏ÇÁöÑÁ°ÆÊå£Èí±Ôºå‰ΩÜ‰Ωú‰∏∫ÊäïËµÑÊú∫ÊûÑÊ≤°ÊúâÂ∞ä‰∏•ÔºåËÄåÁÜäÂ∏ÇÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÈí±Â∞±ÊòØÊúÄÂ§ßÁöÑËµÑÊ∫ê‚ÄùÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Êµ∑Â§ñÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆ‰ºöÊõ¥ÊÑøÊÑèÊé•Ëß¶ÂõΩÂÜÖVC„ÄÇ‚ÄúÂæàÂ§öÂÆùË¥ùÈÉΩÊòØÂú®ÁÜäÂ∏ÇÂèëÁé∞ÁöÑ‚Äù„ÄÇ

 
 

ÈÇ£‰πàÊäõÂºÄ‰∏ÄÁ∫ßÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰∏é‰∫åÁ∫ßÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰πã‰∫âÔºåÁõ¥Êé•ËÅöÁÑ¶Âà∞ËµõÈÅìÔºåÊäïËµÑÊú∫ÊûÑÂ∫îËØ•Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂéªÂèëÁé∞È£éÂè£Âë¢Ôºü‚Äú‰∏ã‰∏ÄËΩÆÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÁöÑÂèô‰∫ãÔºåÂÖ∂ÂÆû‰∏çÁî®ÂéªÈ¢ÑÊµãÔºåÂè™ÈúÄË¶ÅÊïèÊÑüÂú∞‰øùÊåÅ‰∏éÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÁöÑÊ≤üÈÄöÂ∞±Ë°å‰∫ÜÔºåËøôÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Ëá™È™åËØÅÁöÑËøáÁ®ã„ÄÇ‚Äù‰ªñ‰ª•NFT‰∏∫‰æãÔºåÂ∏ÇÂú∫Âú®ÁÅ´ÁàÜ‰πãÂâçÂ∞±Â∑≤ÁªèÈ¢ÑÊúüÊé•‰∏ãÊù•ËØ•ËΩÆÂà∞NFT‰∫ÜÔºå‰∫ãÂÆû‰∏äNFTÁúüÁöÑÁÅ´ÁàÜ‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

 
 

ËøôËÆ©ÈìæËå∂È¶ÜÂõûÊÉ≥Ëµ∑2020Âπ¥10Êúà‰ªΩÂú®‰∏äÊµ∑‰∏æÂäûÁöÑNFTÊ≤ôÈæôÔºåÂΩìÊó∂NFT‰Ωú‰∏∫Êñ∞ÁîüÁâ©ÈíüËøòÂú®ËØïÊé¢ÊñπÂêëÔºåÁé∞Âú∫‰∏ÄËá¥ËÆ§‰∏∫NFTÊòØÂç≥Â∞ÜÂà∞Êù•ÁöÑË∂ãÂäøÔºåÂà∞‰∫ÜÊ¨°Âπ¥NFTÁ°ÆÂÆûÁ†¥Âúà‰∫Ü„ÄÇÂèØËßÅÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÂΩ¢ÊàêÁöÑÈöêÈöêÈ¢ÑÊúüÂæÄÂæÄ‰ºöÊàêÁúüÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Âè™ÈúÄË¶ÅÊïèÈîêÂú∞ÂéªÊçïÊçâËøôÁßç‰ø°Âè∑Âç≥ÂèØ„ÄÇ

ÁÑ∂ËÄåÊàë‰ª¨Âú®ÂàöÂàöËøáÂéªÁöÑËøô‰∏ÄËΩÆÁâõÂ∏Ç‰∏≠ÁúãÂà∞‰∫ÜÂ§ßÈáèÂèçÈù¢Ê°à‰æãÔºå‰ªéÊï£Êà∑Âà∞ÊäïËµÑÊú∫ÊûÑÔºåÂçé‰∫∫Á§æÂå∫Êó†ËÆ∫ÊòØËµÑÈáëÈáèËøòÊòØÊäïËµÑÁÉ≠ÊÉÖÈÉΩÈùûÂ∏∏ÁªôÂäõÔºå‰ΩÜÊäïËµÑË°®Áé∞Âç¥Âæà‰∏ÄËà¨ÔºåÁîöËá≥‰∏ÄÂú∞È∏°ÊØõÔºåÂæàÂ§ßÁ®ãÂ∫¶‰∏äÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•ÂΩíÁªì‰∏∫Áº∫‰πèÊâéÂÆûÁöÑÊ∑±ÂÖ•Á†îÁ©∂ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•‰ªñËøòÂº∫Ë∞É‰ºòÁßÄÁöÑÊäïËµÑ‰∫∫Ë¶ÅÁßØÊûÅËûçÂÖ•‰ª•Ëã±Êñá‰∏∫ËΩΩ‰ΩìÁöÑCryptoÊäïËµÑÁ§æÁæ§„ÄÇ

 
 

Âõ†‰∏∫CryptoÈ¢ÜÂüüÂ≠òÂú®ËØ≠Ë®ÄÊ≠ßËßÜÔºåÂ§ßÂ§öÊï∞Â•ΩÁöÑ‰∏úË•øÈÉΩÊòØ‰ª•Ëã±Êñá‰∏∫ËΩΩ‰ΩìÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•‰∏ä‰∏ÄÊ≥¢ÊàêÂäüÁöÑÊäïËµÑ‰∫∫ÂæÄÂæÄÂú®‰ø°ÊÅØÊ∫ê‰∏äÊòØ‰∫≤Ë•øÊñπÁöÑ„ÄÇ‰ª§‰ªñÂç∞Ë±°Ê∑±ÂàªÁöÑÊòØÔºå‰ªñÂú®2020Âπ¥Â∞±ÈÄöËøá‰∏Ä‰ΩçÊµ∑Â§ñ‰∏ÄÁ∫øÊú∫ÊûÑÁöÑÊúãÂèãÁúãÂà∞‰∫ÜÂÖ≥‰∫éYGGÁöÑÂÜÖÈÉ®Êä•ÂëäÔºåÂ∑≤ÁªèÁ†îÁ©∂ÂæóÈùûÂ∏∏Ê∑±ÂÖ•‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

Âè¶Â§ñÔºåÂú®‰∫åÁ∫ßÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰∏äÂ≠¶‰ºöÂà©Áî®ÂØπÂÜ≤Â∑•ÂÖ∑‰πüÂæàÈáçË¶Å„ÄÇ0xAlphaÂú®ÂÅöË°çÁîüÂìÅÂçèËÆÆDeri‰πãÂâçÂàõÁ´ãËøáÊï∞Â≠óËµÑ‰∫ßÈáèÂåñÂü∫ÈáëÔºåÂú®2018Âπ¥ÁöÑÂä†ÂØÜÁÜäÂ∏Ç‰∏≠Ëá™Ëê•Ë¥¶Êà∑Á¥ØËÆ°Êî∂ÁõäË∂ÖËøá110%„ÄÇ‚ÄúÊàë‰ª¨ÊòØ‰ª•CTAÁ≠ñÁï•‰∏∫‰∏ªÔºå‰πü‰ºöÊ†πÊçÆË°åÊÉÖÂØπÁ≠ñÁï•ËøõË°å‰ºòÂåñÔºåËÄå‰∏îÂºÄÂèë‰∫ÜÊúüÁé∞Â•óÂà©Á≠ñÁï•ÔºåÊÄª‰πãÈÉΩÊòØÈÄöËøáÊ®°Âûã‰∫ßÁîüÁöÑ‰π∞Âçñ‰ø°Âè∑ËøõË°åÊäïËµÑÂÜ≥Á≠ñ„ÄÇ‚Äù

 
 

‰ΩÜÊòØË°çÁîüÂìÅÁöÑÁ≠ñÁï•ÂØπÁªùÂ§ßÂ§öÊï∞‰∫∫Êù•ËØ¥ÈÉΩÈöæ‰ª•ÁêÜËß£ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫Ë°çÁîüÂìÅÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∫ïÂ±ÇÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÈô§ÈùûÂØπË°çÁîüÂìÅÁöÑÁêÜËß£ÈùûÂ∏∏Ê∑±ÂàªÊâçÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•ÂéªÂÅöÁ≠ñÁï•„ÄÇ‚Äú‰ΩÜÊòØÂ¶ÇÊûúÊôÆÈÄöÁî®Êà∑ÊòØÁ´ôÂú®ÁúüÂÆûÁöÑÈúÄÊ±Ç‰∏äÔºå‰πüÂ∞±ÂæàÂÆπÊòìÁêÜËß£Ëøô‰∫õÁ≠ñÁï•‰∫Ü„ÄÇÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÂΩìÊàë‰ª¨ÊääÂ∫îÁî®‰∫éÁâπÂÆöÂú∫ÊôØÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÁªôÂÅöÂá∫Êù•Ôºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÊúçÂä°‰∫éÊäÑÂ∫ïÁöÑÂçèËÆÆÔºâÔºåÊôÆÈÄöÁî®Êà∑Â∞±‰ºöËá™ÁÑ∂ËÄåÁÑ∂Âú∞‰ΩøÁî®‰∫Ü„ÄÇ‚Äù

ÁâõÂ∏Ç‰∏éÁÜäÂ∏ÇÁöÑËΩ¨Êç¢Â∞±ÂÉèÂ≠£ËäÇÁöÑÊõ¥Êõø‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÔºåÊòØ‰∏ç‰ª•‰∏™‰∫∫ÊÑèÂøó‰∏∫ËΩ¨ÁßªÁöÑÂÆ¢ËßÇÁé∞Ë±°ÔºåÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂØπÂæÖÁÜäÂ∏Ç„ÄÇ‰Ωú‰∏∫Â∑≤ÁªèËøõÂÖ•Âà∞Crypto‰∏ñÁïåÁöÑ‰Ω†ÔºåÂú®ÁÜäÂ∏Ç‰∏≠‰πüËÆ∏ÊâçÊúâÊó∂Èó¥ÂÅú‰∏ãÊù•ÂèçÊÄùÔºåÈúÄË¶ÅÂÅöÁöÑ‰ªÖ‰ªÖÂè™ÊòØÁïô‰∏ãÊù•ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏∫Êú™Êù•ÁöÑË¥¢ÂØåÁßØÁ¥ØËÆ§Áü•ÔºåËÄåËøôÈúÄË¶ÅËÄêÂøÉÂíåÂãáÊ∞î„ÄÇ

ËøôÁßç‰∫ãÂÆûÂØπÊú¨‰∫∫Êù•ËØ¥ÊÑè‰πâÈáçÂ§ßÔºåÁõ∏‰ø°ÂØπËøô‰∏™‰∏ñÁïå‰πüÊòØÊúâ‰∏ÄÂÆöÊÑè‰πâÁöÑ„ÄÇ ËøôÊ†∑ÁúãÊù•Ôºå ËÄåËøô‰∫õÂπ∂‰∏çÊòØÂÆåÂÖ®ÈáçË¶ÅÔºåÊõ¥Âä†ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÊòØÔºå ‰∫ÜËß£Ê∏ÖÊ•ö‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÂà∞Â∫ïÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÊÄé‰πàÊ†∑ÁöÑÂ≠òÂú®ÔºåÊòØËß£ÂÜ≥‰∏ÄÂàáÈóÆÈ¢òÁöÑÂÖ≥ÈîÆ„ÄÇ Áé∞Âú®ÔºåËß£ÂÜ≥‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏ÈùûÂ∏∏ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑ„ÄÇ ÊâÄ‰ª•Ôºå ÁîüÊ¥ª‰∏≠ÔºåËã•‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÂá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞±‰∏çÂæó‰∏çËÄÉËôëÂÆÉÂá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜÁöÑ‰∫ãÂÆû„ÄÇ Êó¢ÁÑ∂Â¶ÇÊ≠§Ôºå Êó¢ÁÑ∂Â¶Ç‰ΩïÔºå ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÂõ†‰ΩïËÄåÂèëÁîüÔºü ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÔºåÂèëÁîü‰∫Ü‰ºöÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÔºå‰∏çÂèëÁîüÂèà‰ºöÂ¶Ç‰Ωï„ÄÇ ‰øæÊñØÈ∫¶Âú®‰∏çÁªèÊÑèÈó¥ËøôÊ†∑ËØ¥ËøáÔºåÂØπ‰∫é‰∏çÂ±à‰∏çÊå†ÁöÑ‰∫∫Êù•ËØ¥ÔºåÊ≤°ÊúâÂ§±Ë¥•ËøôÂõû‰∫ã„ÄÇËøôÂè•ËØùËØ≠ËôΩÁÑ∂ÂæàÁü≠Ôºå‰ΩÜ‰ª§ÊàëÊµÆÊÉ≥ËÅîÁø©„ÄÇ

„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÂõ†‰ΩïËÄåÂèëÁîüÔºü ÂØπÊàë‰∏™‰∫∫ËÄåË®ÄÔºå‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£é‰∏ç‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈáçÂ§ßÁöÑ‰∫ã‰ª∂ÔºåËøòÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊîπÂèòÊàëÁöÑ‰∫∫Áîü„ÄÇ Êó¢ÁÑ∂Â¶ÇÊ≠§Ôºå Êàë‰ª¨ÈÉΩÁü•ÈÅìÔºåÂè™Ë¶ÅÊúâÊÑè‰πâÔºåÈÇ£‰πàÂ∞±ÂøÖÈ°ªÊÖéÈáçËÄÉËôë„ÄÇ ÂØπÊàë‰∏™‰∫∫ËÄåË®ÄÔºå‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£é‰∏ç‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈáçÂ§ßÁöÑ‰∫ã‰ª∂ÔºåËøòÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊîπÂèòÊàëÁöÑ‰∫∫Áîü„ÄÇ Êó¢ÁÑ∂Â¶Ç‰ΩïÔºå ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÔºåÂà∞Â∫ïÂ∫îËØ•Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÔºåÂà∞Â∫ïÂ∫îËØ•Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ ÁîüÊ¥ª‰∏≠ÔºåËã•‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÂá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞±‰∏çÂæó‰∏çËÄÉËôëÂÆÉÂá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜÁöÑ‰∫ãÂÆû„ÄÇ È≤ÅÂ∑¥ÈáëÊõæÁªèÊèêÂà∞ËøáÔºåËØª‰π¶ÊòØÂú®Âà´‰∫∫ÊÄùÊÉ≥ÁöÑÂ∏ÆÂä©‰∏ãÔºåÂª∫Á´ãËµ∑Ëá™Â∑±ÁöÑÊÄùÊÉ≥„ÄÇËøô‰∏çÁ¶Å‰ª§ÊàëÊ∑±ÊÄù„ÄÇ ‰ªéËøô‰∏™ËßíÂ∫¶Êù•ÁúãÔºå Êú¨‰∫∫‰πüÊòØÁªèËøá‰∫ÜÊ∑±ÊÄùÁÜüËôëÔºåÂú®ÊØè‰∏™Êó•Êó•Â§úÂ§úÊÄùËÄÉËøô‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ Êó¢ÁÑ∂Â¶Ç‰ΩïÔºå ‰∏ÄËà¨Êù•ËØ¥Ôºå ‰∏ÄËà¨Êù•ËÆ≤ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÈÉΩÂøÖÈ°ªÂä°ÂøÖÊÖéÈáçÁöÑËÄÉËôëËÄÉËôë„ÄÇ ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÔºåÂà∞Â∫ïÂ∫îËØ•Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ ËééÂ£´ÊØî‰∫öÊõæÁªèÊèêÂà∞ËøáÔºåÊäõÂºÉÊó∂Èó¥ÁöÑ‰∫∫ÔºåÊó∂Èó¥‰πüÊäõÂºÉ‰ªñ„ÄÇÂ∏¶ÁùÄËøôÂè•ËØùÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËøòË¶ÅÊõ¥Âä†ÊÖéÈáçÁöÑÂÆ°ËßÜËøô‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºö Áé∞Âú®ÔºåËß£ÂÜ≥‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏ÈùûÂ∏∏ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑ„ÄÇ ÊâÄ‰ª•Ôºå Â∏¶ÁùÄËøô‰∫õÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Êù•ÂÆ°ËßÜ‰∏Ä‰∏ã‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£é„ÄÇ ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÔºåÂèëÁîü‰∫Ü‰ºöÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÔºå‰∏çÂèëÁîüÂèà‰ºöÂ¶Ç‰Ωï„ÄÇ ÂèØÊòØÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÊòØËøôÊ†∑Ôºå‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÁöÑÂá∫Áé∞‰ªçÁÑ∂‰ª£Ë°®‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÂÆöÁöÑÊÑè‰πâ„ÄÇ ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÔºåÂèëÁîü‰∫Ü‰ºöÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÔºå‰∏çÂèëÁîüÂèà‰ºöÂ¶Ç‰Ωï„ÄÇ ÂØπÊàë‰∏™‰∫∫ËÄåË®ÄÔºå‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£é‰∏ç‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈáçÂ§ßÁöÑ‰∫ã‰ª∂ÔºåËøòÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊîπÂèòÊàëÁöÑ‰∫∫Áîü„ÄÇ Â∏¶ÁùÄËøô‰∫õÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Êù•ÂÆ°ËßÜ‰∏Ä‰∏ã‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£é„ÄÇ Êú¨‰∫∫‰πüÊòØÁªèËøá‰∫ÜÊ∑±ÊÄùÁÜüËôëÔºåÂú®ÊØè‰∏™Êó•Êó•Â§úÂ§úÊÄùËÄÉËøô‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ ÊàëËÆ§‰∏∫Ôºå ÂèØÊòØÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÊòØËøôÊ†∑Ôºå‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÁöÑÂá∫Áé∞‰ªçÁÑ∂‰ª£Ë°®‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÂÆöÁöÑÊÑè‰πâ„ÄÇ ÊâÄË∞ì‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÔºåÂÖ≥ÈîÆÊòØ‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÈúÄË¶ÅÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂÜô„ÄÇ ‰∫ÜËß£Ê∏ÖÊ•ö‰∏ÄÁÇπÈùíÊò•Ê∞îÔºåÂçÉÈáåÂø´ÂìâÈ£éÂà∞Â∫ïÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÊÄé‰πàÊ†∑ÁöÑÂ≠òÂú®ÔºåÊòØËß£ÂÜ≥‰∏ÄÂàáÈóÆÈ¢òÁöÑÂÖ≥ÈîÆ„ÄÇ

title: What's going on in web3? #8 | July 29, 2022
body:
## Martin Shkreli debuts web3 drug company

![Proof-of-Optimization Flowchart from Druglike's whitepaper](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/l3_OoBDqyhKjL-MY25VMv.png?height=364&width=583)

Pharma bro Martin Shkreli, fresh out of prison, has been working non-stop over the last few months on a web3 drug company that seeks to disrupt the silicone valley early-stage drug investment game.

The company, [Druglike](https://druglike.com/), dubs itself ‚Äúa platform for democratizing the access, costs, and rewards of early-stage drug discovery.‚Äù At the heart of the technology is what the company refers to as a ‚Äúproof-of-optimization‚Äù consensus mechanism.

[The whitepaper itself is incredibly dense](https://druglike.com/Druglike_Whitepaper.pdf), but there is plenty of documentation to sift through if you have the time to do so do with that what you will. I‚Äôm sifting through it as I can get to it. Section 5 is where it gets into the specifics of the consensus mechanism itself.

[According to the official press release](https://www.newswire.com/news/announcing-druglike-a-web3-drug-discovery-platform-21779057) ‚Äú[Druglike](https://stats.newswire.com/x/html?final=aHR0cHM6Ly9kcnVnbGlrZS5jb20&hit%2Csum=WyIzbGl0NTAiLCIzbGl0NTEiLCIzbGl0NTIiXQ&_ga=2.45407021.885313184.1659055437-1202777305.1659055437) is building a decentralized computing network which provides resources for anyone looking to start or contribute to early-stage drug discovery projects. Unlike competitors, Druglike will be web-based and completely free to use.

Druglike will soon release a web-based suite for target identification, drug design, and tools for both constructing and running large-scale virtual screening workflows.‚Äù

## MetaMask drops much needed UI update

![MetaMask UI Update](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xJWjqYaa8rQlOmb7I0XA2.png?height=1080&width=1920)

With this new update, MetaMask is providing additional context to your transactions to help curb the number of assets lost to scam artists and hackers.

The `setApprovalForAll` permission has been exploited by hackers and scammers in phishing attacks to get people to sign away their entire wallets without realizing it. This was made possible because most Defi wallet UIs don‚Äôt give much detail about what you‚Äôre signing, rather they expect you to do your due diligence to know what contract you are interacting with.

That‚Äôs fine too, but what happens more often than not is the following:

1. someone clicks a link they think is safe for an upcoming mint or token swap
2. the user ends up on a website that is not safe, but it looks identical to what the user expects
3. the user proceeds like normal to mint or swap tokens and signs transaction when prompted by MetaMask
4. Ethereum address gets drained

## SpiceDAO dissolves following a lack of direction

![Image quote by Kevin O'Leary](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9_e36wD0ib7bnCeAap2zr.png?height=1080&width=1080)

SpiaceDAO (previously DuneDAO) is putting together the pieces to dissolve operations as soon as they can after a series of missteps, mismanagement, and hurdles.

In 2021 DuneDAO, following in the footsteps of ConsitutionDAO, BlockbusterDAO, and others, started up and was focused on purchasing a rare copy of a production manual for an early version of Dune which was on sale through Christie's auction house.

After raising more than enough money to buy the book based on the initial asking price in ETH, they found out that Christie‚Äôs didn‚Äôt accept crypto as payment and alternative plans needed to be worked out asap.

One of the co-founders stepped up and fronted the cash to buy the physical copy, but almost immediately organizational issues began to make themselves known.

Simple logistic issues like who would keep the book in their possession, how would they provide access to it to DAO members, how IP would work, etc became complex enough that the other co-founder left altogether.

Now plans are to dissolve the DAO treasury and let users cash out their tokens for eth.

This quote by Kevin O‚ÄôLeary couldn‚Äôt be more true than it is right now on web3.

‚Äî ‚ÄúGreat ideas are a dime-a-dozen. It‚Äôs executional skills that are rare.‚Äù

## Miami partners with Mastercard, Salesforce, & 56 local artists to launch NFT project

[Miami is partnering with Salesforce, Time USA, and Mastercard](https://www.miamigov.com/My-Government/City-Officials/Mayor-Francis-Suarez/web3-Project-City-of-Miami-x-TIME-Mastercard-Salesforce) to bring a 5,000-piece NFT series to life ‚Äúdesigned to drive revenue to local businesses and non-profits through exclusive rewards offerings.‚Äù

The series will be a collaborative effort between 56 artists exercising their creative diversity. 56 is a significant number as it represents the city's 56-square-mile footprint.

Mastercard will be providing the utility by offering holders perks and access to their ‚ÄúPriceless Miami‚Äù branded experiences which ‚Äúprovides unique experiences, from one-of-a-kind events at local Miami restaurants to curated, unforgettable private tours of Miami cultural institutions and other memorable activities.

Salesforce will be handling the minting and management of the NFT collection through their closed beta program, [NFT Cloud](https://www.salesforce.com/products/web3/nft/), which aims at ‚Äúhelping brands deliver connected experiences across the physical and digital worlds.‚Äù

The collection will be on Ethereum following the move to PoS later this fall.

## Feds/FDIC tell Voyager to stop lying about being FDIC-insured

The Feds aren‚Äôt playing with [Voyager](https://www.investvoyager.com/). [According to the FDIC](https://www.fdic.gov/news/press-releases/2022/pr22056.html) Voyager has made blatantly false claims regarding the insurance of funds managed by the firm.

[https://twitter.com/FDICgov/status/1552765397438455809?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1552765397438455809%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fdecrypt.co%2F106206%2Ffed-fdic-order-voyager-to-stop-false-and-misleading-claims-of-insured-deposits](https://twitter.com/FDICgov/status/1552765397438455809?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1552765397438455809%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fdecrypt.co%2F106206%2Ffed-fdic-order-voyager-to-stop-false-and-misleading-claims-of-insured-deposits)

The issue comes down to how Voyager was trying to pass off that it was FDIC insured because it was partnered with Metropolitan Commercial Bank, which itself is FDIC insured. Throughout their marketing material, they claim to be FDIC-insured.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mZ5ubmGpLTur3PgWbEOw2.png?height=370&width=744)

It‚Äôs not clear whether or not this has to do with blatant misrepresentation with the intent to defraud, or if the company leaders are that stupid. We‚Äôll see soon enough.

They aren‚Äôt lying 100% though, that‚Äôs the thing. See they do keep some cash at their partner‚Äôs (MCB) bank, which itself is FDIC-insured, but that is only for Voyager Cash accounts.

This is just the latest in their apparent [uphill bankruptcy battle.](https://decrypt.co/104490/voyager-stock-plummets-crypto-firm-files-bankruptcy) Pour one out for all those affected by Voyager's degeneracy.

## A16Z invests in VeeFriends

a16z is investing $50 Million into Gary Vaynerchuk‚Äôs VeeFriends NFT project/company.

VeeFriends was one of the first NFT projects to show the world what NFTs were capable of by providing both digital and real-world utility.

Aside from having value as a commodity on a secondary marketplace, VeeFriends grants holders exclusive access to Gary, his products, and the events he hosts. First-generation VeeFriends offered different perks based on different traits.

The money is going to be used to grow the IP and help establish the brand as a bridge between web2 and web3.

## Customer.io behind Celsius data breach, phishing attacks expected

Just a few weeks ago Customer.io was behind a data breach that affected pretty much everyone with an OpenSea account. Well, now the same thing happened with Celsius.

In a message to the Celsius community via email and distributed through social media Celsius claims that an employee of customer.io (a third--party email marketing company) obtained a list of email addresses from Celsius clients and had ‚Äútransferred them to a \[another\] third-party‚Äù

[https://twitter.com/CelsiansNetwork/status/1552737193407533057?s=20&t=zcl4EKdHPW_j85sgN_ABFQ](https://twitter.com/CelsiansNetwork/status/1552737193407533057?s=20&t=zcl4EKdHPW_j85sgN_ABFQ)

This just makes me wonder so many things about how customer.io handles their data and who has access to it at any point in time. Furthermore, I think this is a great use case for blockchain to make an impact.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8IivXT6xTxbTEySsJeyMm.png?height=988&width=600)

While the information that was taken wasn‚Äôt necessarily sensitive as it was just an email list, don‚Äôt be surprised if you see an uptick in phishing emails where scammers who have access to the email list create convincing emails that are intended to trick the recipient into going to look-alike sites to interact with potentially malicious smart contracts or to try and steal login credentials.

Stay frosty out there, anon folks


---

## Web3 WOTD: DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization)

***DAOs*** are organizations operated by groups of individuals leveraging web3 tools and resources to accomplish their goals.

Typically DAOs will issue governance tokens which are required to vote on proposals and take part in other DAO activities but can also be sold in some cases on secondary markets or transferred to others in a p2p style.

## Artist of the Day: @em0tionull

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/L4XBcJMtrmrGfDqgz8MzS.png?height=2000&width=2000)

[null](https://twitter.com/em0tionull) is one of my favorite web3 native artists. The dude has built his metaverse complete with his characters and lore from scratch in his spare time with a basic knowledge of the tools when he started using them. Total boss.

## Web3 Builders Tip

> Stop trying to be what you think everyone else wants you to be, focus on building what you set out to build and stay true to yourself.

## Quote Du Jour

> *"Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value." 
 *‚Äî Albert Einstein

title: Why and How we SubDAO
body:
This article presents the conclusions of a research project between RnDAO and Sobol. In this research, we attempt to define groups within DAOs- what we call DAO Units. We also explore the definitions used by members of a range of popular DAOs, determine their motivations and approaches in creating DAO Units, and identify a series of common challenges when setting up and operating different kinds of DAO Units.

[RnDAO](https://intelligent-glove-386.notion.site/5-minute-Summary-on-RnDAO-30902d80eff044a08fd659dea63f257b) is an innovation center funded by DAOs to serve DAOs, with a mission to empower humane collaboration. We help projects deeply understand DAOs and user challenges, so they can build tools that make decentralization fluid and natural, thus facilitating mainstream DAO adoption.

[Sobol](https://sobol.io/) is a collaboration platform for autonomous and decentralized teams. Sobol‚Äôs mission is to accelerate the transition to decentralized and humanistic work by making it easier to operate effectively as a DAO.

We formed this partnership to understand the context of DAO Units, prioritise problems that block success for DAO Units, and help the DAO tooling ecosystem become more strategic.

We formed this partnership to understand the context of DAO Units, prioritise problems that block success for DAO Units, and help the DAO tooling ecosystem become more strategic.

# TERMINOLOGY

Throughout our work, we define ‚ÄúDAO Units‚Äù as any time a DAO forms a smaller group of contributors within the DAO, with a distinct purpose and independence to act.¬† We heard so many different terms and definitions from our participants, and felt like ‚ÄúSubDAO‚Äù implied something quite specific. Think of DAO Units as a large and diverse family, with distinct variations within.

# METHODOLOGY

The team interviewed 15 diverse people contributing to 14 different DAOs. Each interview started as a casual conversation about the DAO and the individual's role in the DAO. The interviewers encouraged the DAO members to share stories about DAO Units such as 'The first DAO Unit the DAO created, how it went, what blew up, what was hard and why.' The interviewers then unpacked the root causes of why there were challenges within the DAO Unit. Finally, the participants answered a quantitative survey on DAO Units covering insights, commonalities, and common challenges.

We used this kind of in-depth qualitative research because we wanted to get beyond counting and opinions. If our goal is to invent and design tools that solve the biggest problems facing DAOs, then we need to understand the subtle details about how these problems appear. We also need to understand what motivates DAOs to create DAO Units. We use this research to create a base of insights. We recommend following  our research with quantitative methods (to understand frequency in the market) and light empirical methods (to test whether the insights are true).

# Why do DAOs create DAO Units?

We asked DAO Unit members and leaders about the core reason for the DAO Units' existence, and the pain points the DAO Units are trying to solve. We arrived at the following reasons:

1. DAOs create DAO Units **to** **drive action**. Rather than involving the entire DAO in every decision and action, DAOs form smaller DAO Units to drive decentralization. DAO participants believe that:
   1. Smaller groups are better at collaborating and getting things done.
   2. DAO Units bring better accountability. Clear division of work and goals can be established and tracked with smaller DAO Units. Smaller DAO Units also reduce the contributors' information burden and let the individual DAO Units focus on specific goals and, in turn, give a better sense of commitment.
   3. The DAO cannot make all decisions with proposals and vote structures; some decisions may not even need everyone's opinion. Operational decisions, routine work, or tasks that do not impact the entire DAO and its treasury, but need to be done to keep the DAO running, do not typically go for a vote or governance proposal.
2. DAOs create DAO Units **to be decisive**. Voting and governance processes take a minimum of 3 days or more from proposal to execution. Involving the entire DAO in every decision slows decision-making and creates information overload. The DAOs expect the DAO Units to help in:
   1. Deciding where to **invest available funds**. Deploying large treasuries requires time and attention that DAO Units can provide.
   2. Focusing **attention on a specific domain**.  The DAO may decide on macro objectives, but leave the decisions on execution to smaller DAO Units. This may involve multiple, smaller decisions to be taken. Sometimes DAOs create DAO Units to **introduce checks and balances**. Certain DAO Units can quickly flag or veto decisions taken by the main DAO or other DAO Units. For example, Decentraland DAO has a Security Advisory Board of solidity experts with a 3 / 5 multi-sig. This board can pause, cancel or resume any action taken by the DAO.
3. DAOs create DAO Units **to support broader contribution and decentralization**. By organizing as DAO Units, DAO participants aim to:
   1. Enable more contributors to take responsibility in an official capacity and gain a sense of ownership as a result.
   2. Make it more comfortable for people to join
4. And finally, a few DAOs also create **DAO Units for risk management.**
   1. Avoid exposing the primary token to riskier activities (e.g. DeFi)
   2. Facilitate bridging to other DAOs

# Common Types of DAO Units in DAOs:

When asked what constitutes a DAO Unit, each participant had clear boundaries to define DAO Units, but the criteria varied. Some use it to mean any group or organized DAO Unit within the DAO. Others made a sharp distinction between normal DAO Units and ‚Äútrue‚Äù subDAOs, which might have a treasury of its own, or its own method of funding, or (occasionally) its own token.

In synthesising the stories from participants, we found the following four archetypes of DAO Units:

### Departments

Functional groups where people can independently carry out work- usually a single discipline or practice. Ex: DevOps, Tech support, Marketing. These are also called Guilds in some DAOs. The structure here is similar to typical organizations in that each DAO Unit may have a lead or steward with significant influence. The leads and stewards typically have delegated voting powers meaning other DAO participants' delegate' their votes to stewards who vote on proposals. Departments typically propose a budget to the main DAO every quarter, move funds out of the treasury after the bid is voted on, and subsequently use the funds to pay the contributors, bounties, and other activities without further approvals. Departments are also typically meant to exist long-term. An interesting variation on a department is the VitaDAO Special Purpose Vehicle for collaborating with institutions such as pharma companies and funds. This group has dedicated tokens reserved for voting, which empowers it to make independent decisions.  But it will have ongoing work to support every collaboration opportunity.

### Projects

Multi-disciplinarian teams organized for a specific goal. This can also comprise members from multiple DAOs, so support cross-DAO collaboration. The team is typically dissolved after the project is accomplished or aborted. Projects are usually initiated by a Project leader in a DAO governance proposal with a set budget. Examples of typical projects are launching a new product, figuring out a new process for the DAO, or creating a media initiative.  Project teams are also called pods or Raids.

### Ventures

These are highly autonomous DAO Units that might eventually generate their own revenue. Ventures often have one or more of the following:

* a treasury solely dedicated to the DAO Unit
* dedicated, independent team
* their own token
* a separate governance model

Ventures are the rarest form of a DAO Unit, partly because most DAOs struggle to allow a project that began by supporting the DAO to then change their purpose and serve other 'clients' too.

Examples of Venture Units are CowSwap, a Gnosis DAO product-based venture spin-off, and Bankless Consulting, a service-based Venture DAO Unit.

### Committees

A DAO Unit that approves or audits projects (we found one DAO with a DAO Unit to find dead accounts). Committees are not defined by their discipline (i.e. not composed exclusively of marketing people, or exclusively of finance, or HR), but instead frequently solve alignment conflicts between different departments. Often DAO leaders or stewards who have governance control form a committee.

An example within CityDAO was their mission guild. This was setup to ensure that the decisions being taken were aligned with the mission, and to prevent ‚Äòwhales‚Äô from influencing unfavourable outcomes. As such, the committee had¬† veto authority. As the governance process has evolved, this DAO Unit is now being dismantled.

## Quantitative survey on DAO Units

![Describe your DAO Unit](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dVpLsJm2bDl1YnaExcGV3.png?height=635&width=988)

## Where DAO Units come from

1. Bottom up: Group of people identify the need for a dedicated DAO Unit and raise a proposal. For example, the marketing team may propose a meme guild to onboard creative contributors or to¬† build fun collaborations with other DAOs.
2. Top down: A DAO leader or founder may propose the formation of a new team in the governance forum. For example, the founder of GitcoinDAO proposed the formation of a Data Science practice.

## The best DAO Units

We asked the DAO participants ‚ÄúWhat makes a happy DAO Unit?‚Äù and ‚ÄúTell us about the best DAO Units you have seen‚Äù. We then dug deeper into what it takes to build a successful DAO Unit. The answers varied by the type of DAO Units.

Departments worked best when given very clear tasks: where it was simple to evaluate work, and contributing was open and easy.¬† Bountying tasks was the common way to bring in engaged contributors. The success of departments relied on a core team or an established process to decompose and define an ongoing pipeline of work.

In Project DAO Units, DAO participants prefer having one leader who decides who can join the team, and often centralizes the decisions. This could be because of the complex nature of the projects as well as the compulsion to deliver on clear objectives in a limited time (and lack of training in other methodologies).

Finally, we found that successful Venture DAO Units tended to be those that had clearly agreed on asset ownership and shared benefits from formation.

## Conclusion

In this section, we gathered insights from DAO participants and defined the ‚ÄòWhy‚Äô, ‚ÄòWhat‚Äô and ‚ÄòHow‚Äô of DAO Units. DAO Units are smaller groups created in DAOs to drive action, to speed up decision-making, introduce checks and balances, facilitate broader contribution, or mitigate risks. Broadly, we identified 4 types of DAO Units in the order of their frequency- Departments (a.k.a guilds), Projects, Ventures and Committees. These DAO Units are formed through proposals in the main DAOs, initiated by a small group in the DAO, or by the DAO founders/leaders.

We observed that¬† DAOs are taking a top-down approach to decentralization. While broader decisions are done through governance proposals, DAO Units have many of the same hierarchical structures that appear in traditional corporations. One key difference between the structures of DAO Units and corporations is transparency and permissionless access. The DAO Units are, however, answerable to a larger decentralized structure.

In the following articles, we will delve into the biggest challenges within DAO Units. We also separately gathered perspectives of DAO Unit leaders and DAO Unit members and synthesized these perspectives to suss out the root cause of challenges of DAO Unit leaders and members.

**For more research and Web3 insights, follow us on Twitter:** 
 [@RnDAO__](https://twitter.com/rndao__)
[@TeamSobol](https://twitter.com/TeamSobol)

title: npm packages for creator smart contracts
body:
Today we help standardize the metadata for music NFTs. Catalog is a dope music NFT company that released a music metadata standard. Today, we‚Äôll extend that standard by putting 100% of the metadata on-chain as a Base64 encoded JSON string. I will teach you how to publish public NPM packages for your solidity smart contracts. The principles I‚Äôll be following here:

1. üëÅ üíõ üíø - built with creators in mind.  
2. 100% open-source code.
3. MIT license - cc0 technology.

I made a goal to publish a package for music NFT metadata (on-chain).

[https://twitter.com/sweetman_eth/status/1552786690149961728?s=20&t=8v_MRPBJtOYYo3DOirItnQ](https://twitter.com/sweetman_eth/status/1552786690149961728?s=20&t=8v_MRPBJtOYYo3DOirItnQ)

Here‚Äôs the steps I followed:

1. create Github [repo](https://github.com/SweetmanTech/Onchain-Music-Metadata).
2. `npm init`.
3. `npm login`.
4. `npm publish`.
5. Import the package into your new music NFTs. ü•≥

## Create Github Repo

To create a Github repo head over to your repositories on Github and create a new repository.

![Creating a new repository in Github](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6IuI-vhHQzWkOB1T7FsJi.png?height=1724&width=2880)

Some details I like to include in my repos:

* MIT license - cc0 philosophy. Anyone can use this code.
* Public - cc0 philosophy. Anyone can clone this code.

Once your Github repo is created, open a terminal and clone your project locally with

```
git clone <your-repo-url>
```

![cloning your github repository](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CjHSdkpO8mJmXB-b2I1Ya.gif?height=708&width=1394)

## npm init

Now that we‚Äôve created our [Github repo](https://github.com/SweetmanTech/Onchain-Music-Metadata) let‚Äôs initialize the npm package. This is the first time I‚Äôve ever initialized an npm package so forgiv me if these instructions are unclear: I‚Äôm still learning myself.

I‚Äôm going to use hardhat as the base deployment method for this project so I‚Äôll set up the base contracts structure with `npx hardhat init`.

![npx hardhat init](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RH-7XkxLqy0Ze9GNfvfD7.gif?height=708&width=1394)

After setting up my base contract to be included in my NPM package (`contracts/)nChainMusicMetadata.sol`) I initialize the npm package with

```
npm init
```

![npm init](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LM4k9nsfUQwCExeCmWiZY.png?height=1746&width=2880)

## Publish the NPM Package

It‚Äôs typically recommended to test your packages before deploying but my goal is to ship this as fast as possible & iterate with tests later.

1. `npm login` - logs you in to the NPM package management system.
2. `npm publish --access=public` - publishes your package publicly for others to use.

![npm login](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/N1nYc67Tx3tY01nmHWomH.png?height=548&width=2450)

running `npm publish --access=public` published my npm package successfully! 

You can view the NPM package I published [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/onchain-music-metadata).

![my first public npm package](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/EHD_9Eo-CN_He8GwRQpWa.png?height=316&width=882)

## Import your Package

Now I want to test to make sure the package works. To test, I‚Äôll spin up a separate hardhat repo (following the steps I listed in the ‚Äúnpm init‚Äù section). Once I create the new repo, I‚Äôll try installing the package I just created with

```
npm i onchain-music-metadata
```

 
 Here‚Äôs how it looks to inherit my OnChain Music Metadata contract:

* `contract MyMusic is OnChainMusicMetadata`

![the MyMusic contract now has OnChainMusicMetadata](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/C7tuvYJt1t44sdKzBDRfv.png?height=492&width=1606)

## Support

I am an independent smart contract engineer. I have a few different options for you to support me as a creator:

* 0.0001 ETH - This article is an NFT. It would really help if you collected this NFT to support my writing of future articles. ‚úèÔ∏è
* Free - follow me on Twitter [here](https://twitter.com/sweetman_eth). üí¨
* Free - share this article to help propagate the meme. ü¶†
* more coming soon. üåõ

```

```

Here‚Äôs how it looks to inherit my OnChain Music Metadata contract:

* `contract MyMusic is OnChainMusicMetadata`

![the MyMusic contract now has OnChainMusicMetadata](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/C7tuvYJt1t44sdKzBDRfv.png?height=492&width=1606)

## Support

I am an independent smart contract engineer. I have a few different options for you to support me as a creator:

title: Â¶Ç‰ΩïÈôç‰ΩéFTXÊâãÁª≠Ë¥π
body:
1„ÄÅFTXÊâãÁª≠Ë¥πÊúâÂ§öÂ∞ë

FTXÊòØÁõÆÂâçÂ¢ûÈïøÈùûÂ∏∏ËøÖÈÄü„ÄÅÂêàÁ∫¶Áé©ÂÆ∂ËæÉÂ§öÁöÑ‰∫§ÊòìÊâÄÔºå‰Ω†Ë¶ÅÊòØÁé©ÂêàÁ∫¶‰∏ÄÂÆöË¶ÅÊ≥®ÂÜåFTX„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫Âπ∂‰∏çÁÜüÊÇâFTXÔºåËøô‰ºöÁªô‰ΩøÁî®Â∏¶Êù•‰∏ç‰æø„ÄÇÊØîÂ¶ÇÔºåÂú®FTX‰∏ä‰∫§ÊòìÊòØÈúÄË¶Å‰∫§ÊâãÁª≠Ë¥πÁöÑ„ÄÇ

ËôΩÁÑ∂ÊâãÁª≠Ë¥πÂæà‰æøÂÆúÔºåÁúãËµ∑Êù•ÂèØ‰ª•ÂøΩÁï•‰∏çËÆ°Ôºå‰ΩÜÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∫§ÊòìÈ¢ëÁπÅ„ÄÅ‰∫§ÊòìÊó∂Èó¥ÈïøÔºåÁßØÂ∞ëÊàêÂ§öÔºåÊâãÁª≠Ë¥πÊîØÂá∫‰∏ÄÂπ¥ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöË∂ÖËøá10000 UÔºåËøôÂ∞±ÈùûÂ∏∏Â§ö‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

title: Own the keys, own your data
body:
![You own the keys1](https://akord.com/media/you_own_the_keys1.png)

With Akord, you own the keys that encrypt and decrypt your data. Your keys are generated when you sign up and are represented by your backup phrase. In this article article, we'll explain the backup phrase, how we store and manage it, and demonstrate exactly how you 'own the keys'.

## Your backup phrase explained

For many web3 services, the backup phrase is required any time you would like to access your wallet from a new device. Let's first explain what the backup phrase is.

In order to generate unique keys, we need a unique random number that is known as a ‚Äúseed‚Äù. Since it is difficult for us to read a large number, crypto-wallets use a backup phrase, which is a human-readable representation of the seed. It is also known by other names such as seed phrase, recovery phrase, mnemonic, or passphrase.

The backup phrase is typically generated using an algorithm called [BIP39](https://privacypros.io/wallets/mnemonic-phrase) and assigned to a user when signing up. Akord uses this method to generate the backup phrase. It consists of 12 or 24 words that are chosen from a list of [2,048 words](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/english.txt) beginning with ‚Äúabandon‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúzoo‚Äù.

How safe is a backup phrase that is made up of 12 words? Well, since there are plenty of possible combinations, the chance of drawing the right combination is 1 out of the big number below:

2,048^12 = 5444517870735015415413993718908291383296 ‚âà 5.4445179e+39

So, as you can see, backup phrase is pretty much impossible to hack from a brute force attack that tries to guess what your backup phrase is. You just need to store it in a safe place.

We recommend the following security practices:

* Store your backup phrase in a few different secure locations offline.
* Don‚Äôt communicate your backup phrase to anyone.
* Don‚Äôt store your backup phrase unencrypted digitally.

## You own the backup phrase on Akord

In Akord, we ask for an email address and password. We ask for your email so we can send you important notifications when other people in your vault take actions. Your password is used to decrypt your backup phrase locally when you want to sign in.

The backup phrase is encrypted using your actual password. This means that nobody can decrypt your backup phrase without knowing your password.

We store the following three things in our database:

1. E-mail address
2. Encrypted backup phrase
3. Verifier of the password

We do not store your password, but rather a cryptographic verifier of it. This means that we can easily check if a password you entered is correct without ever seeing the password itself. For those who are curious about how this works in detail, you can read about this process in the [Secure Remote Password protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Remote_Password_protocol) (SRP).

![Diagam](https://akord.com/media/diagam.png)

So here‚Äôs the process when you sign up with your email address and password. First, we encrypt your backup phrase with the password you entered, or more precisely, with a key derived from your password using [PBKDF2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PBKDF2). Then, we use the SRP protocol, to compute a cryptographic verifier: We send these two pieces of information along with your email address to our server. This makes it impossible for any middleman, or for anyone with access to the data, including Akord, to decrypt your backup phrase or obtain any information about your password.

## Akord‚Äôs simple sign in

Most web3 services require you to connect with a wallet, but with Akord you just need your email and password. So how exactly are you using your keys to sign in?

When you sign in, we first look up your email address and use the SRP protocol to make sure that the password you provided is correct, again, without actually sending the password. If the provided email and password are correct, we send back the encrypted backup phrase. It is decrypted directly in your browser, meaning that nobody but you ever knows it.

At this point, you're ready to use our user-friendly UI to upload your files to Arweave, with all encryption and decryption happening directly in your browser.

‚Äì‚Äì

*We believe in true collaboration with the people using our product. If you have feedback on Akord, the best place to reach us is by becoming part of our community on [Discord](https://discord.gg/g4VXfauK5s).*

title: How to reduce FTX fees
body:
1\. How much is FTX handling fee

FTX is a very fast growing exchange with a lot of contract players. If you want to play contracts, you must sign up for FTX. However, many people are not familiar with FTX, which makes it difficult to use. Trading on FTX, for example, requires a fee.

While the fees are cheap and seem negligible, if the transactions are frequent and long, the fees can add up to more than 10,000 U a year, which is a lot.

FTX uses tiered rates for perpetual and quarterly contracts and spot transactions (including leveraged token spot transactions). Different levels of rates have their respective trading volume requirements.

The chart below shows FTX fee rates. We must pay attention to fee expenses. I have eight years of trading experience, and the following is to share the method to reduce the fee of OFTX.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/EHrX09p-yaasUpzdi4qMY.png?height=262&width=1102)

2\.To sign up for FTX, be sure to use the invite link

FTX offers a fee discount for users who sign up through an invitation link. If you sign up for FTX, you can save 5%. For example, if you sign up for 1U per transaction, you can save 0.05U per transaction. If you sign up for 100 transactions, you can save 5U

To reduce FTX transaction fees, be sure to sign up using the invitation link below.

If you already have an FTX account, you can also reduce the fee. You can find other friends and relatives with the above link to register the trading account for trading;

<https://ftx.com/referrals#a=121031692>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rfyLOLaxGnkOK05qxPzFd.png?height=932&width=497)

3\.How to reduce OKX fees OKX is a professional digital currency trading platform favored by many users, and its transaction fee can be reduced. According to the volume of transactions, Ouyi will be divided into ordinary users and professional users of two levels. Ordinary users are classified according to OKB positions, while professional users are classified according to trading volume and asset volume. The different levels determine the transaction fee for the next trading day. If the transaction volume of coins, the total transaction volume of delivery and perpetuity contracts (USDT delivery contract, currency standard delivery contract, USDT perpetuity contract, and currency standard perpetuity contract), the transaction volume of option contracts, and the amount of assets meet the conditions of different service fee levels, the user will enjoy the highest service fee discount. Method 1: OKX's official maximum savings rate is 20%. Use the link below to sign up for OKX and save 20%. <https://www.ouyi.business/join/BTC1ETH>
The second method: open the official website of OKX, enter "BTC1ETH" in the "invitation code" on the registration page, and you can see the rebate ratio at the bottom: 20%
Be sure to enter the invitation code or you won't get 20% of your cash back.

4\.Reduce Binance processing fees Binance is the largest digital currency exchange in the world. If you want to trade money, you must register with Binance. Binance also pays a transaction fee for each successful transaction. The transaction fee will be deducted from the assets received. For example, if you buy ether /USDT, the processing fee is paid in ether. If you sell Ether /USDT, the processing fee is paid in USDT. Such as: You placed an order for 10 Ether tokens at a price of 3,452.55USDT per share: Transaction fee =10 Ether \*0.1%=0.01 ether Or you can place an order to sell 10 Ether tokens at 3,452.55USDT per share: Transaction fee = (10 Ether \*3,452.55USDT) \*0.1%=34.5255USDT What many people don't know is that Binance's transaction fees can also be reduced. To reduce Binance transaction fees, be sure to use the invitation link below or sign up with the invitation code "Q022W7SC". <https://accounts.binance.com/en/register?ref=Q022W7SC>

5\.The trading road is long. Move forward together Want to learn more about how to reduce OKX fees? Add telegramÔºö btcethcool We specially set up a community to study trading and gold, add Telegram friends to pull you into the community.
